A man staggers into an emergency room with two black eyes and a five iron wrapped tightly around his throat. Naturally the doctor asks him what happened.

\n

"Well
column2: it was like this
column3: said the man, I was having a quiet round of golf with my wife when she sliced her ball into a pasture of cows. We went to look for it and while I was rooting around
column4: I noticed one of the cows had something white at its rear end. I walked over and lifted up the tail and sure enough
column5:
there was my wife''s golf ball--stuck right in the middle of the cow''s butt. That''s when I made my mistake."

\n

"What did you do?" asks the doctor.

\n

"Well
column6: I lifted the tail and yelled to my wife
column7: ''Hey
column8: this looks like yours!''"

column1: According to today''s regulators and bureaucrats
column2: those of us who were kids in the 60''s
column3: 70''s and early 80''s probably shouldn''t have survived
column4:
because our baby cots were covered with brightly coloured lead-based paint which was promptly chewed and licked.

\n

We had no childproof lids on medicine bottles
column5:
or latches on doors or cabinets and it was fine to play with pans.

\n

When we rode our bikes
column6: we wore no helmets
column7:
just flip flops and fluorescent ''spokey dokey''s on our wheels.√î√∏Œ©

\n

As children
column8: we would ride in cars with no seat belts or airbags
column9:
riding in the passenger seat was a treat.

\n

We drank water from the garden hose and not from bottles and it tasted the same.

\n

We ate chips
column10: bread and butter pudding and drank fizzy pop with sugar in it
column11:
but we were never overweight because we were always outside playing.

\n

We shared one drink with four friends
column12:
from one bottle or can and no-one actually died from this.

\n

We would spend hours building go-carts out of scraps and then went top speed down the hill
column13:
only to find out we forgot the brakes.

\n

After running into stinging nettles a few times
column14:
we learned to solve the problem.

\n

We would leave home in the morning and could play all day
column15:
as long as we were back before it got dark. No one was able to reach us and no one minded.

\n

We did not have Play stations or X-Boxes
column16: no video games at all. No 99 channels on TV
column17: no videotape movies
column18: no surround sound
column19: no mobile phones
column20: no personal computers
column21:
and no Internet chat rooms. We had friends we went outside and found them.

\n

We played elastics and street rounders
column22:
and sometimes that ball really hurt.

\n

We fell out of trees
column23:
got cut and broke bones but there were no law suits.

We had full on fist fights but no prosecution followed from other parents.

We played knock-and-run and were actually afraid of the owners catching us.

We walked to friend''s homes.

We also
column24: believe it or not
column25: WALKED to school; we didn''t rely on mummy or daddy to drive us to school
column26:
which was just round the corner.

We made up games with sticks and tennis balls.

We rode bikes in packs of 7 and wore our coats by only the hood.

The idea of a parent bailing us out if we broke a law unheard of. They actually sided with the law.

This generation has produced some of the best risk-takers and problem solvers and inventors
column27:
ever.

\n

The past 50 years have been an explosion of innovation and new ideas.

\n

We had freedom
column28: failure
column29: success and responsibility
column30:
and we learned how to deal with it all.

\n

And you''re one of them. Congratulations!

\n

Pass this on to others who have had the luck to grow as real kids
column31: before lawyers and government regulated our lives
column32:
for our own good.

\n

For those of you who aren''t old enough thought you might like to read about us.

\n

This my friends
column33:
is surprisingly frightening......and it might put a smile on your face: The majority of students in universities today were born in 1983........They are called youth.

\n

They have never heard of "We are the World
column34: We are the children"
column35: and the "Uptown Girl"
column36:
they know is by Westlife not Billy Joel.

\n

They have never heard of Rick Astley
column37: Bananarama
column38:
Nena or Belinda√î√∏Œ© Carlisle.

\n

For them
column39:
there has always been only one Germany and one Vietnam.

AIDS has existed since they were born.

CD''s have existed since they were born.

Michael Jackson has always been white.

To them John Travolta has always been round in shape and they can''t imagine how this fat guy could be a god of dance.

They believe that Charlie''s Angels and Mission Impossible are Films from last year.

They can never imagine life before computers.

They''ll never have pretended to be the A Team
column40:
Red Hand Gang or the Famous Five.

They can''t believe a black and white television ever existed and don''t even know how to switch on a TV without a remote control.

And they will never understand how we could leave he house without a mobile phone.

Now let''s check if we''re getting old...

1. You understand what was written above and you smile.

2. You need to sleep more
column41: usually until the afternoon
column42:
after a night out.

3. Your friends are getting married/already married.

4. You are always surprised to see small children playing comfortably with computers.

5. When you see teenagers with mobile phones
column43:
you shake your head.

\n

6. You meet your friends from time to time
column44: talking about the good old days
column45:
repeating again all the funny you have experienced together.

\n

7. Having read this mail
column46:
you are thinking of forwarding it to some other friends because you think they will like it too...

\n

Yes
column47:
you''re getting older!!!!

\n

The recreational director of a mental hospital wanted to take a well
behaved group of inmates to a baseball game. The General Manager of
the club was a little leery of this. When the Recreational Director
said: "If I prove to you how well behaved they are
column2:
will you let
them in?" The General Director agreed.

\n

The group of inmates came in and sat down. The Recreational Director
shouted: "Stand up
column3: nuts!" Everyone stood up. "Sit down
column4:
nuts!"
Everyone sat down. "Look behind you
column5:
nuts!" Everyone turned around.

\n

Pleased with that
column6:
the General Manager let them in. About the third
inning or so
column7:
he heard a tremendous commotion! People were running
helter skelter. He asked what happened and was told that someone had
called out: "Peanuts!"

column1:
A local bakery decided to hire a part-time counter person and
ended up with a local co-ed who could work evenings and weekends.

\n

She had one eccentric characteristic (which was unknown when she was hired)
she wore short skirts and no underwear. Needless to say she was a real beauty and
had a figure to die for.

\n

The bakery has a small storefront so it was necessary to
have the various products on shelves and then use a ladder to reach the uppermost
items. The item that had previously been least popular but was fast becoming the most
popular with gentlemen in particular was rasin bread
column2:
which was kept on the
uppermost shelf.

\n

One day an elderly gentleman came in and ordered a loaf of bread. The young lady without
thinking scurried up the ladder and then realized she had not asked the
gentleman what kind of bread he had wanted so she nodded and
asked
column3:
"Raisin?"

\n

"No
column4: he replied but it is beginning to twitch just a little."

column1: A woman decided to have a face lift for her birthday. She spent $5000 and felt really good about the result. On her way home she stopped at a dress shop to look around. As she was leaving
column2: she said to the sales clerk
column3: "I hope you don''t mind me asking
column4: but how old do you think I am?" "About 35
column5:
was the reply.
I''m actually 47
column6:
the woman said, feeling really happy.

\n

After that she went into McDonalds for lunch, and asked the order taker the same question, to which the reply was, Oh you look about 29?"
"I am actually 47." That made her feel really good.

\n

While standing at the bus stop she asked an old man the same question.
He replied
column7:
"I am 85 years old and my eyesight is going. But when I was young there was a sure way of telling a woman''s age. If I put my hand up your skirt I will be able to tell your exact age."

\n

As there was no one around
column8: the woman thought
column9: "What the hell"
column10: and let him slip his hand up her skirt. After feeling around for a while
column11: the old man said
column12: "Ok
column13:
You are 47."

\n

Stunned the woman said
column14:
"That was brilliant! How did you do that?"

\n

The old man replied
column15: "I was behind you in line at McDonalds!"

column2:

column3:

other side
column4:
safe and sound.

\n

column5:

directly toward the same water hazard. It landed right in the
center of the pond and kind of hovered over the water. Jesus
casually walked out on the pond and chipped the ball onto the
green.

\n

pad

column1:
Life Lessons Learned At the Movies

* It is always possible to park directly outside any building you are visiting.

* A detective can only solve a case once he has been suspended from duty.

* If you decide to start dancing in the street
column2:
everyone you bump into will know all the steps.

* Most laptop computers are powerful enough to override the communication systems of any invading alien civilization.

* It does not matter if you are heavily outnumbered in a fight involving martial arts - your enemies will wait patiently to attack you one by one by dancing around in a threatening manner until you have knocked out their predecessors.

* When a person is knocked unconscious by a blow to the head
column3:
they will never suffer a concussion or brain damage.

\n

* No one involved in a car chase
column4: hijacking
column5: explosion
column6:
volcanic eruption or alien invasion will ever go into shock.

\n

* Police Departments give their officers personality tests to make sure they are deliberately assigned a partner who is their total opposite.

\n

* When they are alone
column7:
all foreigners prefer to speak English to each other.

\n

* You can always find a chain saw when you need one.

\n

* Any lock can be picked by a credit card or a paper clip in seconds
column8:
unless it''s the door to a burning building with a child trapped inside.

\n

* An electric fence
column9:
powerful enough to kill a dinosaur will cause no lasting damage to an eight-year-old child.

\n

* Television news bulletins usually contain a story that affects you personally at that precise moment you turn the television on.

What was Helen Keller''s favorite color?
Velcro.

Why didn''t Helen Keller scream when she fell down the stairs?
She was wearing gloves.

What was Helen Keller''s speech impediment?
Calluses.

How did Helen Keller''s teachers punish her for talking in class?
They made her wear mittens.

Why didn''t Helen Keller change her baby''s diaper?
So she could always find him.

Why did Helen Keller have yellow fingers?
From whispering sweet-nothings in her boyfriends ear.

How did Helen Keller go crazy?
Trying to read the stucco walls.

How did Helen Keller pick her eyes out?
She shouted hysterically.

Why did Helen Keller stop skydiving?
It was hell on the seeing eye dog!

What goes ("CLICK" is that it? "CLICK" is that it? "CLICK" is that it?)?
Hellen Keller working the rubix cube.

Seen Stevie Wonder''s new video?
He hasn''t either.

column1: Two little boys go into the grocery store. One is nine
column2: one is four. The nine year old grabs a box of tampons from the shelf and carries it to the register for check-out.The cashier asks "Oh
column3: these must be for your mom
column4: huh?"The nine year old replies "Nope
column5: not for my mom." Without thinking
column6: the cashier responded "Well
column7: they must be for your sister then?"The nine year old quipped
column8: "Nope
column9: not for my sister either."The cashier had now become curious "Oh. Not for your mom and not for your sister
column10: who are they for?"The nine year old says "They''re for my four year old little brother."The cashier is surprised "Your four year old little brother??"The nine year old explains: "Well yeah
column11: they say on TV if you wear one of these you can swim or ride a bike and my little brother can''t do either of them!"

column1: When you''re 47 years old
column2: you sometimes hear a small voice inside you that says: "Just because you''ve reached middle age
column3: that doesn''t mean you shouldn''t take on new challenges and seek new adventures. You get only one ride on this crazy carousel we call life
column4:
and by golly you should make the most of it."

\n

This is the voice of Satan.

\n

I know this because recently
column5: on a mountain in Idaho
column6: I listened to this voice
column7:
and as a result my body feels as though it has been used as a trampoline by the Budweiser Clydesdales.

I am currently on an all-painkiller diet. "I''ll have a black coffee and 250 Advil tablets" is a typical breakfast order for me these days.

This is because I went snowboarding.

For those of you who
column8: for whatever reason
column9: such as a will to live
column10: do not participate in downhill winter sports
column11:
I should explain that snowboarding is an activity that is popular with people who do not feel that regular skiing is lethal enough.

\n

These are of course young people
column12: fearless people
column13: people with 100 percent synthetic bodies who can hurtle down a mountainside at 50 miles per hour and knock down mature trees with their faces and then spring to their feet and go
column14:
"Cool."

\n

People like my son. He wanted to try snowboarding
column15: and I thought it would be good to learn with him
column16:
because we can no longer ski together.

\n

We have a fundamental difference in technique: He skis via the Downhill Method
column17: in which you ski down the hill; whereas I ski via the Breath-Catching Method
column18: in which you stand sideways on the hill
column19:
looking as athletic as possible without actually moving muscles (this could cause you to start sliding down the hill).

\n

If anybody asks if you''re OK
column20: you say
column21: "I''m just catching my breath!" in a tone of voice that suggests that at any moment you''re going to swoop rapidly down the slope; whereas in fact you''re planning to stay right where you are
column22: rigid as a statue
column23:
until the spring thaw.

\n

At night
column24: when the Downhillers have all gone home
column25: we Breath-Catchers will still be up there
column26: clinging to the mountainside
column27:
chewing on our parkas for sustenance.

\n

So I thought I''d take a stab at snowboarding
column28:
which is quite different from skiing.

\n

In skiing
column29: you wear a total of two skis
column30: or approximately one per foot
column31: so you can sort of maintain your balance by moving your feet
column32:
plus you have poles that you can stab people with if they make fun of you at close range.

\n

Whereas with snowboarding
column33: all you get is one board
column34: which is shaped like a giant tongue depressor and manufactured by the Institute of Extremely Slippery Things. Both of your feet are strapped firmly to this board
column35: so that if you start to fall
column36:
you can''t stick a foot out and catch yourself. You crash to the ground like a tree and lie there while skiers swoop past and deliberately spray snow on you.

\n

Skiers hate snowboarders. It''s a generational thing. Skiers are (and here I am generalizing) middle-aged Republicans wearing designer space suits; snowboarders are defiant young rebels wearing deliberately drab clothing that is baggy enough to cover the snowboarder plus a major appliance. Skiers like to glide down the slopes in a series of graceful arcs; snowboarders like to attack the mountain
column37: slashing
column38: spinning
column39: tumbling
column40: going backward
column41: blasting through snowdrifts
column42: leaping off cliffs
column43: getting their noses pierced in midair
column44:
etc.

\n

Skiers view snowboarders as a menace; snowboarders view skiers as Elmer Fudd.

\n

I took my snowboarding lesson in a small group led by a friend of mine named Brad Pearson
column45:
who also once talked me into jumping from a tall tree while attached only to a thin rope.

\n

Brad took us up on a slope that offered ideal snow conditions for the novice who''s going to fall a lot: Approximately seven flakes of powder on top of an 18-foot-thick base of reinforced concrete.

\n

You could not dent this snow with a jackhammer. (I later learned
column46: however
column47:
that you COULD dent it with the back of your head.)

We learned snowboarding via a two step method:

STEP ONE: Watching Brad do something.

STEP TWO: Trying to do it ourselves.

I was pretty good at Step One. The problem with Step Two was that you had to stand up on your snowboard
column48:
which turns out to be a violation of at least five important laws of physics.

\n

I''d struggle to my feet
column49: and I''d be wavering there and then the Physics Police would drop a huge chunk of gravity on me
column50: and WHAM my body would hit the concrete snow
column51:
sometimes bouncing as much as a foot.

\n

"Keep your knees bent!" Brad would yell
column52:
helpfully.

\n

Have you noticed that whatever sport you''re trying to learn
column53: some earnest person is always telling you to keep your knees bent? As if THAT would solve anything. I wanted to shout back
column54:
"FORGET MY KNEES! DO SOMETHING ABOUT THESE GRAVITY CHUNKS!"

\n

Needless to say my son had no trouble at all. None. In minutes he was cruising happily down the mountain; you could actually see his clothing getting baggier. I
column55: on the other hand
column56: spent most of my time lying on my back
column57: groaning
column58:
while space-suited Republicans swooped past and sprayed snow on me.

\n

If I hadn''t gotten out of there
column59:
they''d have completely covered me; I now realize that the small hills you see on ski slopes are formed around the bodies of 47-year-olds who tried to learn snowboarding.

\n

So I think
column60: when my body heals
column61: I''ll go back to skiing. Maybe sometime you''ll see me out on the slopes
column62: catching my breath. Please throw me some food.

column1: Good afternoon all. I''m Al Gore
column2:
and I''d like to tell you a
little about myself.

\n

I know a lot about hardship
column3:
because I came into this world as a
poor black child in a tiny town in the backwoods of Tennessee. I
was born in a log cabin that I built with my own hands. I taught
myself to read by candlelight and helped support my 16 brothers
and sisters by working summers as a deck hand on a Mississippi
River steamboat. Frequently we would stop the ship and I would
cut and split five cords of wood for fuel overnight for the
steam engines.

\n

My mother taught me the value of education
column4: so every day
column5:
I
would walk 5 miles to a one-room schoolhouse. I was a
mischievous
column6: fun loving scamp
column7:
though I never dreamed that one
day
column8:
my youthful escapades would serve as the inspiration for
"Huckleberry Finn."

\n

Back then
column9:
we Jewish black folks in the south were second-class
citizens. One day
column10: a traveling minister came through town
column11:
and I
asked him if anyone was ever going to do something to guarantee
civil rights for all Americans. Well
column12:
I guess I made an
impression. You see
column13: the minister''s name was Martin Luther King
column14:
Jr.

\n

My father was a United States Senator. He once perched me on his
knee and said
column15: "Son
column16: if you work hard and listen to your mama
column17: someday you can live in a hotel in Washington
column18: D.C.
column19:
and go to
an exclusive prep school." As a young Hindu boy
column20:
these were very
valuable lessons. But life of privilege was not for me.

\n

Being Chinese
column21: after getting my high school diploma
column22:
I took a
job in a hot
column23:
dirty textile mill. I was so appalled at the
treatment of the workers there that I organized a union. Later
column24: that experience inspired a movie - which is why
column25: to this day
column26:
my
close friends at the AFL-CIO call me "Norma Rae."

\n

When word got out what an 18 year old factory worker had done
column27:
Harvard University called and offered me a scholarship. I
captained the hockey team to four consecutive national
championships
column28:
but I also played football and was good enough to
win the Heisman Trophy.

\n

During my college years
column29:
I lived in a housing project and
moonlighted writing songs and playing lead guitar for a little
rock band. You may have heard of us - The Rolling Stones. I''m
the one with the lips.

\n

But there was a war going on
column30:
and I felt I had to serve my
country. So I enlisted in the U. S. Army and went to Vietnam. I
was deeply opposed to the war
column31:
but I did my duty as a soldier
and came back home with the Medal of Honor and the Croix de
Guerre. My battlefield expertise is current requisite reading
material for Officers Candidates to this very day. My being a
wounded female officer serving in disguise as a journalist was a
full time project
column32:
but my military knowledge helped save tens of
thousands of lives. Many cities in Southeast Asia are named
after me to this very day. Statues of me are still commonplace
in many official Government buildings in Viet Nam.

\n

When I got back
column33:
I took a long journey across this great land of
ours. I''ve crossed the deserts bare
column34: man
column35:
I''ve breathed the
mountain air
column36: man
column37: I''ve traveled
column38: I''ve done my share
column39: man
column40:
I''ve
been everywhere. I''ve hunted all the dangerous species of big
game in five continents using only a handmade spear or my
handmade laser sighted compound bow.

\n

And the people I met at truck stops and campgrounds and homeless
shelters on that journey all said the same thing: "Al
column41:
we need
you in Washington."

\n

I knew they were right
column42:
but first I had to take care of some
other business---building the World Trade Center
column43:
finding a low
cost
column44: more reliable nuclear weapon trigger design
column45:
founding the
Audubon Society
column46:
doing the clinical research that proved smoking
caused cancer
column47:
and coming up with the recipe for Mrs. Field''s
chocolate chip cookies. I was
column48: in fact
column49:
the third (still silent)
partner of Ben & Jerry with over half of the flavors personally
developed by Tipper and me in our own kitchen.

\n

My extensive knowledge of Arctic Sea life keeps me busy in the
research laboratory
column50:
but those endangered species need love too!
Translating the dead sea scrolls is one of my favorite hobbies
column51:
and my current volume is in print in over 73 languages and is
being studied in Seminaries worldwide. Being Indian
column52:
both Native
American and the Mid East kind
column53:
this is valuable experience for
me. Have towel and Tee Pee
column54:
will travel.

\n

Finally
column55:
I deferred to the demands of the people of Tennessee
and allowed them to elect me to the House of Representatives and
the Senate. And then one winter day nearly nine years ago
column56:
for
no particular reason
column57:
I answered the call of the people once
again and took the oath of office as Vice President of the
United States.

\n

I also invented the Internet. Since then
column58:
I''ve been part of the
most successful administration in American history. My friend
column59:
Bill Gates has asked me many times why I gave him the ideas of
software development and asked for no money. Gosh
column60:
it just
wouldn''t be right!

\n

Many times President Bill Clinton has been pondering some grave
decision and has asked me what to do. And when I would give him
my thoughts
column61: he would invariable say
column62:
"Of course. That''s
brilliant. Why didn''t I think of that?" During the darkest days
of the impeachment battles
column63:
the President told me he only wished
he had listened when I told him to stay away form that
dark-haired intern with the big hooters.

\n

So after I decided to run for president
column64:
I sat down with him and
asked if he had any suggestions about how to conduct my
campaign. And Bill Clinton gave me a few simple words of
advice-words I''ll never forget. He looked me in the eye and he
said
column65: "Al
column67:
it''s always worked well for me."

\n

Thanks
column68:
I''m Al Gore and I want to be your next President. You
can trust and believe me.

column1:
A young guy out on the town with his mates spies the girl of his dreams across the dance floor. Having admired her from afar he plucks up the courage to talk to her. Everything goes better than expected and she agrees to accompany him on a date the following Saturday evening.

\n

Saturday night arrives and the man arrives at her house laden with flowers and chocolates. To his amazement she answers the door in nothing but a towel.

\n

"I''m sorry
column2: she exclaims, I am running a bit late. Please come in and I''ll introduce you to my parents who will entertain you while I finish getting dressed. I should warn you however
column3:
that they are both deaf mutes."

\n

With this she ushers him into the living room
column4: introduces him to her parents and promptly disappears. As you can imagine this is a little uncomfortable as both parents are completely silent. Dad is sitting in his arm chair watching the soccer game
column5: and Mom is busy knitting. After about ten minutes of complete silence
column6: Mom suddenly jumps from her chair
column7:
pulls up her skirt pulls down her knickers and pours a glass of water over her arse.

\n

Just as suddenly Dad launches himself across the room bends her over the couch and takes her from behind. He then sits back down in his chair and places a match stick under each eye lid. The room is plunged back into eerie silence and the young man is shocked into disbelief. After a further ten minutes the mother again rises from her chair
column8: pulls up her skirt
column9:
pulls down her pants and throws another glass of water over her arse. Dad leaps up gives her one from behind and places two more match sticks under his eyelids. No sooner have they concluded this strange behaviour and the daughter returns fully dressed ready for their date.

\n

The evening is a complete disaster with the young man completely distracted by the goings on in the living room. At the end of the evening the girl asks
column10:
"What''s the matter? Have I done something wrong?"

\n

"It''s not you
column11:
replied her date, It''s just that the strangest thing happened while I was waiting for you and I am still a bit shocked."

\n

After pleading with him to explain in more detail the young man reluctantly recounts the story. ''Well
column12:
first your Mother jumps from her chair and lifts up her skirt. She then pulls down her pants and throws a glass of water over her behind."

\n

"I see
column13:
says the girl, What happened then?"

\n

"Well
column14:
if that isn''t enough your Father races from his chair leans Mom over the couch and does her from behind. He then sits back down and places a match stick under each eye lid.''

\n

"Oh
column15:
is that all?" replies the girl.

\n

The young man can''t believe the casual response to this weird practice. "It''s easily explained. Mom was simply saying
column16: ''Are you going to get this asshole a drink?'' and Dad was replying
column17: ''No
column18: fuck him. I''m watching the match.''"

column1:
There was a blond woman driving on the open highway when she looked out her window and noticed another blond sitting in the middle of a field rowing a boat.
The woman driving her car then yelled at the other blond
column2: "hey! Why are you rowing a boat with no water?" Then the blond with the boat said
column3: "What are you talking about?" The lady in the car replied
column4: "If I could swim
column5: i would come out there and give you a peice of my mind!"

column1: One day a blonde lady went to a local Florida Department Store to buy a pair of alligator shoes.  As she was looking at a very nice pair of shoes she noticed the very expensive price.  She didn''t have enough to pay for the shoes
column2: and she was outraged.  She marched right up to the counter and told the clerk exactly what she thought of him.She left very angrily
column3: but on her way out she made a comment to the clerk and in that comment she said
column4: With prices like these I should just go out buy me a gun and kill my own alligators. the clerk replied very sarcastically
column5: Good Luck!The clerk went on with his day not even thinking about the lady that came in early. As he was locking up to go home at the end of the day something caught his eye.  There in the swamp was the lady waist deep with a gun in her hand.  At that moment something else caught his eye
column6: off to the left about 25 yards away was an alligator swimming right towards her.The man started jumping up and down screaming at her trying to get her attention.  She turned seen the alligator took aim and shot.She drug it to shore where there was about eight other alligators laying dead on their backs.Then she flipped it over too and said
column7: damn this one is not wearing shoes either.

pond. The first duck answered

blow bubbles." So the fourth duck asked the second duck the same
questions. The response was
column3:
"My name is Freddy and I also like
to blow bubbles all the time in the pond." Then he asked the 3rd
duck the same question and the answer he heard was
column4: "Well
column5:
my
name is Bubbles."

column1:
One day Bill complained to his friend that his elbow really hurt. His friend
suggested that he go to a computer at the drug store that can diagnose anything
quicker and cheaper than a doctor.
''''Simply put in a sample of your urine and the computer will diagnose your
problem and tell you what you can do about it. It only costs $10." Bill figured
he had nothing to lose
column2:
so he filled a jar with a urine sample and went to the
drug store. Finding the computer
column3:
he poured in the sample and deposited the $10.
The computer started making some noise and various lights started flashing.
After a brief pause out popped a small slip of paper on which was printed: "You
have tennis elbow. Soak your arm in warm water. Avoid heavy lifting. It will be
better in two weeks."
Later that evening while thinking how amazing this new technology was and how
it would change medical science forever
column4:
he began to wonder if this machine
could be fooled. He mixed together some tap water
column5:
a stool sample from his dog
and urine samples from his wife and daughter. To top it off
column6:
he masturbated into
the concoction. He went back to the drug store
column7: located the machine
column8:
poured in
the sample and deposited the $10. The computer again made the usual noise and
printed out the following message:
"Your tap water is too hard. Get a water softener. Your dog has worms. Get him
vitamins. Your daughter is using cocaine. Put her in a rehabilitation clinic.
Your wife is pregnant with twin girls. They aren''t yours. Get a lawyer. And if
you don''t stop jerking off
column9: your tennis elbow will never get better."

column1:
Two college football players were taking an important final
exam. If they failed
column2:
they would be on academic probation and
not allowed to play in the Sugar Bowl the following week. The
exam was fill-in-the-blank. The last question read
column3:
"Old
MacDonald had a _________."

\n

Bubba was stumped. He had no idea of the answer. He knew he
needed to get this one right to be sure he passed. Making sure
the professor wasn''t watching
column4:
he tapped Tiny on the shoulder.

"Pssst. Tiny. What''s the answer to the last question?"

Tiny laughed. He looked around to make sure the professor hadn''t
noticed then he turned to Bubba.

"Bubba
column5:
you''re so stupid. Everyone knows Old MacDonald had a
farm."

\n

"Oh yeah
column6:
said Bubba. I remember now." He picked up his No. 2
pencil and started to write the answer in the blank. He stopped.

\n

Reaching to tap Tiny''s shoulder again
column7: he whispered
column8: "Tiny
column9:
how
do you spell farm?"

\n

"You are really dumb
column10:
Bubba. That''s so easy. Farm is spelled E
-I-E-I-O."

column1: A Frenchman
column2: an Englishman
column3: and a New Yorker were captured by cannibals. The chief comes to them and says
column4: "the bad news is that now that we''ve caught you
column5: we''re going to kill you. We will put you in a pot and cook you
column6: eat you
column7:
and then use your skins to build a canoe. The good news is that you get to choose how you die."

\n

The Frenchman says
column8: "I take ze sword." the chief gives him a sword
column9: he shouts
column10:
Vive la France! and runs himself through.

\n

The Englishman says
column11: "a pistol for me
column12: please." The chief gives him a pistol
column13: he points it at his head
column14: says
column15:
"God save the queen!" and pulls the trigger.

\n

The New Yorker says
column16: "gimme the fawkin'' fork." the chief is puzzled
column17: but he shrugs and gives him a fork. The new Yorker takes the fork and starts jabbing himself all over--the stomach
column18: the sides
column19: the chest
column20: everywhere. There''s blood gushing out all over
column21:
it''s horrible.

\n

The chief is appalled
column22: and asks
column23: "my God almighty
column24:
what are you doing?"

\n

The New Yorker says
column25: "so much for your canoe
column26: you stupid asshole!"

column3:

8> "Let''s mix things up a little. How about you grab *me*
column4:

\n

7> Prior to the exam
column5:
he connects a red light bulb to your nose "to tell me if I''m doing something wrong."

\n

6> He says that the best way to do your heart bypass surgery is to go through your stomach
column6: "you know
column7:
because of that saying."

\n

5> You somehow doubt all his hype about the growing field of "Xtreme Gynecology."

\n

4> This may be the only clinic your HMO covers
column8:
but you''re pretty sure what your doctor is doing isn''t the "reasonable and customary" way to perform an artificial insemination.

\n

3> Employs the services of his pets
column9: Fluffy and Rover
column10:
for your cat scan and lab work.

\n

2> You''re pretty sure the American Academy of Dermatology doesn''t really sponsor his Pimple Squeezin'' Olympics.

\n

column11: "I AM DR. CLEMENT OKON OF NIGERIA.  FIRST

column1:
It is Michigan week...here we go...

\n

A little boy and his mother were walking through a Michigan
cemetery when they came upon a headstone that read "Here lies a
Michigan graduate and an honest man." The little boy asked
column2: "Mommy
column3:
why did they bury 2 people in there?"

Coach Lloyd Carr is only dressing 10 players for the Michigan
game against Ohio State. The rest of the team will get dressed
by themselves.

Q: How do you get a Michigan cheerleader into your dorm room?
A: Grease her hips and push.

Q: Why is ice no longer available at Michigan football games?
A: The senior who knew the recipe graduated.

Q: What are the longest 3 years of a Michigan football player''s
life?
A: His freshman year.

Q: Why did Michigan replace the stadium grass with Astroturf?
A: To keep the cheerleaders from grazing during games.

Q: How do you get a Michigan graduate off your front porch?
A: Pay him for the pizza

Q: What does the average University of Michigan football player
get on his S.A.T.?
A: Drool.

Q: Why are there no Nativity scenes on the Michigan University
campus at Christmas?
A: Because they can''t find three wise men and a virgin.

fish up with the ball still in the fishes mouth. mouth. He flies
over the green and the fish drops the ball and it rolls into the
cup. Jesus turns to god and says
column2:
"You gonna play golf or you
gonna fuck around?"

column1: Mr. Jones gets a call from the hospital. They tell him his wife''s been in a terrible car accident. He rushes to the hospital
column2:
runs in to the ER and says his wife''s been in an accident.

\n

They tell him Dr. Smith is handling the case and they page the doctor.

\n

Doc comes out to the waiting room to see a terribly upset Mr. Jones.
"Mr. Jones?" the doctor asks.
"Yes sir
column3:
what''s happened? How is my wife?"

\n

The doctor sits next to him and says
column4:
"Not good news. Your wife''s accident resulted in two fractures of her spine."
"Oh my God" says Mr. Jones
column5:
"what will be her prognosis?"

\n

"Well
column6: Mr. Jones
column7: her vital signs are stable. However
column8:
her spine is inoperable. She''ll have no motor skills or capability. This means you will have to feed her."
Mr. Jones begins to sob.

\n

"And you''ll have to turn her in her bed every two hours to prevent pneumonia."
Mr. Jones begins to wail and cry loudly.

\n

"Then

column6: John says

column9: I do

column1:
One hot summer afternoon a woman is at the local public swimming
pool when she notices a man smoking a cigarette underwater.

She is astounded that such a thing can be so she asks him how he
does it.

"It''s easy." He said. "I just use a condom."

"Where can I get them?" The woman asked.

"Just go into any drugstore and ask for them." The man tells her.

The next day she goes into her local drugstore and asks the
clerk for a condom.

"Any particular kind?" He asks.

"Yes
column2: she replied. One that will fit a camel."

column1: Two friends had arranged a round of golf and were now on the first tee
column2:
preparing to start their game at 7 a.m. Just as the first was half way up his
backswing
column3:
a good looking young lady ran across the course about 10 yards in
front of him
column4:
peeling off her clothes as she went until she was totally naked.
As she disappeared into the woods he turned
column5: dazed
column6: to his companion
column7:
"What was
that about?!!!"

\n

"Take no notice. Just get on with the game
column8:
replied the other.

\n

Settling down and lining up for his drive, the first golfer then noticed four
men in white coats running across the course on a similar track to the young
lady. What......?!?"

"Look. Just get on with the game

the second says with a chuckle.

"He''s the guy who caught her the last time. That''s his handicap."

column1: A friend just got back from a holiday ski trip to Utah with the kind of story that warms the cockles of anybody''s heart. Conditions were perfect
column2: 12 below
column3: no feeling in the toes
column4:
basic numbness all over. The "Tell me when we''re having fun" kind of day.

\n

One of the women in the group complained to her husband that she was in dire need of a restroom. He told her not to worry
column5: that he was sure there was relief at the top of the lift in the form of a powder room for female skiers in distress. He was wrong
column6: of course
column7:
and the pain did not go away.

\n

If you''ve ever had nature hit its panic button in you
column8: then you know That a temperature of 12 below zero doesn''t help matters. So with time running out
column9:
she weighed her options.

\n

Her husband
column10: picking up on the intensity of the pain
column11: suggested that since she was wearing an all white ski outfit
column12: she should go off in the woods. No one would ever notice
column13: he assured her. The white will provide more than adequate camouflage. So she headed for the tree line
column14: began disrobing and proceeded to do her thing. If you''ve ever parked on the side of a slope
column15: then you know there is a right way and a wrong way to set your skies so you don''t move. Yup
column16:
you got it. She had the skies positioned the wrong way.

\n

Steep slopes are not forgiving
column17: even during embarrassing moments. Without any warning
column18: the woman found herself skiing backward
column19: out of control racing through the trees
column20: somehow missing all of them
column21: and on to the slope. Her derriere and the reverse side were still bare
column22: her pants down around her knees
column23: and she was picking up speed all the while she continued on backwards
column24: totally out-of-control
column25:
creating an unusual sight for the other skiers.

\n

The woman skied
column26: if you define that verb loosely
column27: back under the lift
column28: and finally collided violently with a pylon. The bad news was she broke her arm and was unable to pull up the ski pants. At long last her husband arrived
column29: put an end to her nude show
column30: then went to the base of the mountain and summoned the ski patrol
column31:
who transported her to a hospital.

\n

In the emergency room she was regrouping when a man with a broken leg was put in a bed next to hers.

\n

"So
column32: how''d you break your leg?" She asked
column33:
making small talk.

\n

"It was the darndest thing you ever saw
column34:
he said I was riding up this ski lift and suddenly I couldn''t believe my eyes. There was this crazy woman skiing backwards out of control down the mountain with her bare bottom hanging out. I leaned over to get a better look and I guess I didn''t realize how far I''d moved. I fell out of the lift."

\n

"So how''d you break your arm?"

column1:
Q: Why didn''t the monster make the football team?
A: Because he threw like a ghoul!

To the citizens of the United States of America:

\n

In light of your failure to elect a President of the USA and thus to govern yourselves
column2: we hereby give notice of the revocation of your independence
column3:
effective today.

\n

Her Sovereign Majesty Queen Elizabeth II will resume monarchial duties over all states
column4: commonwealths and other territories. Except Utah
column5: which she does not fancy. Your new prime minister (The Rt. Hon. Tony Blair
column6:
MP for the 97.85% of you who have until now been unaware that there is a world outside your borders) will appoint a minister for America without the need for further elections. Congress and the Senate will be disbanded. A questionnaire will be circulated next year to determine whether any of you  noticed.

\n

To aid in the transition to a British Crown Dependency
column7:
the following rules are introduced with immediate effect:

\n

1. You should look up "revocation" in the Oxford English Dictionary.
Then look up "aluminium" . Check the pronunciation guide. You will be amazed at just how wrongly you have been pronouncing it. Generally
column8:
you should raise your vocabulary to acceptable levels.

Look up "vocabulary". Using the same twenty seven words interspersed with filler noises such as "like" and "you know" is an unacceptable and inefficient form of communication. Look up "interspersed".

2. There is no such thing as "US English". We will let Microsoft know on your behalf.

3. You should learn to distinguish the English and Australian accents. It really isn''t that hard.

4. Hollywood will be required occasionally to cast English actors as the good guys.

5. You should relearn your original national anthem
column9: God Save The Queen
column10:
but only after fully carrying out task 1. We would not want you to get confused and give up half way through.

\n

6. You should stop playing American football. There is only one kind of football. What you refer to as American football is not a very good game. The 2.15% of you who are aware that there is a world outside your borders may have noticed that no one else plays American" football. You will no longer be allowed to play it
column11:
and should instead play proper football.

\n

column1: An 85 year old couple

column3: had died in a car crash. They had been in good health the last ten years mainly due to her interest in health food
column4: and exercise. When they reached the pearly gates
column5: St. Peter took them to their mansion which was decked out with a beautiful kitchen and master bath suite and Jacuzzi. As they "oohed and aahed" the old man asked Peter how much all this was going to cost. "It''s free
column6: Peter replied, this is Heaven." Next they went out back to survey the championship golf course that the home backed up to. They would have golfing privileges everyday and each week the course changed to a new one representing the great golf courses on earth. The old man asked
column7: "What are the green fees?" Peter''s reply
column8: "This is heaven
column9: you play for free." Next they went to the club house and saw the lavish buffet lunch with the cuisine''s of the world laid out. "How much to eat?" asked the old man. "Don''t you understand yet? This is heaven
column10: it is free!" Peter replied with some exasperation. "Well
column11: where are the low fat and low cholesterol tables?" the old man asked timidly. Peter lectured
column12: "That''s the best part . . . you can eat as much as you like of whatever you like and you never get fat and you never get sick. This is Heaven." With that the old man went into a fit of anger
column13: throwing down his hat and stomping on it
column14: and shrieking wildly. Peter and his wife both tried to calm him down
column15: asking him what was wrong. The old man looked at his wife and said
column16: "This is all your fault. If it weren''t for your bran muffins
column17: I could have been here ten years ago!"

column1: Veteran Pillsbury spokesman
column2: Pop N. Fresh
column3: died yesterday of a severe yeast infection. He was 71. Known to friends as "Brown-n-Serve
column4:
Fresh was an avid gardener and tennis player.

Fresh was buried in one of the largest funeral ceremonies in recent years. Dozens of celebrities turned out including Mrs. Butterworth, the California Raisins, Hungry Jack, Aunt Jemima, Betty Crocker, the Hostess Twinkies, and Skippy.

The graveside was piled high with flours as longtime friend, Aunt Jemima, delivered the eulogy, describing Fresh as a man who never knew how much he was kneaded."

Fresh rose quickly in show business
column5: but his later life was filled with many turnovers. He was not considered a very smart cookie
column6:
wasting much of his dough on half-baked schemes -- conned by those who buttered him up.

\n

Still
column7: even as a crusty old man
column8:
he was a roll model for millions. He enjoyed being prodded by his many friends who invariably poked fun at him.

\n

Fresh is survived by his second wife. They have two children and another bun in the oven.

\n

The funeral was held at 3:50 for about 20 minutes.

column1: One day
column2: John''s tennis elbow was acting up and he decided to stop in and see a doctor. When he got to the doctor''s office the nurse told him he could see the doctor in 15 minutes but
column3: first he''d have to give a urine sample. John said that this was absurd but
column4: the nurse insisted and John complied. 15 minutes later
column5:
John was ushered in to see the doctor.

\n

"So that tennis elbow is really acting up
column6:
huh?" the doctor said.

\n

"The nurse must have told you
column7:
said John, wondering how the Doctor knew.

\n

No. It was in your urinalysis." and the doctor continued to say that he had just purchased this new machine that could diagnose every physical condition with total accuracy based on the urine contents. John didn''t believe a word of this but he did agree to provide another urine sample on check-up visit.

\n

Two days later
column8: John was sitting at the kitchen table with his wife and his teenage daughter. He was telling them about this ridiculous machine. When John decided to have a little fun with the doctor. John pissed in the bottle as did his wife and teenage daughter. Then while walking to his garage he had a brainstorm. John put a few drops of oil from his crankcase in the jar and finally beat off and put a few drops of semen in the jar. He drove to the doctors office
column9: shook the bottle
column10: then handed it to the nurse. This time his urinalysis took half an hour. Finally
column11:
John was ushered in to see the doctor.

\n

The doctor looked at him and said
column12: "I''ve got some bad news
column13: smartass. Your daughter is pregnant
column14: your wife''s got V. D.
column15: your car is about to throw a rod
column16: and if you don''t stop beating off
column17: that tennis elbow is never gonna heal!"

column1:
An avid duck hunter was in the market for a new bird dog. His search ended
when he found a dog that could actually walk on water to retrieve a duck.
Shocked by his find
column2:
he was sure none of his friends would ever believe him.
He decided to try to break the news to a friend of his
column3: a pessimist by nature
column4: and invited him to hunt with him and his new dog. As they waited by the shore
column5:
a
flock of ducks flew by. They fired
column6:
and a duck fell. The dog responded and
jumped into the water. The dog
column7: however
column8:
did not sink but instead walked across
the water to retrieve the bird
column9:
never getting more than his paws wet.
The friend saw everything but did not say a single word.
On the drive home the hunter asked his friend
column10:
"Did you notice anything
unusual about my new dog?"
I sure did
column11: responded his friend. He can''t swim.

on a perilous twist in the trail

sending him and his rifle tumbling down the mountainside. Before
he knew it
column4: his rifle went one way and he went the other
column5:
landing on a rock and breaking both legs. That was the good
news. The bad news was the ferocious bear charging at him from a
distance
column6: and he couldn''t move. "Oh
column7: Lord
column8:
the preacher prayed,
I''m so sorry for skipping services today to come out here and
hunt. Please forgive me and grant me just one wish...please make
a Christian out of that bear that''s coming at me. Please
column9:
Lord!"

\n

That very instant
column10: the bear skidded to a halt
column11:
fell to its
knees
column12:
clasped its paws together and began to pray aloud right
at the preacher''s feet. "Dear God
column13:
bless this food I am about to
receive...."

column1: If you receive an email entitled "Badtimes
column2:
delete it immediately! Do not open it. Apparently, this one is pretty nasty.

\n

It will not only erase everything on your hard drive, but it will also delete anything on disks within 20 feet of your computer. It demagnetizes the stripes on ALL of your credit cards. It reprograms your ATM access code, screws up the tracking on your VCR and uses subspace field harmonics to scratch any CD''s you attempt to play. It will re-calibrate your refrigerator''s coolness settings so all your ice cream melts and your milk curdles. It will program your phone''s autodial to call only your mother-in-law''s number. This virus will mix antifreeze into your fish tank. It will drink all your beer. It will leave dirty socks on the coffee table when you are expecting company. Its radioactive emissions will cause your toe jam and bellybutton fuzz (be honest, you have some)to migrate behind your ears. It will replace your shampoo with Nair and your Nair with Rogaine, all while dating your current boy/girlfriend behind your back and billing their hotel rendezvous to your Visa card. It will cause you to run with scissors and throw things in a way that is only fun until someone loses an eye. It will give you Dutch Elm Disease and Tinea. It will rewrite your backup files, changing all your active verbs to passive tense and incorporating undetectable misspellings, which grossly change the interpretations of key sentences. If the Badtimes" message is opened in a Windows95 environment
column3: it will leave the toilet seat up and leave your hair dryer plugged in dangerously close to a full bathtub. It will not only remove the forbidden tags from your mattresses and pillows
column4: but it will also refill your skim milk with whole milk. It will replace all your luncheon meat with Spam. It will molecularly rearrange your cologne or perfume
column5: causing it to smell like dill pickles. It is insidious and subtle. It is dangerous and terrifying to behold. It is also a rather interesting shade of mauve.   These are just a few signs of infection. PLEASE FORWARD THIS MESSAGE TO EVERYONE YOU KNOW!!! LIFE IS UNCERTAIN; EAT YOUR DESSERT FIRST!

column1: A guy goes to his local church during the week to see the priest and confess his sins. He goes into the confessional box and says

column5:

"No

column1: After Quasimodo''s death
column2:
the bishop of the cathedral of Notre Dame sent word
through the streets of Paris that a new bell ringer was needed. The bishop
decided that he would conduct the interviews personally and went up into the
belfry to begin the screening process.

\n

After observing while several applicants demonstrated their skills
column3:
he
decided to call it a day. Just then a lone
column4:
armless man approached him and
announced that he was there to apply for the bell ringer''s job.

\n

The bishop was incredulous. "You have no arms!"

\n

"No matter
column5:
said the man, observe!" He then began striking the bells with
his face
column6:
producing a beautiful melody on the carillon.

\n

The bishop listened in astonishment
column7:
convinced that he had finally found a
suitable replacement for Quasimodo.Suddenly
column8:
while rushing forward to strike a
bell
column9:
the armless man tripped and plunged headlong out of the belfry window to
his death in the street below.

\n

The stunned bishop immediately rushed down the stairways.When he reached the
street
column10: a crowd had gathered around  the fallen figure
column11:
drawn by the beautiful
music they had heard only moments before. As they silently parted to let the
bishop through
column12: one of them asked
column13: "Bishop
column14:
who was this man?"

\n

"I don''t know his name
column15:
the bishop sadly replied, but his face rings a
bell."

column1: Many parents today are concerned that their offspring might somehow be involved in the world of illegal pharmaceuticals
column2: or "drugs".  This is a healthy concern.  Knowing your kids are "high" is the first step toward helping them avoid problems with their health
column3: their grades
column4: the law
column5:
and getting those hard-to-clean vomit stains out of the Oriental rug.

KNOW THE WARNING SIGNS- select the option which best describes your child.

1. Your child''s idea of a fun sport to play is:

A) tossing a pigskin ball around

B) throwing an orange rubber ball into a netted hole

C) inserting a pointy needle into a vein and mixing foreign substances into the human bloodstream.

2. Your child''s idea of a responsible adult is:

A) Bill Clinton

B) Tom Hanks

C) Charles Manson.

3. Your child''s favorite hobbies include:

A) Model Rocketry

B) Baseball

C) Taking white
column6:
powdery substances from a big bag and breaking it down into many smaller bags.

4. Your child''s pet is:

A) a puppy dog

B) a 16'' python

C) a colony of imaginary bugs and spiders that crawl under their skin.

5. Your child''s breath smells like:

A) a fresh
column7:
minty mountain top

B) lunch

C) an opium den.

6. When your young ones dress up to go out
column8:
they look like:

A) Fred and Ginger

B) Regis and Kathy Lee

C) Sid and Nancy

7. Your child would identify Tijuana Gold as:

A) a precious metal

B) a Mexican theme park

C) a good deal
column9:
but not as potent as the stuff from Thailand.

8. When you ask your child how their day at school was at the dinner table they answer:

A) they scored a goal for their soccer team

B) they got the highest grade in class on a math test

C) they scored a dime bag and got high.

Total up the number of times you answered "C" to the questions above
column10:
and consult the table below.

\n

0 "C''s"- Chances are your child is not on drugs. They probably aren''t that exciting either. Kick them out of the house and force them to live on the cold streets for a few months to let them really appreciate life in all it''s murkiness.

column12:
but it scares the pants off your kids and is kind of fun.

3-6 "C''s"- You may as well face it
column13:
you''ve got a little druggie on your hands. Your child is a menace to society and must be dealt with accordingly. We suggest a good flaying to help them kick their nasty habit. Confiscate all their stash and send it to Ooze.

7-8 "C''s"- Your child has never used drugs. No sir. Just smile nicely at them and slink out of the house. Never return.

column1: NOTICE OF REVOCATION OF INDEPENDENCETo the citizens of the United States of America
column2: In the light of your failure to elect a President of the USA and thus to govern yourselves
column3: we hereby give notice of the revocation of your independence
column4: effective today.Her Sovereign Majesty Queen Elizabeth II will resume monarchical duties over all states
column5: commonwealths and other territories. Except Utah
column6: which she does not fancy. Your new prime minister (The right honourable Tony Blair
column7: MP for the 97.85% of you who have until now been unaware that there is a world outside your borders) will appoint a minister for America without the need for further elections. Congress and the Senate will be disbanded. A questionnaire will be circulated next year to determine whether any of you noticed.To aid in the transition to a British Crown Dependency
column8: the following rules are introduced with immediate effect:1. You should look up "revocation" in the Oxford English Dictionary. Then look up "aluminium". Check the pronunciation guide. You will be amazed at just how wrongly you have been pronouncing it. Generally
column9: you should raise your vocabulary to acceptable levels. Look up "vocabulary". Using the same twenty seven words interspersed with filler noises such as "like" and "you know" is an unacceptable and inefficient form of communication. Look up "interspersed".2. There is no such thing as "US English". We will let Microsoft know on your behalf.3. You should learn to distinguish the English and Australian accents. It really isn''t that hard.4. Hollywood will be required occasionally to cast English actors as the good guys.5. You should relearn your original national anthem
column10: "God Save The Queen"
column11: but only after fully carrying out task 1. We would not want you to get confused and give up half way through.6. You should stop playing American "football". There is only one kind of football. What you refer to as American "football" is not a very good game. The 2.15% of you who are aware that there is a world outside your borders may have noticed that no one else plays "American" football. You will no longer be allowed to play it
column12: and should instead play proper football. Initially
column13: it would be best if you played with the girls. It is a difficult game. Those of you brave enough will
column14: in time
column15: be allowed to play rugby (which is similar to American "football"
column16: but does not involve stopping for a rest every twenty seconds or wearing full kevlar body armour like nancies). We are hoping to get together at least a US rugby sevens side by 2005.7. You should declare war on Quebec and France
column17: using nuclear weapons if they give you any merde. The 98.85% of you who were not aware that there is a world outside your borders should count yourselves lucky. The Russians have never been the bad guys."Merde" is French for "sh*t".8. July 4th is no longer a public holiday. November 8th will be a new national holiday
column18: but only in England. It will be called "Indecisive Day".9. All American cars are hereby banned. They are crap and it is for your own good. When we show you German cars
column19: you will understand what we mean.10. Please tell us who killed JFK. It''s been driving us bonkers.Thank you for your co-operation.

column4:

\n

"Well

column16: now what exactly do you use it for?" replies the survey-taker with his pen poised over his clipboard
column17:
ready to record the answer.

\n

"Let''s see.....we use it for dry skin
column18: chapped lips
column19:
and sex."

\n

The well-dressed man stops writing abruptly. He looks around
column20:
leans forward and in a low voice says "We pride ourselves in being very thorough sir. I know how you''d use Vaseline for dry skin and chapped lips. But would you mind telling me how you use it for sex?"

\n

"No problem
column21:
the homeowner says in a whisper, we put it on our bedroom doorknob".

\n

The survey-taker gets a strange look on his face and takes a step backwards before the homeowner continues
column22: "It keeps the kids out".

column1: I took some clients out to dinner last week
column2:
and I noticed a spoon in the
shirt pocket of our waiter as he handed us the menus. It seemed a little odd
column3:
but I dismissed it as a random thing. Until our busboy came with water and
tableware; he too
column4:
sported a spoon in his breast pocket. I looked around the
room
column5:
and all the waiters and busboys had spoons in their pockets. When our
waiter returned to take our order
column6: I just had to ask
column7:
"Why the spoons?"

\n

"Well
column8:
he explained, our parent company recently hired some Andersen
Consulting efficiency experts to review all our procedures
column9:
and after months of
statistical analyses
column10:
they concluded that our patrons drop spoons on the floor
73% more often than any other utensil
column11:
at a frequency of 3 spoons per hour per
workstation. By preparing our workers for this contingency in advance
column12:
we can
cut our trips to the kitchen down and save time... nearly 1.5 extra man-hours
per shift." Just as he concluded
column13: a "ch-ching" came from the table behind him
column14:
and he quickly replaced the fallen spoon with the one from his pocket."I''ll grab
another spoon the next time I''m in the kitchen instead of making a special
trip
column15:
he proudly explained.

\n

I was impressed. Thanks
column16:
I had to ask."

\n

"No problem
column17:
he answered. Then he continued to take our orders. As the
members of our dinner party took their turns, my eyes darted back and forth from
each person ordering and my menu. That''s when, out of the corner of my eye, I
spotted a thin black thread protruding from our waiter''s fly. Again, I dismissed
it; yet I had to scan the room and, sure enough, there were other waiters and
busboys with strings hanging out of their trousers. My curiosity overrode
discretion at this point, so before he could leave I had to ask. Excuse me
column18: but...uh...why
column19:
or what about that string?"

\n

"Oh
column20: yeah
column21:
he began, in a quieter tone, not many people are that observant.
That same efficiency group found we could save time in the Men''s Room
column22:
too."

\n

"How''s that?" I asked.

\n

"You see
column23: by tying a string to the end of our
column24: uh
column25: selves
column26:
we can pull it out
at the urinals literally hands-free and thereby eliminate the need to wash our
hands
column27:
cutting time spent in the washroom by over 93%!"

\n

"Hey
column28: wait a minute. If the string helps you pull it out
column29:
how do you get it
back in?"

\n

"Well
column30: he whispered, I don''t know about the other guys
column31:
but I use the
spoon."

column1: 1. When you call us to have your computer moved
column2:
be sure to leave it
Buried under half a ton of postcards
column3: baby pictures
column4: stuffed animals
column5: Dried flowers
column6:
bowling trophies and children''s art. We don''t have a
Life
column7:
and we find it deeply moving to catch a fleeting glimpse of yours.

\n

2. Don''t write anything down. Ever. We can play back the error messages
From here.

\n

3. When an I.T. person says he''s coming right over
column8:
go for coffee. That
Way you won''t be there when we need your password. It''s nothing for us
To remember 700 screen saver passwords.

\n

4. When you call the help desk
column9: state what you want
column10:
not what''s keeping
you from getting it. We don''t need to know that you can''t get into your
Mail because your computer won''t power on at all.

\n

5. When I.T. support sends you an E-Mail with high importance
column11:
delete it
At once. We''re just testing.

\n

6. When an I.T. person is eating lunch at his desk
column12:
walk right in and
Spill your guts right out. We exist only to serve.

\n

7. Send urgent email all in uppercase. The mail server picks it up and
Flags it as a rush delivery.

\n

8. When the photocopier doesn''t work
column13:
call computer support. There''s
Electronics in it.

\n

9. When something''s wrong with your home PC
column14:
dump it on an I.T. person''s
Chair with no name
column15:
no phone number and no description of the problem.
We love a puzzle.

\n

10. When an I.T. person tells you that computer screens don''t have
Cartridges in them
column16:
argue. We love a good argument.

\n

11. When an I.T. person tells you that he''ll be there shortly
column17:
reply in
A scathing tone of voice: "And just how many weeks do you mean by
Shortly?" That motivates us.

\n

12. When the printer won''t print
column18:
re-send the job at least 20 times.
Print jobs frequently get sucked into black holes.

\n

13. When the printer still won''t print after 20 tries
column19:
send the job to
All 68 printers in the company. One of them is bound to work.

\n

14. Don''t learn the proper term for anything technical. We know exactly
What you mean by "My thingy blew up".

\n

15. Don''t use on-line help. On-line help is for wimps.

column1: Most diets fail because we are still thinking and eating like people. For those us who have never had any success dieting. Well now there is the new Miracle Cat Diet! This diet will also work on humans! Except for cats that eat like people -- such as getting lots of table scraps -- most cats are long and lean (or tiny and petite). the Cat Miracle Diet will help you achieve the same lean
column2: svelte figure. Just follow this diet for one week and you''ll find that you not only look and feel better
column3:
but you will have a whole new outlook on what constitutes food. Good Luck!

DAY ONE

Breakfast: Open can of expensive gourmet cat food. Any flavor as long as it cost more the .75 per can -- and place 1/4 cup on your plate. Eat 1 bite of food; look around room disdainfully. Knock the rest on the floor. Stare at the wall for awhile before stalking off into the other room.

Lunch: Four blades of grass and one lizard tail. Throw it back up on the cleanest carpet in your house.

Dinner: Catch a moth and play with it until it is almost dead. Eat one wing. Leave the rest to die.

Bedtime snack: Steal one green bean from your spouse''s or partner''s plate. Bat it around the floor until it goes under the refrigerator. Steal one small piece of chicken and eat half of it. Leave the other half on the sofa. Throw out the remaining gourmet cat food from the can you opened this morning.

DAY TWO

Breakfast: Picking up the remaining chicken bite from the sofa. Knock it onto the carpet and bat it under the television set. Chew on the corner of the newspaper as your spouse/partner tries to read it.

Lunch: Break into the fresh French bread that you bought as your part of the dinner party on Saturday. Lick the top of it all over. Take one bite out of the middle of the loaf.

Afternoon snack: Catch a large beetle and bring it into the house. Play toss and catch with it until it is mushy and half dead. Allow it to escape under the bed.

Dinner: Open a fresh can of dark-colored gourmet cat food -- tuna or beef works well. Eat it voraciously. Walk from your kitchen to the edge of the living room rug. Promptly throw up on the rug. Step into it as you leave. Track footprints across the entire room.

DAY THREE

Breakfast: Drink part of the milk from your spouse''s or partner''s cereal bowl when no one is looking. Splatter part of it on the closest polished aluminum appliance you can find.

Lunch: Catch a small bird and bring it into the house. Play with on top of your down filled comforter. Make sure the bird is seriously injured but not dead before you abandon it for someone else to have to deal with.

Dinner: Beg and cry until you are given some ice cream or milk in a bowl of your own. Take three licks/laps and then turn the bowl over on the floor.

FINAL DAY

Breakfast: Eat 6 bugs
column4: any type
column5: being sure to leave a collection of legs
column6: wings
column7:
antennae on the bathroom floor. Drink lots of water. Throw the bugs and all of the water up on your spouse''s or partner''s pillow.

\n

Lunch: Remove the chicken skin from last night''s chicken-to-go leftovers your spouse or partner placed in the trash can. Drag the skin across the floor several times. Chew it in a corner and then abandon.

\n

Dinner: Open another can of expensive gourmet cat food. Select a flavor that is especially runny
column8: like Chicken and Giblets in Gravy. Lick off all the gravy and leave the actual meat to dry and get hard.

on a Confederate flag. It is shipped with a Daisy Duke screen saver.

column1: In a never-ending effort to attract the unchurched
column2:
some churches have considered translating their unfamiliar terminology into familiar football phrases:

BLITZ: The strategic play that takes place two seconds after every benediction.

BLOCKING: Talking endlessly to the pastor at the church door and keeping everyone else from exiting.

COACH: The children''s Christmas program director.

ASSISTANT COACH: Every mother who has a kid in the children''s Christmas program.

COMMERCIAL: Announcements.

DRAFT CHOICE: The decision to sit close to an air conditioning vent.

DRAW PLAY: What many children (and not a few adults) do with their bulletins during the service.

END ZONE: The pews.

EXTRA POINT: What you receive when you tell the preacher his sermon was too short.

FIRST QUARTER: What most people put into the Sunday school offering so it looks like they are giving.

FOURTH QUARTER: The amount that makes up the $1 most people put into the Sunday school offering when under peer pressure to give more.

HAIL MARY: Desperate move made by ushers in a last-ditch attempt to get people to put something in the plate.

HALFTIME: Usually during the offertory when at least 14 people decide they need to use the restroom.

HOLDING: Passing on the offering place without putting in a cent.

ILLEGAL CONTACT: What gets some church leaders into trouble and out of the ministry.

ILLEGAL MOTION: Leaving before the benediction.

INTERFERENCE: Talking during the organ prelude.

OFFSIDES: When an orchestra member accidentally walks into the choir room (severe penalty incurred).

PASS INTERFERENCE: 1. Single male usher spots single woman in audience.
2. A parent moving between two teens in the
pew to halt the flow of notes back and forth during the sermon.

QUARTERBACK SNEAK: 1. How the pastor gets from the pulpit to the rear door during the benediction.
2. Sunday school teachers entering the building five minutes after classes began.

RAIN DELAY: Baptism

RED DOG: Common strategy performed each Sunday by those who "own" their own pew.

SUDDEN DEATH: The penalty to the pastor who preaches more than twenty minutes.

TACKLE: 1. What takes place to the only eligible bachelor at the 35-and-over singles enrichment retreat.
2. Asking that "new couple" to sing in the choir
column3: work in the nursery
column4: serve on a committee
column5: join a Bible study
column6:
and teach the middle schoolers before they get away.

PASS: When the new couple says no.

TIME-OUT: Refreshment time in the Fellowship Hall.

TWO-MINUTE WARNING: The pastor''s wife looking at her watch in full view of the pastor.

UNSPORTSMANLIKE CONDUCT: Usually takes place at a committee meeting to decide on the color of carpet or some other thing.

Submitted by Admin
Edited by Calamjo

column1: A golfer and his buddies where playing a big round of golf for $200. At the eighteenth green the golfer had a ten foot putt to win the round
column2:
and the $200.

\n

As he was lining up his putt
column3: a funeral procession started to pass by. The golfer set down his putter
column4: took his hat off
column5: placed it over his chest
column6: and began to wait for the funeral procession to pass. After it passed
column7:
he picked up his putter and returned to lining up his putt.

\n

One of his buddies said
column8: "That was the most touching thing I have ever seen.  I can''t believe you stopped playing
column9: possibly loosing your concentration
column10:
to pay your respects."

\n

"Well
column11: we were married for 25 years!"

column1: Two blondes were playing golf at a foggy par three
column2: and could see the flag
column3: but not the green. Each hit their ball anyway. When they walked to the green
column4: they discovered one about three feet from the cup
column5: while the other somehow had gone directly in. They tried to figure out which ball belonged to who
column6: since they were both using Titleist number threes. Unable to decide
column7:
they returned to the Club House and asked the golf pro for a ruling.

\n

After hearing their story and congratulating them both on their superb shots under such adverse conditions he asked
column8: "OK
column9: so who was playing the yellow ball ?"

column1: Two Rednecks went bear hunting. While one stayed in the cabin
column2: the other went out looking for a bear. He soon found a huge bear
column3: shot at it but only wounded it. The enraged bear charged toward him
column4: he dropped his rifle and started running for the cabin as fast as he could. He ran pretty fast but the bear was just a little faster and gained on him with every step. Just as he reached the open cabin door
column5: he tripped and fell flat. Too close behind to stop
column6: the bear tripped over him and went rolling into the cabin. The man jumped up
column7: closed the cabin door and yelled to his friend inside
column8: "You skin this one while I go and get another!"

The room was full of pregnant women and their partners
column2:
and the Lamaze class
was in full swing.

\n

The instructor was teaching the women how to breathe properly
column3:
along with
informing the men how to give the necessary assurances at this stage of the
plan.

\n

column4: "Ladies
column5:
exercise is good for you. Walking
is especially beneficial. And
column6: gentlemen

it wouldn''t hurt you to take the time

his hand. "Yes?" replied the teacher.

column1:
Here are answers to 5 of the toughest questions women ask men.

1 - "What are you thinking?"

2 - "Do you love me?"

3 - "Do I look fat?"

4 - "Do you think she is prettier than me?"

5 - "What would you do if I died?"

What makes these questions so bad is that every one is guaranteed to explode into a major argument and/or divorce if the man does not answer properly
column2:
which is to say dishonestly. For example:

\n

1 - "What are you thinking?"

\n

The proper answer to this question
column3: of course is
column4: "I''m sorry if I''ve been pensive
column5: dear. I was just reflecting on what a warm
column6: wonderful
column7: caring
column8: thoughtful
column9: intelligent
column10:
beautiful woman you are and what a lucky guy I am to have met you."

\n

Obviously
column11: this statement bears no resemblance whatsoever to what the guy was really thinking at the time
column12:
which was most likely one of five things:

a - Baseball

b - Football

c - How fat you are

d - How much prettier she is than you

e - How he would spend the insurance money if you died According to the Sassy article
column13: the best answer to this stupid question came from Al Bundy
column14: of Married With Children
column15: who was asked it by his wife
column16: Peg. "If I wanted you to know
column17:
Al said, I''d be talking instead of thinking."

The other questions also have only one right answer but many wrong answers:

2 - "Do you love me?"

The correct answer to this question is
column18: "Yes." For those guys who feel the need to be more elaborate
column19: you may answer
column20: "Yes
column21:
dear."

Wrong answers include:

a - I suppose so.

b - Would it make you feel better if I said yes?

c - That depends on what you mean by "love".

d - Does it matter?

e - Who
column22:
me?

\n

3 - "Do I look fat?"

\n

The correct male response to this question is to confidently and emphatically state
column23: "No
column24:
of course not" and then quickly leave the room.

\n

Wrong answers include:

\n

a - I wouldn''t call you fat
column25:
but I wouldn''t call you thin either.

b - Compared to what?

c - A little extra weight looks good on you.

d - I''ve seen fatter.

e - Could you repeat the question? I was thinking about your insurance policy.

4 - "Do you think she''s prettier than me?"

The "she" in the question could be an ex-girlfriend
column26: a passer-by you were staring at so hard that you almost caused a traffic accident or an actress in a movie you just saw. In any case
column27: the correct response is
column28: "No
column29:
you are much prettier."

\n

Wrong answers include:

\n

a - Not prettier
column30:
just pretty in a different way.

\n

b - I don''t know how one goes about rating such things.

\n

c - Yes
column31:
but I bet you have a better personality.

d - Only in the sense that she''s younger and thinner.

e - Could you repeat the question? I was thinking about your insurance policy.

5 - "What would you do if I died?"

Correct answer: "Dearest love
column32: in the event of your untimely demise
column33:
life would cease to have meaning for me and I would perforce hurl myself under the front tires of the first Domino''s Pizza truck that came my way."

\n

This might be the stupidest question of the lot
column34:
as is illustrated by the following stupid exchange:

\n

"Dear
column35:
said the wife. What would you do if I died?"

\n

"Why
column36: dear
column37: I would be extremely upset
column38:
said the husband. Why do you ask such a question?"

\n

"Would you remarry?" persevered the wife.

\n

"No
column39: of course not
column40:
dear" said the husband.

\n

"Don''t you like being married?" said the wife.

\n

"Of course I do
column41:
dear" he said.

\n

"Then why wouldn''t you remarry?"

\n

"Alright
column42:
said the husband, I''d remarry."

\n

"You would?" said the wife
column43:
looking vaguely hurt.

"Yes" said the husband.

"Would you sleep with her in our bed?" said the wife after a long pause.

"Well yes
column44:
I suppose I would." replied the husband.

\n

"I see
column45:
said the wife indignantly.

\n

And would you let her wear my old clothes?"

\n

"I suppose
column46:
if she wanted to" said the husband.

\n

"Really
column47:
said the wife icily.

And would you take down the pictures of me and replace them with pictures of her?"

"Yes. I think that would be the correct thing to do."

"Is that so?" said the wife
column48:
leaping to her feet.

\n

"And I suppose you''d let her play with my golf clubs
column49:
too."

\n

"Of course not
column50: dear
column51: said the husband. She''s left-handed..."
