column1: Morris walks out into the street and manages to get a taxi just going by. He gets into the taxi
column2: and the cabbie says
column3:
"Perfect timing. You''re just like Dave."

"Who?"

"Dave Aronson. There''s a guy who did everything right. Like my coming along when you needed a cab. It would have happened like that to Dave."

"There are always a few clouds over everybody
column4:
says Morris.

\n

Not Dave. He was a terrific athlete. He could have gone on the pro tour in tennis. He could golf with the pros. He sang like an opera baritone and danced like a Broadway star."

\n

"He was something
column5:
huh?"

\n

"He had a memory like a trap. Could remember everybody''s birthday. He knew all about wine
column6: which fork to eat with. He could fix anything. Not like me. I change a fuse
column7:
and I black out the whole neighborhood."

\n

"No wonder you remember him."

\n

"Well
column8:
I never actually met Dave."

\n

"Then how do you know so much about him?" asks Morris.

\n

"Because I married his widow."

column1:
A traveling salesman was driving down a farm road when his car suddenly
stopped and wouldn''t start again. A farmer on a tractor was passing by and
stopped to help the salesman fix his car. By the time they were finished
column2:
it was
almost sundown
column3:
so the farmer told the salesman he could spend the night at his
home if he didn''t mind sharing the bed with his twin daughters. The salesman
thought the twins were kids
column4:
so he said it was okay. They farmer took the
salesman to his home and went into the house.

\n

After a few minutes of talking and cleaning up
column5:
the men were called to the
dinner table by the farmer''s wife. As they sat down
column6:
the salesman saw the two
most beautiful young ladies he had ever seen. The farmer introduced them as his
twin daughters. During the entire meal all the salesman thought about was he was
sleeping in the same bed as the girls and he was going to have a good time that
night. They all finished their supper and the men went and talked while the
women finished cleaning up. The salesman couldn''t keep his mind off what was to
be a good time. Finally it was time to go to bed and the salesman anxiously got
prepared. The twins got into the bed
column7:
one on each side of the salesman. Just as
the lights were going to be turned off
column8:
the farmer came into the bedroom and
placed one egg on both sides of the salesman. The farmer said
column9:
"This is to make
sure you don''t do anything with my daughters tonight!! If I come in tomorrow
morning and find one or both eggs broken
column10:
I''ll know you did something and I''ll
shoot you!! You understand? Well
column11: the salesman looked at the eggs
column12: the farmer
column13:
and the shotgun in the farmer''s hand and quietly replied that he understood.
With that
column14:
the farmer told them goodnight and turned off the light.

\n

During the night
column15:
the salesman turned over and accidentally broke one of the
eggs. "What the hell
column16: he thought, I''m dead anyway
column17:
and screwed the first
twin. After several minutes of bliss, he rolled off of her and broke the other
egg. Might as well go out smiling
column18:
he thought and had his way with the second
twin. When he was finished, he noticed that it was almost sunup and the farmer
was starting to stir. Thinking quickly, he looked into his sales bag and got out
a tube of superglue and glued the eggs back together. The glue dried quickly and
the salesman jumped back into the bed and had just put both eggs back when the
farmer entered.

\n

I see the eggs are alright
column19:
so I guess I won''t shoot you. Want some
breakfast?"

\n

"What are you making?" the salesman asked.

\n

Holding up the eggs
column20: he said
column21:
"Eggs."

\n

"No thanks
column22: I''ll eat later
column23:
I got to get going!!!" the salesman quickly said
and grabbed his clothes and left.

\n

The farmer went to the stove and broke the first egg over the skillet
column24:
but
nothing came out. He then broke the second egg and again
column25:
nothing came out.
Extremely pissed off
column26: the farmer walked out to the hen house and shouted
column27: "Alright...which one of you roosters is wearing a rubber???"

column1: By Barbara Florio GrahamFrom McCall''s
column2: June
column3: 1983I read every diet I can get my hands on.  I even follow their suggestions.  But eventually
column4: inevitably
column5: I always get fat again.  Now
column6: at last
column7: I''ve found The Answer.  After living for almost 14 years with a man who never gains an ounce no matter what I serve him
column8: I''ve found out what it is that keeps him thin: He thinks differently.  The real difference between fat and thin people is that thin people:avoid eating popcorn in the movies because it gets their hands greasy;split a large combination pizza with three friends;think Oreo cookies are for kids;nibble cashews one at a time;think that doughnuts are indigestible;read books they have to hold with both hands;become so absorbed in a weekend project they forget to have lunch;fill the candy dish on their desks with paper clips;counteract the midafternoon slump with a nap instead of a cinnamon Danish;exchange the deep-fryer they received for Christmas for a clock-radio;lose their appetites when they''re depressed;think chocolate Easter bunnies are for kids;save leftovers that are too skimpy to use for another meal in order to make interesting soups;throw out stale potato chips;will eat only Swiss or Dutch chocolate
column9: which cannot be found except in a special store;think it''s too much trouble to stop at a special store just to buy chocolate;don''t celebrate with a hot-fudge sundae every time they lose a pound;warm up after skiing with black coffee instead of hot chocolate and whipped cream;try all the salads at the buffet
column10: leaving room for only one dessert;find iced tea more refreshing than an ice-cream soda;get into such interesting conversations at cocktail parties that they never quite work their way over to the hors-d''oeuvre table;have no compulsion to keep the candy dish symmetrical by reducing the jelly beans to an equal number of each color;think that topping brownies with ice cream makes too rich a dessert;bring four cookies into the TV room instead of a box;think banana splits are for kids.

column1:
Callus Collection

\n

Florence Franklin of Peoria
column2: IL
column3: holds the record. As of Sept 12
column5: Florence had over 200 pounds of callus in her collection. "I shave it off people
column6:
Florence told us. They don''t mind. Some people even autograph the big pieces."

\n

Infestation of Mites (Group)

\n

This record belongs to the 3
column7: 859 residents of Itchy Butt
column8: Montana. In 1989
column9: visiting doctors certified that every person in the town was suffering from scabies
column10: a skin disease caused by mite infection. "The mites seemed to be jumping from one person to another
column11:
the mayor of Itchy Butt told us, so we decided to get together and go for the record."

\n

Snail-Sucking (Live)

\n

Armand Forcalquier
column12: of Marseille
column13: France
column14: holds the record. In a contest held on Feb 12
column16: Armand sucked down 1
column17: 238 live snails in a little over 4 hours. "It was not easy
column18: Armand boasted after he learned the record was his. They cling to their shells
column19:
but they can''t get away from me."

\n

Nose Stuffing (Limburger Cheese)

\n

Hans Kleiber
column20: of West Berlin
column21: holds the record. In a contest held on May 1
column23:
Hans managed to stuff 13 ounces of limburger into his nostrils in less than a minute. Hans'' closest competitor gagged on nine ounces and was disqualified.

\n

Raw Kidney (Eating)

\n

Alice Caldwell of Butte
column24: Montana
column25: holds the record. On Oct 22
column27: Alice gobbled up more than 14 pounds of raw veal and lamb kidneys. "Kidneys are a good source of protein and vitamins
column28: Alice told us. If you cook them
column29: you lose some of the vitamins. As you can see
column30:
I don''t care about the record - I care about my health."

\n

Roach (Largest)

\n

Rita Carlson
column31: of Pasadena
column32: CA
column33: claims the record for having raised the world''s largest roach. Her record-setting roach is over a foot long and weighs close to two pounds (1992). "Plenty of protein
column34: Rita told us, and plenty of good
column35: natural vitamins helped to make this roach into a champion. You should have seen it when I first found it crawling around my kitchen." {There are a couple more roach records. One is highest paid for a roach named Lassie II ($112
column36: 450) and longest living (Lassie
column37: 12 years). Both roaches came from roach afficianado Sheila Biderman. About the oldest roach
column38: Sheila reports that "She''s like one of the family. If she ever gets too old to poke around food by herself
column39: you can bet I''ll do the humane thing and step on her
column40:
record or no record."}

\n

Socks (Continuous Wear)

\n

Andy Schwartz
column41: of Glen Ridge
column42: NJ
column43: claimed the record in 1989. In a sworn statement
column44: Andy''s wife declared that he had worn the same socks every day for twenty years and 114 days. In 1983
column45:
shoe stores throughout New Jersey banned Andy from their premises. Since then he has purchased his shoes through the mail. Andy plans to remove the socks and take a look at his feet in 1999.

\n

Tapeworm (Longest)

\n

Sally Mae Wallace of Great Grits
column46: Mississippi
column47: holds the record. On Sep 5
column49: doctors extracted 37 feet (continuous) of tapeworm from Sally. "About after 20 feet of that thing had come out of my mouth
column50:
Sally told us, I just knew I had the record. I was really filled with joy."

\n

Tongue (Hairiest)

\n

Selma Ruby
column51: of Dallas
column52: Texas
column53: holds the record. Selma''s tongue is fully covered with hair (1992). "I''ve been thinking about having it removed by an electrolysist
column54:
Selma told us, though lately people have been telling me that it''s beautiful."

\n

Underarm Hair (Length)

\n

Florence Floss of Ban
column55: Idaho
column56: holds the record. On July 15
column58: the hair growing out of Florence''s left armpit stretched to a length of 34 inches. This was more than enough for a record
column59: but Florence hopes to have a yard of hair dangling from her armpit soon. "I shave the other armpit
column60:
Florence reported to us.

\n

Feet (Smell)

\n

On Aug 21, 1991, Wanda Lake, 18, broke the record held by George David. Wanda removed her shoes in the crowded lobby of a Los Angeles theatre. In the five minutes that followed, the lobby was a chaotic mass of panic-stricken people trying desperately to escape. In the end, 42 people were sick, and 14 others had passed out. One day, a lawyer was riding in his limo and saw two men sitting
on the side of the road eating grass. He ordered his driver to
stop the limo and stepped outside. Excuse me
column61:
the lawyer
started. May I ask as to why you are consuming that green ...
plant?"

\n

The skinnier man replied
column62:
"We have no money ... we haven''t eaten
in weeks
column63:
the man pulled some grass out of his torn pocket.
This is for my wife and-" The lawyer cut him off. "Come ...
Come with me! To my home! You deserve better than this dead dry
grass!" The two men looked at each other. The thin one said
column64:
"I
have a wife and 4 kids
column65:
he pointed to his friend, he has a
wife and 8 children! Will you still take us in?"

\n

The lawyer gave them a warm smile. "Of course! I feel it is my
duty ... Besides the grass at my house is nice and green ... and
at least 2 feet tall!!"

column1: Following a distinguished legal career
column2: a man arrived at the Gates of Heaven
column3: accompanied by the Pope
column4: who had the misfortune to expire on the same day. The Pope was greeted first by St. Peter
column5:
who escorted him to his quarters.

\n

The room was somewhat shabby and small
column6:
similar to that found in a low grade Motel 6 type establishment.

\n

The lawyer was then taken to his room
column7: which was a palatial suite including a private swimming pool
column8: a garden
column9: and a terrace overlooking the Gates. The attorney was somewhat taken aback
column10: and told St. Peter
column11: "I''m really quite surprised at these rooms
column12:
seeing as how the Pope was given such small accommodations."

\n

St. Peter replied
column13: "We have over a hundred Popes here
column14: and we''re really very bored with them. We''ve never had a lawyer."

column1:
If you want someone who will bring you the paper without first tearing it apart to remove the sports section

buy a dog.

If you want someone willing to make a fool of himself simply over the joy of seeing you

buy a dog.

If you want someone who will eat whatever you put in front of him and never says its not quite as good as his mother made it

buy a dog.

If you want someone always willing to go out
column2: at any hour
column3:
for as long and wherever you want

\n

buy a dog.

\n

If you want someone to scare away burglars
column4:
without a lethal weapon which terrifies you and endangers the lives of your family and all the neighbors

\n

buy a dog.

\n

If you want someone who will never touch the remote
column5: doesn''t give  a damn about football
column6:
and can sit next to you as you watch romantic movies

buy a dog.

If you want someone who is content to get up on your bed just to warm your feet and whom you can push off if he snores

buy a dog.

If you want someone who never criticizes what you do
column7: doesn''t care  if you are pretty or ugly
column8: fat or thin
column9: young or old
column10: who acts as if  every word you say is especially worthy of listening to
column11: and loves  you unconditionally
column12: perpetually
column13:
\n

buy a dog.

\n

But on the other hand If you want someone who will never come when you call
column14: ignores you totally when you come home
column15: leaves  hair all over the place
column16: walks all over you
column17: runs around all night
column18: only comes home to eat and sleep
column19: and acts as if your entire  existence is solely to ensure his happiness
column20:
Then .............

Buy a cat.

(Any resemblance to a man is purely coincidental)

column1:
Police officer George and officer Mary had been assigned to walk the beat.
They had only been out a short while when Mary said
column2: "Damn
column3: I was running late this morning after my workout and after I showered
column4:
I forgot to put on my panties! We have to go back

\n

to the station to get them."

\n

George replied
column5: "We don''t have to go back
column6: just give the K-9 unit
column7: Fido
column8: one sniff
column9:
and he will go fetch them for you."

\n

It was a hot day and Mary didn''t fell like heading back to the station
column10:
so she lifted her skirt for the dog.

\n

Fido''s nose shoots between her legs
column11: sniffing and snorting. After 10 seconds of sniffing
column12: Fido''s ears pick up
column13: he sniffs the wind
column14:
and he is off in a flash towards the station house.

\n

Five minutes go by and no sign of Fido.

\n

Ten minutes pass
column15:
and the dog is nowhere to be seen.

\n

Fifteen minutes pass
column16:
and they are starting to worry.

\n

Twenty minutes pass
column17:
and they hear sirens in the distance.

\n

The sirens get louder and louder. Suddenly
column18: followed by a dozen police cars
column19: Fido rounds the corner with the Desk Sergeant''s balls in his mouth.

column1:
1. Glorious history of killing North American tribes.
2. Two World Wars and One World Cup doo-dah doo-dah.
3. Warm beer.
4. Punctuality.
5. You get to confuse everyone with the rules of cricket.
6. You get to accept defeat graciously in major sporting events.
7. Union jack underpants.
8. You can live in the past and imagine you are still a world power.
9. Bathing once a week-whether you need to or not.
10. Ditto changing underwear.
11. Beats being Welsh.
12. Or Scottish.

A burglar broke into a house one night. He shone his torch around looking for valuables.

\n

When he picked up a CD player to place in his sack
column2: a strange disembodied voice echoed from the dark
column3: saying
column4:
''Jesus is watching you.''

\n

He nearly jumped out of his skin
column5:
clicked his flashlight off and froze.

\n

When he heard nothing more after a little while
column6: he shook his head
column7: promised himself a holiday after the next score
column8:
and then clicked his light back on and began searching for more valuables.

\n

Just as he pulled the stereo out so he could disconnect the wires
column9: clear as a bell
column10: he heard
column11:
''Jesus is watching you.''

\n

Freaked out
column12:
he shone his light around frantically looking for the source of the voice.

\n

Finally
column13: in the corner of the room
column14:
his torch came to rest on a parrot.

\n

''Did you say that?'' he hissed at the parrot.

\n

''Yep
column15: '' the parrot confessed
column16: and then squawked
column17:
''I''m trying to warn you.''

\n

The burglar relaxed.

\n

''Warn me
column18:
eh? Who are you?''

\n

''Moses
column19:
'' replied the parrot.

\n

`Moses?'' The burglar laughed. ''What kind of stupid people would name a parrot Moses?''

\n

The parrot replied
column20: ''Probably the same kind of people that would name a Rottweiler Jesus.''

column1: You might be a redneck if...You''ve ever hitchhiked naked
column2: You''re turned on by a woman who can field dress a deer. You use the O on a stop sign to sight your new rifle. Your bumper sticker says
column3: "My other car is a combine." The gas pedal on your car is shaped like a bare foot. The highlight of your parties is when you flip out your false teeth. Your wife keeps a can of Vienna sausage in her purse. Taking a dip has nothing to do with water. There are more than ten lawsuits currently pending against your dog. You take a fishing pole to Sea World. The hood and one door are a different color from the rest of your car. You''ve ever filled your deer tag on the golf course. You''ve ever shot somebody over a mall parking space. Santa Claus refuses to let your kids sit in his lap. Your toilet paper has page numbers on it. You think mud rasslin'' should be an Olympic sport. The receptionist checks the rat traps at your place of business. You list your parole officer as a reference. There are more fish on your wall than pictures. Motel 6 turns off the lights when they see you coming.

column1: ''Twas the night before Christmas when all through the house
column2:
\n

I searched for the tools to hand to my spouse.

\n

Instructions were studied and we were inspired
column3:
\n

in hopes we could manage "Some Assembly Required."

\n

The children were quiet (not asleep) in their beds
column4:
\n

while Mom and I faced the evening with dread:

\n

a kitchen
column5: two bikes
column6:
Barbie''s town house to boot!

\n

And
column7: thanks to Grandpa
column8:
a train with a toot!

\n

We opened the boxes
column9:
my heart skipped a beat....

let no parts be missing or parts incomplete!

Too late for last-minute returns or replacement;

if we can''t get it right
column10:
it goes in the basement!

\n

When what to my worrying eyes should appear
column11:
\n

but 50 sheets of directions
column12: concise
column13: but not clear
column14:
\n

with each part numbered and every slot named
column15:
\n

so if we failed
column16:
only we could be blamed.

\n

More rapid than eagles the parts then fell out
column17:
all over the carpet they were scattered about.

"Now bolt it! Now twist it! Attach it right there!

Slide on the seats
column18:
and staple the stair!

\n

Hammer the shelves
column19:
and nail to the stand."

\n

"Dearest" said Mom
column20:
"you just glued my hand."

\n

And then in a twinkling
column21:
I knew for a fact

that all the toy dealers had indeed made a pact

to keep parents busy all Christmas Eve night

with "assembly required" till morning''s first light.

We spoke not a word
column22: but kept bent at our work
column23:
\n

till our eyes
column24:
they went bleary; our fingers all hurt.

\n

The coffee went cold and the night
column25:
it wore thin

\n

before we attached the last rod and last pin.

\n

Then laying the tools away in the chest
column26:
\n

we fell into bed for a well-deserved rest.

\n

But I said to my wife just before I passed out
column27:
\n

"This will be the best Christmas
column28:
without any doubt.

\n

Tomorrow we''ll cheer
column29: let the holiday ring
column30:
and not have to run to the store for a thing!

We did it! We did it! The toys are all set

for the perfect
column31: most perfect
column32: Christmas
column33:
I bet!"

\n

Then off to dreamland and sweet repose

\n

I gratefully went
column34:
though I suppose

\n

there''s something to say for those self-deluded-

\n

I''d forgotten that BATTERIES are never included!

my

casually today

WRONG fourteen times gives you job security."

Being punctual in our office was of no benefit what-so-ever. There was never
anybody around to appreciate it.
"Never put off until tomorrow what you can avoid altogether."
- Unknown
"Do you believe in life after death?" the boss asked one of his employees.
"Yes
column9: Sir." the new recruit replied. "Well
column10: then
column11:
that makes everything just
fine
column12:
the boss continued. After you left the office early yesterday to go to
your grandmother''s funeral
column13:
she stopped in to see you!"
"Go the extra mile. It makes your boss look like an incompetent slacker."
- Unknown
Our office was always on the cutting edge of technology. Not only did we have
computers which spoke as well as listened
column14:
some of them even got ulcers.
"We waste more time by 8:00 in the morning than other companies do all day."
- Unknown
Stevenson''s boss came into his office one morning and caught him hugging his
secretary. He said in a rage
column15:
"Is this what you get paid for?!" Stevenson
replied
column16: "Nope
column17:
I do this for free!"
"Arguing with an Engineer is a lot like wrestling in the mud with a pig: After
a few hours
column18:
you realize the pig likes it."
- Unknown
The pretty new temp was standing in front of the paper shredder with a
confused look on her face. Stevenson asked if she needed any help and she said
column19: "Yeah
column20:
how does this thing work?" He took the papers from her hand and
demonstrated how to work the shredder. She stood there a moment with yet another
confused expression
column21: so Stevenson said
column22: "Any questions?" She said
column23:
"Yeah...
exactly where do the copies come out from?"
"This isn''t an office. It''s Hell with fluorescent lighting."
- Unknown

column2:
\n

I regret to inform you that you have been eliminated from further
contention as Mr. Right. As you are probably aware
column3:
the competition was
exceedingly tough and dozens of well-qualified candidates such as yourself also
failed to make the final cut. I will
column4: however
column5:
keep your name on file should an
opening come available. So that you may find better success in your future
romantic endeavors
column6:
please allow me to offer the following reason(s) you were
disqualified from the competition: (Check those that apply)

\n

__ Your last name is objectionable. I can''t imagine taking it
column7: hyphenating it
column8:
or subjecting my children to it.

__ Your first name is objectionable. It''s just not something I can picture
myself yelling out in a fit of passion.

__ The fact that our finest dining experience to date has been at McDonald''s
reveals a thriftiness that I find unappealing.

__ Your inadvertent admission that you "buy condoms by the truckload"
indicates that you may be interested in me for something other than my
personality.

__ You failed the 20 Question Rule
column9: i.e.
column10:
I asked you 20
questions about yourself before you asked me more than one about myself.

\n

__ Your breasts are bigger than mine.

\n

__ Your legs are skinnier than mine. If you can FIT into my pants
column11:
then you
can''t GET into my pants.

__ You''re too short. Any son that we produced would inevitably be beaten up
repeatedly at recess. AMEN!

__ You''re too tall. I''m developing a chronic neck condition from trying to
kiss you.

__ The fact that your apartment has been condemned reveals an inherent
slovenliness that I fear is unbreakable.

__ Although I do enjoy the X-Files
column12:
I find your wardrobe of Star Trek uniforms
a little disconcerting.

__ Your frequent references to your ex-girlfriend lead me to suspect that you
are some sort of psychotic stalker.

__ Your ability to belch the alphabet is not a trait that I am seeking in a
long term partner.

__ Your height is out of proportion to your weight. If you should
column13: however
column14: happen to gain the necessary 17 vertical inches
column15:
please resubmit your
application.

__ The fact that you categorize the ProBowler''s Tour as ''Must
See TV'' demonstrated that you do not meet my intelligence requirements.

__ Somehow I doubt those condoms that I found in your overnight bag were
really necessary for a successful business trip.

__ I am out of your league; set your sights lower next time.

Sincerely

column1: There was a boy who worked in the produce section of a market. A man came in and asked to buy half a head of lettuce. The boy told him that they only sold whole heads of lettuce. But the man said that he did not need a whole head

column3:

and we like that around here. Where are you from son?"

sir".

"My wife is from Minnesota!"

column1: Diet for Stress How''s your stress level? This should help. It is more than a diet
column2:
so read on... This diet is designed to help you cope with the stress that builds up during the day.

Breakfast:

1/2 grapefruit 1 slice whole wheat toast 8 oz. skim milk

Lunch: 4 oz. lean broiled chicken breast 1 cup steamed spinach 1 cup herb tea 1 Oreo cookie

Mid-Afternoon snack: The rest of Oreos in the package 2 pints Rocky Road ice cream with nuts
column3:
cherries and whipped cream 1 jar hot fudge sauce

\n

Dinner: 2 loaves garlic bread 4 cans or 1 large pitcher Coke 1 large sausage
column4:
mushroom and cheese pizza 3 Snickers bars

\n

Late Evening News: Entire frozen Sara Lee cheesecake (eaten directly from freezer)

\n

Rules for this Diet
1. If you eat something and no one sees you eat it
column5:
it has no calories.
2. If you drink a diet soda with a candy bar
column6:
the calories in the candy jar are canceled out by the diet soda.
3. When you eat with someone else
column7:
calories don''t count if you do not eat more than they do.
4. Food used for medicinal purposes NEVER count
column8: such as hot chocolate
column9:
toast and Sara Lee Cheesecake.
5. If you fatten up everyone else around you
column10:
then you look thinner.
6. Movie related foods do not have additional calories because they are part of the entertainment package and not part of one''s personal fuel. Examples: Milk Duds
column11: buttered popcorn
column12: Junior Mints
column13:
Red Hots and Tootsie Rolls.
7. Cookie pieces contain no calories. The process of breaking causes calorie leakage.
8. Things licked off knives and spoons have no calories if you are in the process of preparing something.
9. Foods that have the same color have the same number of calories. Examples are: spinach and pistachio ice cream; mushrooms and mashed potatoes.
10. Chocolate is a universal color and may be substituted for any other food color.
11. Anything consumed while standing has no calories. This is due to gravity and the density of the caloric mass.
12. Anything consumed from someone else''s plate has no calories since the calories rightfully belong to the other person and will cling to his/her plate. (We ALL know how calories like to cling!)

\n

REMEMBER: STRESSED SPELLED BACKWARDS IS DESSERTS

column1: LAW 2: Your best round of golf will be followed almost immediately  by your worst round ever. The probability of the latter increases with the number of people you tell about the former.
Occasionally
column2:
airline attendants make an effort to make the "in-flight safety lecture" and their other announcements a bit more entertaining.

\n

Here are some real examples that have been heard or reported:

\n

1. From a Southwest Airlines employee.... "There may be 50 ways to leave your lover
column3:
but there are only 4 ways out of this airplane..."

\n

2. Pilot-"Folks
column4: we have reached our cruising altitude now
column5: so I am going to switch the seat belt sign off. Feel free to move about as you wish
column6: but please stay inside the plane till we land...it''s a bit cold outside
column7:
and if you walk on the wings it affects the flight pattern."

\n

3. After landing: "Thank you for flying Delta Business Express. We hope you enjoyed giving us the business as much as we enjoyed taking you for a ride.

\n

4. As the plane landed and was coming to a stop at Washington National
column8: a lone voice comes over the loudspeaker: "Whoa
column9:
big fella. WHOA!"

\n

5. After a particularly rough landing during thunderstorms in Memphis
column10: a flight attendant on a Northwest flight announced: "Please take care when opening the overhead compartments because
column11: after a landing like that
column12:
sure as hell everything has shifted."

\n

6. From a Southwest Airlines employee.... "Welcome aboard Southwest Flight XXX to YYY. To operate your seatbelt
column13: insert the metal tab into the buckle
column14: and pull tight. It works just like every other seatbelt and if you don''t know how to operate one
column15: you probably shouldn''t be out in public unsupervised. In the event of a sudden loss of cabin pressure
column16: oxygen masks will descend from the ceiling. Stop screaming
column17: grab the mask
column18: and pull it over your face. If you have a small child traveling with you
column19: secure your mask before assisting with theirs. If you are traveling with two small children
column20:
decide now which one you love more.

\n

7. Weather at our destination is 50 degrees with some broken clouds
column21: but they''ll try to have them fixed before we arrive. Thank you
column22: and remember
column23: nobody loves you or your money
column24:
more than Southwest Airlines."

\n

8. "Your seat cushions can be used for flotation and in the event of an emergency water landing
column25:
please take them with our compliments."

\n

9. "As you exit the plane
column26:
please make sure to gather all of your belongings. Anything left behind will be distributed evenly among the flight attendants. Please do not leave children or spouses."

10. "Last one off the plane must clean it."

11. From the pilot during his welcome message: "We are pleased to have some of the best flight attendants in the industry... Unfortunately none of them are on this flight...!

12. Overheard on an American Airlines flight into Amarillo
column27: Texas
column28: on a particularly windy and bumpy day. During the final approach

welcome to Amarillo. Please remain in your seats with your seatbelts fastened while the Captain taxis what''s left of our airplane to the gate!"

13. Another flight Attendant''s comment on a less than perfect landing: "We ask you to please remain seated as Captain Kangaroo bounces us to the terminal."

\n

column38: "Sonny

column40: Ma''am

column44: "Ladies and Gentlemen
column45: please remain in your seats until Captain Crash and the Crew have brought the aircraft to a screeching halt up against the gate. And
column46: once the tire smoke has cleared and the warning bells are silenced
column47:
we''ll open the door and you can pick your way through the wreckage to the terminal.

column6:
I am getting along pretty well now. The skull fracture and the concussion I got when I jumped out of the window of my dormitory when it caught fire shortly after my arrival are pretty well healed now. I only spent two weeks in the hospital and I now can see almost normally and I only get those sick headaches once a week.

\n

Fortunately
column7: the fire in the dormitory and my jump was witnessed by an attendant at the gas station near the dorm and he was the one who called the fire department and the ambulance. He also visited me at the hospital and since I had nowhere to live because of the burnt-out dorm
column8: he was kind enough to invite me to share his apartment with him. It''s really a basement room
column9:
but it''s kind of cute.

\n

He is a very fine boy and we have falled deeply in love and are planning to get married. We haven''t exactly set the date yet
column10: but it will be before my pregnancy begins to show. Yes
column11: Mom and Dad
column12:
I am pregnant. I know how you are looking forward to being grandparents and I know you will welcome the baby and give it the same love and devotion and tender care you gave me as a child. The reason for the delay in our marriage is that my boy friend has some minor infection which prevents us from passing our premarital blood tests and I carelessly caught it from him. This will soon clear up with the penicillin injections I am taking daily.

\n

I know you will welcome him into the family with open arms. He is kind
column13: and although not well educated
column14: has ambitions. Although he is of a different race and religion than ours
column15: I know oft-expressed tolerance will not permit you to be bothered by the fact that his skin color is somewhat darker than ours. I am sure you will love him as I do. His family background is good
column16: too
column17:
for I hear that his father is an important gun-bearer in the village in Africa from which he comes.

\n

Now that I have brought you up to date
column18: I want to tell you that there was no dormitory fire. I do not have a concussion or a skull fracture
column19: I was not in the hospital
column20: I am not pregnant
column21: I am not engaged
column22:
I do not have syphilis and there is no colored man in my life.

\n

However
column23:
I am getting a ''D'' in history and an ''F'' in science class and I wanted you to see these marks in their proper perspective.

\n

Your loving daughter
column24:
\n

Trish

column1:
Schedule of a Wife and Mother:

\n

Attempt to wake husband.
Feed baby.
Make breakfast.
Change baby.
Wake kids.
Dress kids.
Walk dog.
Feed baby.
Drive kids to school.
Drag husband out of bed.
Do laundry.
Iron clothes.
Clean house.
Make husband lunch.
Feed and change baby.
Clean house again.
Walk dog again.
Pick up kids.
Pick up school stuff.
Clean up dog''s mess.
Make dinner.
Call repairman
column2: plumber
column3: electrician
column4:
and exterminator.
Swat flies.
Yell at kids.
Put kids to bed.
Change baby.
Go to Wal-Mart to stand on line for three hours to get one bag of chips for husband.
Clean house again.
Go to bed. Get up.
Comfort baby.
Let dog out.
Change baby.
Let dog in.
Get 10 minutes of sleep.

\n

Schedule of a Husband and Father

\n

Sleep.
Go to work.
Sleep.
Drink coffee.
Have wife pick up.
Watch football and drink beer.
Fall asleep.
Go to bathroom.
Lift one heavy object for begging wife.
Go to bed.
Get sleep while wife feeds baby.

column1: A Frenchman
column2: an Englishman

column9: he shouts

column14: says

column18: the sides

column22: and asks

column1:
Four women were teeing off to the first hole of their golf game. The
forth woman hit a terrific slice and it zoomed off to the next fairway and
hit a guy. He clasped his hands to his crotch and fell
down in pain.

\n

The girl ran over to him and taking his hands and placing them to his side
said
column2:
"I''m a physical therapist and I can
help you."

\n

She then proceeded to open up his pants and began to massage his private
parts therein. After a few minutes she said
column3:
"There! Doesn''t that feel
better?"

\n

The guy said
column4:
"Yeah that does feel good. But my thumb still hurts like
hell!

TEST:
*******************************************************************
DO NOT SKIP AHEAD. Read this message ONE LINE AT A TIME and just do what it says. You will be glad you did. If not
column2:
you''ll feel like an idiot and wish you had listened.
*******************************************************************

\n

1) pick a number from 1-9
2) subtract 5
3) multiply by 3
4) square the number (multiply by the same number -- not square root) and if it''s negative make it positive.
5) add the digits until you get only one digit (i.e. 64=6 4= 10= 1 0=1)
6) if the number is less than 5
column3:
add five. Otherwise subtract 4.
7) multiply by 2
8) subtract 6
9) map the digit to a letter in the alphabet 1=A
column6:
etc...
10) pick a name of a country that begins with that letter
11) take the second letter in the country name and think of a mammal that begins with that letter
12) think of the color of that mammal

\n

********************************************************************
DO NOT SCROLL DOWN UNTIL YOU HAVE DONE ALL OF THE ABOVE

tipped it over and ate everything on the ship.

column7:
again hauling potatoes.

Bob again capsizes the ship and eats everything onboard.

The third ship they found was also hauling potatoes and Bob once again capsized it and ate everything.

Finally his buddy Bill asked him

Bob replied

but I just can''t help myself once I start. Everyone knows you can''t eat just one potato ship."

column1:
T''was the night before Christmas - Old Santa was pissed

\n

He cussed out the elves and threw down his list

\n

Miserable little brats
column2:
ungrateful little jerks

I have good mind to scrap the whole works

I''ve busted my ass for damn near a year

Instead of "Thanks Santa" - what do I hear

The old lady bitches cause I work late at night

The elves want more money - The reindeer all fight

Rudolph got drunk and goosed all the maids

Donner is pregnant and Vixen has AIDS

And just when I thought that things would get better

Those assholes from IRS sent me a letter

They say I owe taxes - if that ain''t damn funny

Who the hell ever sent Santa Clause any money

And the kids these days - they all are the pits

They want the impossible ...Those mean little shits

I spent a whole year making wagons and sleds

Assembling dolls...Their arms
column3:
legs and heads

I made a ton of yo yo''s - No request for them

They want computers and robots...they think I''m IBM!

If you think that''s bad...just picture this

Try holding those brats...with their pants full of piss

They pull on my nose - they grab at my beard

And if I don''t smile..the parents think I''m weird

Flying through the air...dodging the trees

Falling down chimneys and skinning my knees

I''m quitting this job...there''s just no enjoyment

I''ll sit on my fat ass and draw unemployment

There''s no Christmas this year...now you know the reason

I found me a blonde.. I''m going SOUTH for the season!!

column1:
By Jeff Foxworthy

\n

''Twas the night after Christmas and all through the trailer
column2:
\n

the beer had gone flat and the pizza was staler.

\n

The tube socks hung empty
column3: no candies or toys
column4:
\n

and I was camped out on my old Lay-Z-Boy.

\n

The kids they weren''t talking to me or my wife
column5:
\n

the worst Christmas they said they had had in their lives.

\n

My wife couldn''t argue and neither could I
column6:
\n

so I watched TV and my wife
column7:
she just cried.

\n

When out in the yard the dog started barkin''
column8:
\n

I stood up and looked and I saw Sheriff Larkin.

\n

He yelled
column9:
"Roy I am sworn to uphold the laws

\n

and I got a complaint here from a feller named Claus."

\n

I said
column10: "Claus
column11: I don''t know nobody named Claus
column12:
\n

and you ain''t taking me in without probable cause."

\n

Then the Sheriff he said
column13:
"The man was shot at last night."

\n

I said
column14: "That might have been me
column15:
just what''s he look like?"

\n

The Sheriff replied
column16: "He''s a jolly old feller
column17: with a big beer gut belly
column18:
\n

that shakes when he laughs like a bowl full of jelly.

\n

He sports a long beard
column19:
and a nose like a cherry."

\n

I said
column20:
"Sheriff that sounds like my wife''s sister Sherri."

"It''s no time for jokes Roy" the Sheriff he said.

"The man I''m describing is dressed all in red.

I''m here for the truth now
column21:
it''s time to come clean.

\n

Tell me what you''ve done
column22:
tell me what you''ve seen."

\n

Well I started to lie then I thought what the hell
column23:
\n

it wouldn''t have been the first time that I''ve spent New Years in jail.

\n

I said
column24: "Sheriff it happened last night about ten
column25:
and I thought that my wife had been drinking again."

When she walked in from work she was as white as a ghost.

I thought maybe she had seen one of them UFO''s.

But she said that a bunch of deer had just flown over her head
column26:
\n

and stopped on the roof of our good neighbour Red.

\n

Well I ran outside to look and the sight made me shudder
column27:
\n

a freezer full of venison standing right on Red''s gutter.

\n

Well my hands were a shakin'' as I grabbed my gun
column28:
when outta Red''s chimney this feller did run.

And slung on his back was this bag over flowin''.

I thought he''d stolen Red''s stuff while old Red was out bowling''.

So I yelled
column29: "Drop fat boy
column30:
hands in the air!"

But he went about his business like he hadn''t a care.

So I popped a warning shot over his head.

Well he dropped that bag and he jumped in that sled.

And as he flew off I heard him extort
column31:
\n

"That''s assault with intent Roy
column32: I''ll see ya in court."

A golfer
column2: playing a round by himself
column3: is about to tee off
column4: and a greasy little salesman runs up to him
column5: and yells
column6: "Wait! Before you tee off
column7:
I have something really amazing to show you!"
The golfer
column8: annoyed
column9: says
column10:
"What is it?"

\n

"It''s a special golf ball
column11:
says the salesman. You can never lose it!"

\n

"Whattaya mean
column12:
scoffs the golfer, you can never lose it? What if you hit it into the water?"

\n

"No problem
column13: says the salesman. It floats
column14: and it detects where the shore is
column15:
and spins towards it."

\n

"Well
column16:
what if you hit it into the woods?"

\n

"Easy
column17: says the salesman. It emits a beeping sound
column18:
and you can find it with your eyes closed."

\n

"Okay
column19:
says the golfer, impressed. But what if your round goes late and it gets dark?"

\n

"No problem
column20: sir
column21: this golf ball glows in the dark! I''m telling you
column22:
you can never lose this golf ball!"

\n

The golfer buys it at once. "Just one question

he says to the salesman. Where did you get it?"

\n

"I found it."

but it seems you''ve hit puberty."

What job applicants really mean on their applications and resumes and in employment interviews

\n

"I KNOW HOW TO DEAL WITH STRESSFUL SITUATIONS:" I''m usually on Prozac.
When I''m not
column2:
I take lots of cigarette and coffee breaks.

"I SEEK A JOB THAT WILL DRAW UPON MY STRONG COMMUNICATION &
ORGANIZATIONAL SKILLS:" I talk too much and like to tell other
people what to do.

"I''M EXTREMELY ADEPT AT ALL MANNER OF OFFICE ORGANIZATION:" I''ve
used Microsoft Office.

"I''M HONEST
column3:
HARD-WORKING AND DEPENDABLE:" I pilfer office supplies.

"MY PERTINENT WORK EXPERIENCE INCLUDES:" I hope you don''t ask
me about all the McJobs I''ve had.

"I TAKE PRIDE IN MY WORK:" I blame others for my mistakes.

"I''M BALANCED AND CENTERED:" I''ll keep crystals at my desk and
do Tai Chi in the lunch room.

"I HAVE A SENSE OF HUMOR:" I know a lot of corny
column4:
old jokes
and I tell them badly.

\n

"I''M PERSONABLE:" I give lots of unsolicited personal
advice to co-workers.

\n

"I''M WILLING TO RELOCATE:" As I leave San Quentin
column5:
anywhere''s better.

"I''M EXTREMELY PROFESSIONAL:" I carry a Day-Timer.

"MY BACKGROUND AND SKILLS MATCH YOUR REQUIREMENTS:" You''re probably
looking for someone more experienced.

"I AM ADAPTABLE:" I''ve changed jobs a lot.

"I AM ON THE GO:" I''m never at my desk.

"I''M HIGHLY MOTIVATED TO SUCCEED:" The minute I find a better job.
I''m outta there.

"I HAVE FORMAL TRAINING:" I''m a college drop-out.

"I INTERACT WELL WITH CO-WORKERS:" I''ve been accused of
sexual harassment.

"THANK YOU FOR YOUR TIME AND CONSIDERATION:" Wait! Don''t throw me away!

"I LOOK FORWARD TO HEARING FROM YOU SOON:" Like
column6:
I''m gonna hold
my breath waiting for your stupid form letter thanking me for my
interest and wishing me luck in my future career.

The animals were bored.  Finally
column2: the lion had an idea.  "I know a really exciting game that the humans play called football.  I''ve seen it on T.V."He proceeded to describe it to the rest of the animals and they all got excited about it so they decided to play.  They went out to the field and chose up teams and were ready to begin.The lion''s team received.  They were able to get two first downs and then had to punt.  The mule punted and the rhino was back deep for the kick.  He caught the ball
column3: lowered his head and charged. First
column4: he crushed a roadrunner
column5: then two rabbits.  He gored a wildebeast
column6: knocked over two cows
column7: and broke through to daylight
column8: scoring six.Unfortunately
column9: they lacked a placekicker
column10: and the score remained 6 - 0.Late in the first half the lion''s team scored a touchdown and the mule kicked the extra point.  The lion''s team led at halftime 7 - 6.  In the locker room
column11: the lion gave a peptalk."Look you guys.  We can win this game.  We''ve got the lead and they only have one real threat.  We''ve got to keep the ball away from the rhino
column12: he''s a killer. Mule
column13: when you kick off be sure to keep it away from the rhino."The second half began.  Just as the mule was about to kick off
column14: the rhino''s team changed formation and the ball went directly to the rhino.  Once again
column15: the rhino lowered his head and was off running.  First
column16: he stomped two gazelles.  He skewered a zebra
column17: and bulldozed an elephant out of the way.  It looked like he was home free.  Suddenly at the twenty yard line
column18: he dropped over dead.  There were no other animals in sight anywhere near him. The lion went over to see what had happened.  Right next to the dead rhino he saw a small centipede."Did you do this?" he asked the centipede."Yeah
column19: I did." the centipede replied.The lion retorted
column20: "Where were you during the first half?""I was putting on my shoes."

column1:
High school boys afflicted with spring fever skipped morning classes. After
lunch they reported to the teacher that they had a flat tire.
Much to their relief she smiled and said: "Well
column2:
you missed a test today so
take seats apart from one another and take out a piece of paper."
Still smiling
column3:
she waited for them to sit down. Then she said:
"First Question: Which tire was flat?"

column1: There were two old guys
column2: Abe and Sol
column3: sitting on a bench in a park feeding pigeons and talking about baseball
column4: just like they did every day. Abe turns to Sol and says
column5: "Do you think there''s baseball in heaven?"Soloman thinks about it for a minute and replies
column6: "I dunno
column7: Abe. But let''s make a deal: If I die first
column8: I will come back and tell you -- and if you die first
column9: you come back and tell me -- if there is baseball in heaven."They shake on it and
column10: sadly
column11: a few months later poor Abe passes on. One day soon afterward
column12: Sol is sitting there feeding the pigeons by himself when he hears a voice whisper
column13: "Sol... Sol...."Sol responds
column14: "Abe! Is that you?""Yes it is Sol
column15: whispers the spirit of Abe.Sol, still amazed, asks, So
column16: is there baseball in heaven?""Well
column17: says Abe says, I got good news and I got bad news.""Gimme the good news first
column18: says Sol.Abe says, Well... there is baseball in heaven."Sol says
column19: "That''s great! What news could be bad enough to ruin that!?"Abe sighs and whispers
column20: "You''re pitching on Friday."

column1: There were three people stranded on an island
column2: a brunette
column3: a redhead
column4: and a blonde. The brunette looked over the water to the mainland and estimated about 20 miles to shore. So she announced
column5: "I''m going to try to swim to shore." So she swam out five miles
column6: and got really tired. She swam out ten miles from the island
column7: and she was too tired to go on
column8:
so she drowned.

\n

The second one
column9: the redhead
column10: said to herself
column11: "I wonder if she made it. I guess it''s better to try to get to the mainland than stay here and starve." So she attempts to swim out. The redhead had a lot more endurance than the brunette
column12: as she swam out 10 miles before she even got tired. After 15 miles
column13: she was too tired to go on
column14:
so she drowned.

\n

So the blonde thought to herself
column15: "I wonder if they made it! I think I''d better try to make it
column16: too." So she swam out 5 miles
column17: ten miles
column18: 15 miles
column19: NINETEEN miles from the island. The shore was just in sight
column20: but she said
column21:
"I''m too tired to go on!" So she swam back.

\n

There are more jokes like this at http://www.humorshack.com

column1:
If Santa answered his mail honestly...

\n

----------
Dear Santa
I wud like a kool toy space ranjur fer Xmas. Iv bena gud boy all
yeer.
Yer Frend
column2:
BiLLy

\n

Dear Billy
column3:
Nice spelling. You''re on your way to a career in lawn care. How
about I send you a fucking book so you can learn to read and
write? I''m giving your older brother the space ranger. At least
HE can spell!
Santa

\n

----------
Dear Santa
column4: I have been a good girl all year
column5:
and the only thing I ask for
is peace and joy in the world for everybody!
Love
column6:
Sarah

\n

Dear Sarah
column7: You''re parents smoked pot when they had you
column8:
didn''t they?
Santa

\n

----------
Dear Santa
column9: I don''t know if you can do this
column10: but for Christmas
column11:
I''d like for
my mommy and daddy to get back together. Please see what you can
do.
Love
column12:
Teddy

\n

Dear Teddy
column13: Look
column14:
your dad''s banging the babysitter like a screen door in a
hurricane. Do you think he''s gonna give that up to come back to
your fat mom
column15:
who rides his ass constantly? It''s time to give up
that dream. Let me get you some nice Legos instead.
Santa

\n

----------
Dear Santa
column16: I want a new bike
column17: a Playstation
column18: a train
column19: some G.I. Joes
column20:
a
dog
column21: a drum kit
column22:
a pony and a tuba.
Love
column23:
Francis

\n

Dear Francis
column24:
Who names their kid "Francis" nowadays? I bet you''re gay.
Santa

\n

----------
Dear Santa
column25: I left milk and cookies for you under the tree
column26:
and I left
carrots for your reindeer outside the back door.
Love
column27:
Susan

\n

Dear Susan
column28:
Milk gives me the runs and carrots make the deer fart in my face
when riding in the sleigh. You want to do me a favor? Leave me a
bottle of scotch.
Santa

\n

----------

\n

Dear Santa
column29:
What do you do the other 364 days of the year? Are you busy
making toys?
Your friend
column30:
Thomas

\n

Dear Thomas
column31: All the toys are made in China. I have a condo in Vegas
column32:
where I
spend most of my time making low-budget porno films. I unwind by
drinking myself silly and squeezing the asses of cocktail
waitresses while losing money at the craps table. Hey
column33:
you
wanted to know.
Santa

\n

----------
Dear Santa
column34: Do you see us when we''re sleeping
column35:
do you really know when we''re
awake
column36:
like in the song?
Love
column37:
Jessica

\n

Dear Jessica
column38:
Are you really that gullible? Good luck in whatever you do. I''m
skipping your house.
Santa

\n

----------
Dear Santa
column39:
I really really want a puppy this year. Please please please
PLEASE PLEASE could I have one?
Timmy

\n

Timmy
column40: That whiney begging shit may work with your folks
column41:
but that crap
doesn''t work with me. You''re getting a sweater again.
Santa

\n

----------
Dearest Santa
column42: We don''t have a chimney in our house
column43:
how do you get into our
home?
Love
column44:
Marky

\n

Mark
column45: First
column46: stop calling yourself "Marky"
column47:
that''s why you''re getting
your ass whipped at school. Second
column48: you don''t live in a house
column49: you live in a low-rent apartment complex. Third
column50:
I get inside
your pad just like all the burglars do
column51:
through your bedroom
window.
Sweet Dreams
column52: Santa

column1:
Here are some basic descriptions of what may happen if airplanes had different
operating systems running them.

\n

DOS: Everybody pushes it till it glides
column2:
then jumps on and lets it coast till
it skids
column3: then jumps off
column4: pushes
column5: jumps back on
column6:
etc.

\n

DOS with QEMM: Same as DOS
column7:
but with more leg room for pushing.

\n

Macintosh: All the flight attendants
column8:
captains and baggage handlers look the
same
column9: act the same and talk the same. Every time you ask a question
column10:
you are
told you don''t need to know
column11:
don''t want to know and everything will be done for
you without your knowing
column12:
so just shut up.

\n

OS/2: To get on board
column13:
you have to have your ticket stamped 10 different times
by standing in 10 different lines. Then you fill out a form asking how you want
your seating arranged--with the look and feel of an ocean liner
column14:
a passenger
train or a bus. If you get on board and off the ground
column15:
you will have a
wonderful trip
column16: except when the rudder and flaps freeze
column17:
in which case you have
time to say your prayers before you crash.

\n

Windows: Colorful airport terminal
column18: friendly flight attendants
column19:
easy access to
a plane
column20: and an uneventful takeoff. Then
column21: all in a sudden
column22:
boom! You blow up
without any warning whatsoever.

\n

NT: The terminal and flight attendants all look like those the Windows plane
uses
column23:
but the process of checking in and going through security is a nightmare.
Once aboard
column24:
those passengers with first class tickets can go anywhere they want
and arrive in half the time
column25:
while the vast majority of passengers with coach
tickets can''t even get aboard.

\n

Unix: Everyone brings one piece of the plane. Then they go on the runway and
piece it together
column26:
all the while arguing about what kind of plane they''re
building.

\n

CAIRO: The airplane is distributed among 47 different hangars in 13
airports scattered over 8 states
column27: 4 Canadian provinces
column28:
and a remote mountain
hideaway in Nicaragua. But you don''t need to know where the airplane is or who
it belongs to in order to fly it. Actually
column29:
you don''t fly the airplane itself;
you fly a simulation that behaves just like the real thing except that you don''t
go anywhere. But that''s okay
column30:
because when the world is at your fingertips you
never need to leave home.

Answers Given By Students To Test Questions On The Bible:

The first book of the Bible is Guinessis.

Noah''s wife was called Joan of Ark.

Lot''s wife was a pillar of salt by day

The Egyptians were all drowned in the dessert. Afterward

The Fifth Commandment is humor thy mother and father.
(I used this one alot when I was a kid...wait...I still do!)

The Seventh Commandment is thou shalt not admit adultery.
(Used by Bill Clinton...Monica who?)

Moses died before he ever reached the UK.

Joshua led the Hebrews in the Battle of Geritol.

The greatest miracle in the Bible is when Joshua told his son to stand still

a race of people who lived in the Biblical times.

Solomon had 300 wives and 700 porcupines.

The Jews were a proud people and

column1: A middle-aged woman enters her family doctor''s office in a frantic state. She says
column2: "Doctor
column3: I think I''m turning into a horse!"The doctor
column4: taken aback
column5: replies
column6: "I''m sure you may have SOME problem
column7: but I assure you no human has ever turned into a horse."The woman became more insistent and said
column8: "Doctor
column9: look at my teeth. They''re getting bigger and more yellow!"The doctor calmly replied
column10: "Yes
column11: I see. Your teeth appear a bit larger and more yellow than your last visit
column12: but I don''t think you''re turning into a horse."Getting more frustrated
column13: the woman said
column14: "Well
column15: I think I''m getting a mane! Look at all this hair on the back of my neck. It''s grown 5 inches in ONE WEEK!"Becoming more concerned
column16: the doctor said
column17: "You''re NOT turning into a horse. We''ll just shave your neck occasionally."At this point the woman became considerably frustrated
column18: speaking faster and louder. "Just look at my finger and toe nails! They''ve become very thick and big. I''m developing HOOVES!"The doctor in amazement cried
column19: "Holy cow! I''ve never seen finger and toe nails THAT big!"Then the woman pulls up the back of her skirt and said
column20: "And look at this
column21: doctor. My backbone is protruding significantly from my butt!"The doctor looked in amazement
column22: then started scribbling on a small piece of paper.The woman asked
column23: "Are you writing me a prescription?"The doctor said
column24: "No. I''m writing a memo to my brother-in-law. He works at City Hall. Take this to him and he''ll give you a permit to take a dump in the street!"

column1: If you are not familiar with golf
column2:
you probably won''t get these. Ask your closest golf player.

\n

1. Never try to keep more than 300 separate thoughts in your mind during your swing.

\n

2. When your shot has to carry over a water hazard
column3:
you can either hit one more club or two more balls.

\n

3. If you are afraid a full shot might reach the green while the group ahead are still putting
column4: you have two options: you can immediately shank a lay-up
column5:
or you can wait until the green is clear and top a ball halfway there.

\n

4. The less skilled the player
column6:
the more likely he is to share his ideas about the golf swing.

\n

5. If it isn''t broke
column7:
try changing your grip.

6. Golfers who claim they don''t cheat also lie.

7. Everyone replaces his divot after a perfect approach shot.

8. A golf match is a test of your skill against your opponent''s luck.

9. It''s surprisingly easy to sink a 50 foot putt when you lie.

10. Counting on your opponent to inform you when he breaks a rule is like expecting him to make fun of his own haircut.

11. Nonchalant putts count the same as chalant putts.

12. It''s not a gimme putt if you''re still away.

13. The shortest distance between any two points on a golf course is a straight line that passes directly through the large tree.

14. There are two kinds of bounces: unfair bounces and bounces just the way you intended to play it.

15. You can hit a two-acre fairway 10% of the time and a 2-inch branch on a tree 90% of the time.

16. Every time a golfer makes a birdie he must subsequently make three triple bogeys to restore the fundamental equilibrium of the universe.

17. If you want to hit a 7-iron as far as Tiger Woods try to hit just short of a water hazard.

18. To calculate the speed of a player''s downswing
column8: multiply the speed of his backswing by his handicap. Example
column9: backswing 20 miles per hour
column10: handicap
column12:
downswing 300
m.p.h.

\n

19. There are two things you can learn by stopping your backswing at the top and checking the position of your hands: how many hands you have
column13:
and which hand is wearing
the golf glove.

\n

20. Hazards attract; Fairways repel.

\n

21. You can put "draw" on the ball
column14: you can put "fade" on the ball
column15:
but no golfer can put "straight" on the ball.

\n

22. A ball you can see in the rough from 50 yards away is not yours.

\n

23. If there is a ball in the fringe and a ball in the bunker
column16:
your ball is in the bunker.

\n

24. If both balls are in the sand
column17:
yours is in the footprint.

\n

25. Don''t buy a putter until you have had a chance to throw it.

\n

26. The inevitable result of any golf lesson is the instant elimination of the one critical unconscious motion that allowed you to compensate for all your errors.

column1:
1:00 AM: Alarm clock rings.
2:00 AM: Hunting partners arrive
column2:
drag you out of bed.
2:30 AM: Throw everything except kitchen sink into pickup.
3:00 AM: Leave for deep woods.
3:15 AM: Drive back home to pick up gun.
3:30 AM: Drive like crazy to get to the woods before daylight.
4:00 AM: Set up camp. Forgot the stupid tent.
4:30 AM: Head for the woods.
6:05 AM: See eight deer.
6:06 AM: Take aim and squeeze trigger.
6:07 AM: CLICK.
6:08 AM: Load gun while watching deer go over hill.
8:00 AM: Head back to camp.
9:00 AM: Still looking for camp.
10:00 AM: Realize that you don''t know where camp is.
NOON : Fire gun for help---eat wild berries.
2:15 PM: Run out of bullets---eight deer come back.
2:20 PM: Strange feeling in stomach.
2:30 PM: Realize that you ate poison berries.
2:45 PM: Rescued.
2:55 PM: Rushed to hospital to have stomach pumped
column3:
throw up instead.
3:15 PM: Arrive back at camp.
3:30 PM: Leave camp to kill deer.
4:00 PM: Return to camp for bullets.
4:01 PM: Load gun---leave camp again.
5:00 PM: Empty gun on bug that is bugging you.
6:00 PM: Arrive at camp -- see deer grazing.
6:01 PM: Load gun.
6:02 PM: Fire gun.
6:03 PM: One dead pickup.
6:05 PM: Hunting partners arrive in camp dragging deer.
6:06 PM: Repress desire to shoot hunting partners.
6:07 PM: Fall into fire.
6:10 PM: Change clothing
column4:
throw burned ones in fire.
6:15 PM: Take pickup
column5:
leave hunting partners and deer in camp.
6:25 PM: Pickup boils over due to hole shot in block.
6:26 PM: Start walking.
6:30 PM: Stumble and fall
column6:
drop gun in mud.
6:35 PM: Meet bear.
6:36 PM: Take aim.
6:37 PM: Fire gun

One morning he had played the first hole and was just about to tee off on the second, when he saw the most gorgeous woman he had ever seen putting on the first.

The man waited until the woman had reached the second tee and asked if she would like to join him and they could finish the round together. To his surprise the woman agreed and they played the remaining holes. Not only was this woman beautiful, she was also a good golfer. When they completed their round, the man told the woman that he was a cordon bleu chef and wine buff.

He invited her back to his place for a meal and a few drinks. The woman accepted enthusiastically and off they went. Back at the house the man cooked a magnificent meal. In fact it was more than just cooking it was a performance do behold. They enjoyed good food, good wine and good conversation. The man was so taken by the beauty and skill of this woman and desired her no end.

He then asked if she would like to play golf the following morning, to which she agreed. Once again they enjoyed a great game of golf, a magnificent evening meal. This went on for three weeks when the lawyer finally said to the woman, Listen

Why not?" came the reply.

column8: captains and baggage handlers look the same
column9: act the same and talk the same.  Every time you ask a question

column11: don''t want to know and everything will be done for you without your knowing
column12: so just shut up.OS/2:  To get on board
column13: you have to have your ticket stamped 10 different times by standing in 10 different lines.  Then you fill out a form asking how you want your seating arranged--with the look and feel of an ocean liner
column14: a passenger train or a bus.  If you get on board and off the ground

column16: except when the rudder and flaps freeze

column21: all in a sudden

column25: while the vast majority of passengers with coach tickets can''t even get aboard.Unix:  Everyone brings one piece of the plane.  Then they go on the runway and piece it together

column1: My Dear Husband
column2:
\n

I am sending you this letter via this BBS communications thing
column3: so that you will be sure to read it. Please forgive the deception
column4:
but I thought you should know what has been going on at home since your computer entered our lives TWO YEARS AGO.

\n

The children are doing well. Tommy is seven now and is a bright
column5: handsome boy. He has developed quite an interest in the arts. He drew a family portrait for a school project
column6: all the figures were good
column7:
and the back of your head is very realistic. You should be very proud of him.

\n

Little Jennifer turned three in September. She looks a lot like you did at that age. She is an attractive child and quite smart. She still remembers that you spent the whole afternoon with us on her birthday. What a grand day for Jenny
column8:
despite the fact that it was stormy and the electricity was out.

\n

I am doing well. I went blonde about a year ago
column9: and discovered that it really is more fun! George
column10: I mean
column11: Mr. Wilson the department head
column12: has uh
column13:
taken an interest in my career and has become a good friend to us all.

\n

I discovered that the household chores are much easier since I realized that you didn''t mind being vacuumed but that feather dusting made you sneeze. The house is in good shape. I had the living room painted last spring; I''m sure you noticed it. I made sure that the painters cut holes in the drop sheet so you wouldn''t be disturbed.

\n

Well
column14: my dear
column15: I must be going. Uncle George
column16: uh
column17: Mr. Wilson
column18: I mean
column19: is taking us all on a ski trip and there is packing to do. I have hired a housekeeper to take care of things while we are away
column20: she''ll keep things in order
column21: fill your coffee cup and bring your meals to your desk
column22:
just the way you like it.

\n

I hope you and the computer will have a lovely time while we are gone. Tommy
column23:
Jenny and I will think of you often. Try to remember us while your disks are booting.

\n

Love
column24:
\n

Your Wife

column1: There were two men who played golf together frequently. One was several strokes better than the other. The lesser player was very proud
column2:
and never wanted to take any strokes to even up the game.
One Saturday morning
column3: he shows up with a gorilla at the first tee. He says to his friend
column4: "I''ve been trying to beat you for so long that I''m about ready to give up. But
column5: I heard about this golfing gorilla
column6: and I was wondering if it would be alright if he plays for me today. In fact if you''re game

I''d like to try to get back all the money I''ve lost to you this year. I figure comes to about a thousand bucks. Are you willing?"

The other guy thought about it for a minute
column8: and then decided to play the gorilla. "After all
column9:
how good could a gorilla be at golf?" he thought.

\n

Well

column13: right at the pin
column14:
stopping about 6 inches away from the hole.

column15: I would have never believed it if I hadn''t seen it with my own eyes. But
column16: you know what
column17: I''ve seen enough. I''ve got no interest in being totally humiliated by this gorilla golfing machine. You send this frigging gorilla back to where he comes from. I need a drink; better make it a double
column18:
and I''ll write you a check."

After handing over the check

column20: "By the way
column21:
how''s that gorilla''s putting?"

The other guy replies
column22:
"Same as his driving."

\n

"That good
column23:
huh?"

"No
column24: I mean
column25: he hits putts the same way - 450 yards
column26: right down the middle!"

column1:
Signs from hotels and from around the world:

In a Tokyo hotel:
Is forbidden to steal hotel towels please. If you are not a person to do such a thing please not to read notis.

In a Bucharest hotel lobby:
The lift is being fixed for the next day. During that time we regret that you will be unbearable.

In a Leipzig elevator:
Do not enter lift backwards
column2:
and only when lit up.

\n

In a Belgrade hotel elevator:
To move the cabin
column3: push button for wishing floor. If the cabin should enter more persons
column4:
each one should press a number of wishing floor. Driving is then going alphabetically by national order.

In a Bangkok drycleaners:
Drop your trousers here for best results.

In a Japanese hotel:
You are invited to take advantage of the chambermaid.

In an Austrian hotel catering to skiers:
Not to perambulate the corridors during the hours of repose in the boots of Ascension.

In a Yugoslav hotel:
The flattening of underwear with pleasure is the job of the chambermaid.

On the menu of a Swiss restaurant:
Our wines leave you nothing to hope for.

On the menu of a Polish hotel:
Salad a firm''s own make; limpid red beet soup with cheesy dumplings in the form of a finger; roasted duck let loose; beef rashers beaten up in the country people''s fashion.

Outside a Hong Kong tailor''s shop:
Ladies may have a fit upstairs.

Outside a Paris dress shop:
Dresses for street walking.

39. Always

column5: they also have to take a shot.- If the photo of the SWAT "gunman" is shown

column7: everyone must press their palms together and make a swimming move with their hands. column8: everyone must shout

A count is made of how many players said each name. Everyone who called out the more popular name has to take a drink of beer.- Whenever the station goes "live to Little Havana" everyone must stand up and dance. The last person on their feet has to do a shot.- If Marisleysis is shown crying everyone must yell "knock it off" and then take a drink of beer.- If Juan Miguel Gonzales is shown carrying his "other son" everyone must yell "wahhhhh" like a baby for as long as they can on one breath. The last person to stop gets to pick a person to do a shot.- If Elian Gonzales returns to Cuba with his father
column10: everyone shouts "Thank God." The game is then over.

column2:

full scholarship to medical school.

\n

* Then there was the golfer who was sentenced to be hanged. He
asked the warden if he could take a few practice swings first.

\n

* Just think guys
column3:
a golfer can spend the entire weekend with a
bunch of "hookers" and his wife isn''t the least bit concerned.

\n

* Basically
column4:
golf has made more liars out of Americans than all
of the income tax forms ever filed.

* Contrary to popular belief avid golfers do not lie all the
time. Anytime one golfer calls another a "liar" they''re probably
telling the truth.

* Some people just have to cheat all the time when it comes to
recording the number of strokes on their golf cards. I knew one
fellow who got a hole-in-one and entered "zero" on his card.

* Although not condoned

secretary said

column8: I asked
column9:

me

rich who could not meet the academic requirements of any other college. Lo and
behold
column2:
the college basketball team wins every game and dominates their league.
All this success is due to one amazing player - a cross betwen Larry Bird and
Michael Jordan.
This kid is terrific. The player and the team become the center of nationwide
media attention. The student body is thrilled. Now
column3:
the NCAA goes to the college
and asks for proof of this player''s academic eligibility. The college
administration promises such documentation in a few days. The faculty works
night and day coaching the student for the crucial test.
The day of the public examinatin arrives
column4:
and the entire student body is there
to support their star player. A professor stands

and announces the first
question
column6:
"How much is five and two?" The student frowns in deep concentration -
he thinks
column7: he sweats
column8: he shakes with effort. At last he shouts the answer
column9: "SEVEN". The entire student body rises
column10: and as a single voice
column11:
they cry. "Give
him another chance. Give him another chance".

column1:
It''s that time of year once again...Time for this year''s Darwin Awards

\n

First Place - Candidate for this years Darwin Awards. When his 38-caliber revolver failed to fire at his intended victim during a holdup in Long Beach
column2: California
column3:
would be robber James Elliot did something that can only inspire wonder: He peered down into the barrel and tried the trigger again. This time it worked.

\n

And now
column4:
the honorable mentions:

\n

The chef at a hotel in Switzerland lost a finger in a meat cutting machine and
column5: after a little hopping around
column6: submitted a claim to his insurance company. The company
column7: suspecting negligence
column8:
sent out one of its men to have a look for himself. He tried the machine out and lost a finger. The chef''s claim was approved.

\n

A man who shoveled snow for an hour to clear a space for his car during a blizzard in Chicago returned with his vehicle to find a woman had taken the space. Understandably
column9:
he shot her.

\n

After stopping for drinks at an illegal bar
column10: a Zimbabwean bus driver found that the 20 mental patients he was supposed to be transporting from Harare to Beltway had escaped. Not wanting to admit his incompetence
column11: the driver went to a nearby bus stop and offered everyone waiting there a free ride. He then delivered the passengers to the mental hospital
column12:
telling the staff that the patients were very excitable and prone to bizarre fantasies. The deception wasn''t discovered for 3 days.

\n

column13:
the lad told police that he was simply trying to see how close he could get his head to a moving train before he was hit.

was a crime committed?)

column21: "FREEZE
column22: MOTHER-STICKERS
column23: THIS IS A FUCK-UP!" For a moment

column25:
because he''d been about to draw his gun. He couldn''t have drawn and fired before the thief got him. The thief ran away and is still at large.

\n

column26: grab some booze
column27: and run. So he lifted the cinderblock and heaved it over his head at the window. The cinderblock bounced back and hit the would-be thief on the head
column28:

\n

column32: "Yes
column33: officer
column34:
that''s her. That''s the lady I stole the purse from."

\n

column35: Michigan

column37: flashed a gun
column38: and demanded cash. The clerk turned him down because he said he couldn''t open the cash register without a food order. When the man ordered onion rings

column40: frustrated

walked away.

column42: though
column43: they pulled the bumper off their truck. Scared
column44:
they left the scene and drove home.

\n

With the chain still attached to the machine. With their bumper still attached to the chain. With their vehicle''s license plate still attached to the bumper. They were quickly arrested.

\n

A 5-STAR STUPIDITY AWARD WINNER!
When a man attempted to siphon gasoline from a motor home parked on a Seattle street
column45: he got much more than he bargained for. Police arrived at the scene to find an ill man curled up next to a motor home near spilled sewage. A police spokesman said that the man admitted to trying to steal gasoline and plugged his siphon hose into the motor home''s sewage tank by mistake. The owner of the vehicle declined to press charges

The woman rushed down to the man and immediately began to apologize. She then explained that she was a physical therapist: "Please allow me to help. I''m a physical therapist and I know I could relieve your pain if you''d just allow me!" she told him earnestly.

"Ummph
column5: oooh

But she persisted, and he finally allowed her to help. She gently took his hands away and laid them to the side, loosened his pants and put her hands inside, beginning to massage him.

\n

How does that feel?" she asked. "It feels great." He replied. "But my thumb still hurts like the dickens!".
