column1: ''The Xmas-Files''by Frank Cammuso and Hart Seely  57 Elm Street Bethlehem
column3: December 24th.''We''re too late! It''s already been here.'' ''Mulder
column4: I hope you know what you''re doing.'' ''Look
column5: Scully
column6: just like the other homes: Douglas fir
column7: truncated
column8: mounted
column9: transformed into a shrine; halls decked with boughs of holly; stockings hung by the chimney
column10: with care.'' ''You really think someone''s been here?'' ''Someone
column11: or something.'' ''Mulder
column12: over here--it''s a fruitcake.'' ''Don''t touch it! Those things can be lethal.'' ''It''s O.K. There''s a note attached: ''Gonna find out who''s naughty and nice.'''' ''It''s judging them
column13: Scully. It''s making a list.'' ''Who? What are you talking about?'' ''Ancient mythology tells of an obese humanoid entity who could travel at  great speed in a craft powered by antlered servants. Once a year
column14: near the winter solstice
column15: this creature is said to descend from the heavens to reward its followers and punish disbelievers with jagged chunks of anthracite.'' ''But that''s legend
column16: Mulder--a story told by parents to frighten children. Surely you don''t believe it?'' ''Something was here tonight
column17: Scully. Check out the bite marks on this gingerbread man. Whatever tore through this plate of cookies was massive--and in a hurry.'' ''It left crumbs everywhere. And look
column18: Mulder
column19: this milk glass has been completely drained.'' ''It gorged itself
column20: Scully. It fed without remorse.'' ''But why would they leave it milk and cookies?'' ''Appeasement. Tonight is the Eve
column21: and nothing can stop its wilding.'' ''But if this thing does exist
column22: how did it get in? The doors and windows were locked. There''s no sign of forced entry.'' ''Unless I miss my guess
column23: it came through the fireplace.'' ''Wait a minute
column24: Mulder. If you''re saying some huge creature landed on the roof and came down this chimney
column25: you''re crazy. The flue is barely six inches wide. Nothing could get down there.'' ''But what if it could alter its shape
column26: move in all directions at once?'' ''You mean
column27: like a bowl full of jelly?'' ''Exactly. Scully
column28: I''ve never told anyone this
column29: but when I was a child my home was visited. I saw the creature. It had long white shanks of fur surrounding its ruddy
column30: misshapen head. Its bloated torso was red and white. I''ll never forget the horror. I turned away
column31: and when I looked back it had somehow taken on the facial features of my father.'' ''Impossible.'' ''I know what I saw. And that night it read my mind. It brought me a Mr. Potato Head
column32: Scully. It knew that I wanted a Mr. Potato Head!'' ''I''m sorry
column33: Mulder
column34: but you''re asking me to disregard the laws of physics. You want me to believe in some supernatural being who soars across the skies and brings gifts to good little girls and boys. Listen to what you''re saying. Do you understand the repercussions? If this gets out
column35: they''ll close the X-files.'' ''Scully
column36: listen to me: It knows when you''re sleeping. It knows when you''re awake.'' ''But we have no proof.'' ''Last year
column37: on this exact date
column38: SETI radio telescopes detected bogeys in the airspace over twenty-seven states. The White House ordered a Condition Red.'' ''But that was a meteor shower.'' ''Officially. Two days ago
column39: eight prized Scandinavian reindeer vanished from the National Zoo
column40: in Washington
column41: D.C. Nobody--not even the zookeeper--was told about it. The government doesn''t want people to know about Project Kringle. They fear that if this thing is proved to exist the public will stop spending half its annual income in a holiday shopping frenzy. Retail markets will collapse. Scully
column42: they cannot let the world believe this creature lives. There''s too much at stake. They''ll do whatever it takes to insure another silent night.'' ''Mulder
column43: I--'' ''Sh-h-h. Do you hear what I hear?'' ''On the roof. It sounds like ... a clatter.'' ''The truth is up there. Let''s see what''s the matter.''

column1:
DETROIT--With third-quarter sales sluggish and its share of the domestic
market down 11 percent since 1993
column2:
General Motors unveiled a new instant-win
airbag contest Monday. The new airbags
column3:
which award fabulous prizes upon
violent
column4: high-speed impact with another car or stationary object
column5:
will come
standard in all of the company''s 1997 cars.

\n

"Auto accidents have never been so exciting
column6:
said GM vice-president of
marketing Roger Jenkins, who expects the contest to boost 1997 sales
significantly. When you play the new GM Instant Win Airbag Game
column7:
your next
fatal collision could mean a trip for two to Super Bowl XXXI in New Orleans. Or
a year''s worth of free Mobil gasoline."

\n

Though it does not officially begin until Jan. 1
column9:
the airbag
promotion is already being tested in select cities
column10:
with feedback overwhelmingly
positive. "As soon as my car started to skid out of control
column11:
I thought to
myself
column12: ''Oh
column13: boy
column14:
this could be it--I could be a big winner!''" said Cincinnati''s
Martin Frelks
column15:
who lost his wife but won $50 Sunday when the Buick LeSabre they
were driving hit an oil slick at 60 mph and slammed into an oncoming truck.
"When the car stopped rolling down the embankment
column16: I knew Ellen was dead
column17:
but
all I could think about was getting the blood and glass out of my eyes so I
could read that airbag!"

\n

Hartford
column18: CT
column19:
resident Jonathan Ryerson was killed Sunday when his 1997
Pontiac LeMans hit a freight train. Ryerson won $50 in the accident. "It''s
really addictive
column20:
said Sacramento, CA, resident Marjorie Kamp, speaking from
her hospital bed, where she is listed in critical condition with severe brain
hemorrhaging and a punctured right lung. I''ve already crashed four cars trying
to win those Super Bowl tickets
column21: but I still haven''t won. I swear
column22:
I''m going to
win those tickets--even if it kills me!"

\n

Kamp said that as soon as she is well enough
column23:
she plans to buy a new
Pontiac Bonneville and drive it into a tree. GM officials are not surprised the
airbag contest has been so well received. "In the past
column24:
nobody really liked car
wrecks
column25: and that''s understandable. After all
column26: they''re scary and dangerous and
column27: sometimes
column28: even fatal
column29: GM CEO Paul Offerman said. But now
column30:
when you drive a
new GM car or truck
column31:
your next serious crash could mean serious cash. Who
wouldn''t like that?"

\n

Offerman added that in the event a motorist wins a prize but is killed
column32:
that prize will be awarded to the next of kin. According to GM''s official
contest rules
column33: odds of winning the grand prize
column34:
a brand-new 1997 Cutlass
Supreme
column35: are 1 in 43
column37: 000. Statistical experts
column38: however
column39:
say the real chances
of winning are significantly worse. "If you factor in the odds of getting in a
serious car accident in the first place--approximately 1 in 720
column40:
000--the actual
odds of winning a prize each time you step in your car are more like 1 in 31
trillion." Further
column41: even if one is in an accident
column42:
there is no guarantee the
airbag will inflate. "I was recently broadsided by a drunk driver in my new
Chevy Cavalier
column43: said Erie, PA, resident Jerry Polaner. My car was totaled
column44:
and
because it was the side of my car that got hit
column45:
my airbag didn''t even inflate.
But what really gets me is the fact that the drunk driver
column46:
who rammed my side
with the front of his 1997 Buick Regal
column47:
won a $100 Office Depot gift
certificate. That''s just wrong."

Martha Stewart vs Me...

\n

Martha''s way: Stuff a miniature marshmallow in the bottom of a sugar cone to prevent ice cream drips.
My way: Just suck the ice cream out of the bottom of the cone
column2: for Pete''s sake
column3:
you are probably lying on the couch with your feet up eating it anyway.

\n

Martha''s way: Use a meat baster to "squeeze" your pancake batter onto the hot griddle and you''ll get perfectly shape pancakes every time.
My way: Buy the precooked kind you nuke in the microwave for 30 seconds. The hard part is getting them out of the plastic bag.

\n

Martha''s way: To keep potatoes from budding
column4:
place an apple in thebag with the potatoes.
My way: Buy Hungry Jack mashed potato mix and keep it in the pantry for up to a year.

\n

Martha''s way: To prevent egg shells from cracking
column5:
add a pinch of salt to the water before hard boiling.
My way: Who cares if they crack
column6:
aren''t you going to take the shells off anyway?

\n

Martha''s way: To get the most juice out of fresh lemons
column7:
bring them to room temperature and roll them under your palm against the kitchen counter before squeezing.
My way: Sleep with the lemons in between the mattress and box springs.

\n

Martha''s way: To easily remove burnt-on food from your skillet
column8: simply add a drop or two of dish soap and enough water to cover bottom of pan
column9:
and bring to a boil on stovetop.
My way: Eat at Chili''s every night and avoid cooking.

\n

Martha''s way: Spray your Tupperware with nonstick cooking spray before pouring in tomato based sauces and there won''t be any stains.
My way: Feed your garbage disposal and there won''t be any leftovers.

\n

Martha''s way: When a cake recipe calls for flouring the baking pan
column10:
use a bit of the dry cake mix instead and there won''t be any white mess on the outside of the cake.
My way: Go to the bakery. They''ll even decorate it for you.

\n

Martha''s way: If you accidentally over salt a dish while it''s still cooking
column11:
drop in a peeled potato and it will absorb the excess salt for an instant "fix me up"
My way: If you over salt a dish while you are cooking
column12:
that''s too damn bad.
My motto: I made it and you will eat it and I don''t care how bad it tastes.

Martha''s way: Wrap celery in aluminum foil when putting in the refrigerator and it will keep for weeks.
My way: Celery? Never heard of the stuff.

Martha''s way: Brush some beaten egg white over pie crust before baking to yield a beautiful glossy finish.
My way: The Mrs. Smith frozen pie directions do not include brushing egg whites over the crust and so I don''t do it.

Martha''s way: Place a slice of apple inhardened brown sugar to soften it.
My Way: Brown sugar is supposed to be "soft"?

Martha''s way: When boiling corn on the cob
column13:
add a pinch of sugar to help bring out the corn''s natural sweetness.
My Way: The only kind of corn I buy comes in a can.

\n

Martha''s way: To determine whether an egg is fresh
column14: immerse it in a pan of cool
column15: salted water. If it sinks
column16: it is fresh
column17: but if it rises to the surface
column18:
throw it away.
My way: Eat
column19: cook
column20: or use the egg anyway. If you feel bad later
column21:
you will know it wasn''t fresh.

\n

Martha''s way: Cure for headaches: Take a lime
column22:
cut it in half and rub it on your forehead. The throbbing will go away.
My way: Martha
column23: dear
column24: the only reason this works is because you can''t rub a lime on your forehead without getting lime juice in your eye
column25: and then the problem isn''t the headache anymore
column26:
it is because you are now blind.

Martha''s way: Don''t throw out all that leftover wine. Freeze into ice cubes for future use in casseroles and sauces.
My way: Leftover wine?

Martha''s way: If you have a problem opening jars: Try using latex dishwashing gloves. They give a non slip grip that makes opening jars easy.
My way: Go ask the very cute neighbor to do it.

Martha''s way: Potatoes will take food stains off your fingers. Just slice and rub raw potato on the stains and rinse with water.
My way: Mashed potatoes will now be replacing the anti-bacterial soap in the handy dispenser next to my sink.

Martha''s way: Now look what you can do with Alka Seltzer.
* Clean a toilet. Drop in two Alka-Seltzer tablets
column27: wait twenty minutes
column28:
brush and flush. The citric acid and effervescent action clean vitreous china.
* Clean a vase. To remove a stain from the bottom of a glass vase or cruet
column29:
fill with water and drop in two Alka-Seltzer tablets.
* Polish jewelry. Drop two Alka-Seltzer tablets into a glass of water and immerse the jewelry for two minutes.
* Clean a thermos bottle. Fill the bottle with water
column30: drop in four Alka-Seltzer tablets
column31: and let soak for an hour (or longer
column32:
if necessary).
My way: Put your jewelry
column33: vases
column34: and thermos in the toilet. Add some Alka-Seltzer and you have solved a whole bunch of problems at once.

column1:
A young blonde was on vacation in the depths of Louisiana.

\n

She wanted a pair of genuine alligator shoes in the worst way
column2:
but was very reluctant to pay the high prices the local vendors were asking.

\n

After becoming very frustrated with the "no haggle" attitude of one of the shopkeepers
column3: the blonde shouted
column4:
"Maybe I''ll just go out and catch my own alligator so I can get a pair of shoes at a reasonable price!"

\n

The shopkeeper said
column5: "By all means
column6:
be my guest. Maybe you''ll luck out and catch yourself a big one!"

\n

Determined
column7: the blonde turned and headed for the swamps
column8:
set on catching herself an alligator.

\n

Later in the day
column9: the shopkeeper was driving home
column10: when he spotted the young woman standing waist deep in the water
column11:
shotgun in hand.

\n

Just then
column12: he saw a huge 9-foot alligator swimming quickly toward her. She took aim
column13: killed the creature
column14:
and with a great deal of effort hauled it on to the swamp bank.

\n

Lying nearby were several more of the dead creatures. The shopkeeper watched in amazement.

\n

Just then the blonde flipped the alligator on its back. Frustrated
column15: she shouts out
column16: "Damn it
column17:
this one isn''t wearing any shoes either!"

\n

column1: Q:  How many American footballers does it take to change a light bulb?A:  Two - one to screw it in and the other to recover the fumble.

41 Rules Men Wish Women Knew

\n

1. If you think you''re fat
column2:
you probably are. Don''t ask us.

2. Learn to work the toilet seat: if it''s up put it down.

3 . Don''t cut your hair. Ever.

4. Birthdays
column3: Valentines
column4: and Anniversaries are not quests to see if he can find the perfect present
column5:
again!

\n

5. If you ask a question you don''t want an answer to
column6:
expect an answer you don''t want to hear.

\n

6. Sometimes
column7:
he''s not thinking about you. Live with it.

\n

7. Don''t ask him what he''s thinking about unless you are prepared to discuss such topics as navel lent
column8:
the shotgun formation and monster trucks.

\n

8. Get rid of your cat. And no
column9: it''s not different
column10:
it''s just like every other cat.

9. Dogs are better than ANY cats. Period.

10. Sunday = Sports. It''s like the full moon or the changing of the tides. Let it be.

11. Shopping is not sport.

12. Anything you wear is fine. Really.

13. You have enough clothes.

14. You have too many shoes.

15. Crying is blackmail. Use it if you must
column11:
but don''t expect us to like it.

\n

16. Your brother is an idiot
column12:
your ex-boyfriend is an idiot and your Dad probably is too.

\n

17. Ask for what you want. Subtle hints don''t work.

\n

18. No
column13:
he doesn''t know what day it is. He never will. Mark anniversaries on a calendar.

\n

19. Yes
column14:
pissing standing up is more difficult than peeing from point blank range. We''re bound to miss sometimes.

\n

20. Most guys own two to three pairs of shoes-what makes you think we''d be any good at choosing which pair
column15: out of thirty
column16:
would look good with your dress?

21. Yes and No are perfectly acceptable answers.

22. A headache that lasts for 17 months is a problem. See a doctor.

23. Your Mom doesn''t have to be our best friend.

24. Foreign films are best left to foreigners.

25. Check your oil.

26. Don''t give us 50 rules when 25 will do.

27. Don''t fake it. We''d rather be ineffective than deceived.

28. It is neither in your best interest nor ours to take the quiz together.

29. Anything we said 6 or 8 months ago is inadmissible in an argument. All comments become null and void after 7 days.

30. If you don''t dress like the Victoria''s Secret girls
column17:
don''t expect us to act like soap opera guys.

\n

31. If something we said can be interpreted two ways
column18: and one of the ways makes you sad and angry
column19:
we meant the other one.

\n

32. Let us ogle. If we don''t look at other women
column20:
how can we know how
pretty you are?

33. Don''t rub the lamp if you don''t want the genie to come out.

34. You can either ask us to do something OR tell us how you want it done not both.

35. Whenever possible
column21:
please say whatever you have to say during commercials.

\n

36. Christopher Columbus didn''t need directions
column22:
and neither do we.

\n

37. Women wearing Wonderbras and low-cut blouses lose their right to complain about having their boobs stared at.

\n

38. Consider Golf a mini-vacation from you. We need it
column23:
just like you do.

39. Telling us that the models in the men''s magazines are airbrushed makes you look jealous and petty and it''s certainly not going to deter us from reading the magazines.

40. The relationship is never going to be like it was the first two months we were going out.

41. Anyone can buy condoms.

Baseball''s Guide to Love

beer. As he approaches the bar he sees a big sign on the door saying:

column5:

glasses
column9:

column1: There is a new virus going around
column2:
called ''work''. If you receive any sort of
''work'' at all
column3: whether via email
column4:
internet or simply handed to you by a
colleague...DO NOT OPEN IT.

\n

Work has been circulating around our building for months and those who have
been tempted to open ''work'' or even look at ''work'' have found that their social
life is deleted and their brain ceases to function properly.

\n

If you do encounter ''work'' via email or are faced with any ''work'' at all
column5:
then
to purge the virus
column6:
send an email to your boss with the words ''Sorry...I''m off
to the pub''. The ''work'' should automatically be deleted from your brain.

\n

If you receive ''work'' in paper-document form
column7:
simply lift the document and
drag the ''work'' to your garbage can. Put on your coat and skip to the nearest
bar with two friends and order three pints of beer.

\n

After repeating this action 14 times
column8:
you will find that ''work'' will no longer
be of any relevance to you.

\n

Send this message to everyone in your address book. If you do not have anyone
in your address book
column9:
then I''m afraid the ''work'' virus has already corrupted
your life.

column1: A few years ago
column2: I applied for a job at Kodak.  I made it through all the interviews with flying colours
column3: and the only thing left was the drug test.  I was confident in passing
column4: but there was one slight problem: I have *very* shy kidneys.  I''ve had to sneak out of the doctor''s office on more than one occasion
column5: because I can''t "go" and fill up a cup on command.  Usually
column6: this is a good thing
column7: as I can go to a concert or football game
column8: drink beer all day
column9: and be fine until I get home
column10: while my friends are standing in line in the bathrooms several times during the same time period.So
column11: to prepare
column12: on the morning I had to take the test
column13: I drank my usual 10-cup pot of coffee
column14: and several large glasses of water
column15: and for the 20-minute trip to Kodak
column16: I filled a plastic gallon jug with water
column17: and finished it off on the way.   Now
column18: Kodak has huge parking lots
column19: each containg hundreds and hundreds of cars
column20: and by the time I got there
column21: the visitor''s lots were pretty full
column22: and I had to park way in the back.As soon as I got out of my car
column23: I''m thinking
column24: "Good
column25: it worked
column26: I think I can go!"  By the time I''d finished the 10-minute walk to the entrance
column27: I was thinking
column28: "Boy
column29: no problems now
column30: I can *definitely* go!"To get in
column31: I had to go past a security hut.  I told them why I was there
column32: and they told me where to report
column33: about another 10-minute walk
column34: a little ways into the plant.  I had to pass building after building before I got to the right one
column35: every step of the way
column36: becoming actually painful
column37: and before I was there
column38: I was looking at bushes and doorways and the like
column39: thinking
column40: "Well
column41: if it gets too bad
column42: I could go there
column43: or maybe there
column44: or..."By the time I got to the right building
column45: I was just about in agony. I found the right area
column46: and the receptionist told me to take a seat with about 8 other people.  I sat down
column47: thinking that would help
column48: but 10 seconds later I was up
column49: walking around
column50: trying to read stuff on the wall
column51: anything to keep my mind occuppied
column52: but managing to read 5 or 10 words
column53: and then having to pace again.Finally
column54: I couldn''t take it anymore
column55: and after having asked the girl a couple of times how long
column56: I told her
column57: "look
column58: either you get me in *now*
column59: or I use the bathroom over there
column60: and we reschedule!!" She said she''d see what she could do
column61: and left.  I went back to sit down
column62: and it took all of 5 seconds before I was up pacing again. She came back a few minutes later
column63: and told me to go on in.When I got to the actual room
column64: there were 4 people standing in line.  I hopped up and down a couple of times
column65: before I passed the others
column67: and told them I have to go **NOW**!!! They asked the others in line if anyone objected
column68: and they said no
column69: so they said as soon as one of the 2 bathrooms come free
column70: I could go.  I snatched the cup out of his hand
column71: and practically raced down the aisle to the bathrooms and just stood waiting.  It couldn''t have been more than 20 seconds or so
column72: but they were some of the most agonizing seconds of my life!!Finally
column74: and I nearly flattened some poor girl coming out in my rush to get in.  I closed the door
column77: and dropped them and then my underwear
column78: and then the world caved in...  I started going.  And going.  And going. I could have knocked down the Berlin wall with the force!   But the problem was
column79: that I couldn''t "grab" it!!  It was whipping around like one of those Water Wiggle things.  I''m trying like heck to reign it it in
column80: but just couldn''t.  I''m dancing around in a circle
column81: with my pants around my ankles
column83: and it was just about impossible for probably a good 15 seconds.  Finally
column85: and was able to aim in the toilet
column86: just remembering at the end to put a shot or two in the cup to put on the little shelf.   By the time I''d stopped
column88: and just leaned up against the wall
column89: feeling like I''d just run a marathon...It was then that was able to survey the bathroom.  It was a room
column91: but my god...  I had finished the most intense pee of my life in the john
column97: it was drenched -- including my pants and underwear.  I tried soaking it up with toilet paper (using the whole roll as a sponge)
column98: but that was drenched and didn''t work that well.  I''d also soaked the extra rolls on the back of the toilet
column100: and the extra roll of paper towels.  I went through the garbage
column102: just trying to make the place semi-presentable
column103: as in the sink and the mirror
column104: but it didn''t do much good.  I was just ending up pushing the wet around
column105: so I finally gave up.Steeling myself

column108: and pulled down my semi-wet shirt as much as possible
column109: and went out. I whipped back up the aisle

column1: A married man and his secretary were having a torrid affair. One afternoon they couldn''t contain their passion
column2: so they rushed over to her place where they spent the afternoon making passionate love. When they were finished
column3: they fell asleep
column4: not waking until 8 o''clock. They got dressed quickly. Then the man asked his secretary to take his shoes outside and rub them on the lawn. Bewildered
column5:
she did as he asked thinking him pretty weird.

\n

The man finally got home and his wife met him at the door. Upset
column6: she asked where he''d been. The man replied
column7: "I can not tell a lie. My secretary and I are having an affair. Today we left work early
column8: went to her place
column9: spent the afternoon making love
column10:
and then fell asleep. That''s why I''m late."

\n

The wife looked at him
column11: took notice of his shoes and yelled
column12: "I can see those are grass stains on your shoes. YOU DAMN LIAR! You''ve been playing golf again
column13: haven''t you?"

Veteran Pillsbury spokesman Pop N. Fresh died yesterday of a severe yeast
infection. He was 71. Known to friends as Brown-n-Serve
column2:
Fresh was an avid
gardener and tennis player. Fresh was buried in one of the largest funeral
ceremonies in recent years. Dozens of celebrities turned out including Mrs.
Butter worth
column3: the California Raisins
column4: Hungry Jack
column5: Aunt Jemima
column6: Betty Crocker
column7: the Hostess Twinkies
column8:
and Skippy. The graveside was piled high with flours as
longtime friend Aunt Jemima delivered the eulogy
column9:
describing fresh as a man who
"never knew how much he was kneaded."

\n

Fresh rose quickly in show business
column10:
but his later life was filled with many
turnovers. He was not considered a very smart cookie
column11:
wasting much of his dough
on half-baked schemes -- conned by those who puttered him up. Still
column12:
even as a
crusty old man
column13:
he was a roll model for millions. His second wife survives
fresh. They have two children and another bun in the oven. The funeral was held
at 350 for about 20 minutes.

on half-baked schemes -- conned by those who puttered him up. Still

even as a
crusty old man

he was a roll model for millions. His second wife survives
fresh. They have two children and another bun in the oven. The funeral was held
at 350 for about 20 minutes.

column1:
A policeman interrogates three blondes who are training to become detectives.

\n

To test their skills in recognizing a suspect
column2: he shows the first blonde a picture for five seconds and then hides it. "This is your suspect
column3:
how would you recognize him?"

\n

The first blonde answers
column4: "That''s easy
column5:
we''ll catch him fast because he only has one eye!"

\n

The policeman says
column6: "Well
column7: uh
column8:
thats because the picture shows his profile."

\n

Slightly flustered by this ridiculous response
column9: he flashes the picture for five seconds at the second blonde and asks her
column10: "This is your suspect
column11:
how would you recognize him?"

\n

The second blonde giggles
column12: flips her hair and says
column13:
"Ha! He''d be too easy to catch because he only has one ear!"

\n

The policeman angrily responds
column14:
"What''s the matter with you two?! Of course only one eye and one ear are showing because it''s a picture of his profile! Is that the best answer you can come up with?"

\n

Extremely frustrated at this point
column15: he shows the picture to the third blonde and in a very testy voice asks
column16: "This is your suspect
column17: how would you recognize him?" He quickly adds
column18:
"Think hard before giving me a stupid answer."

\n

The blonde looks at the picture intently for a moment and says
column19: "Hmm
column20:
the suspect wears contact lenses."

\n

The policeman is surprised and speechless because he really doesn''t know if the suspect wears contacts or not. "Well
column21:
that''s an interesting answer. Wait here for a few minutes while I check his file."

\n

He leaves the room and goes to his office
column22: checks the suspects file in his computer
column23:
and comes back with a beaming smile on his face. "Wow! I cant believe it. It''s true! The suspect does in fact wear contact lenses. Good work! How were you able to make such an astute observation?"

\n

"That''s easy
column24:
the blonde replied. He can''t wear regular glasses because he only has one eye and one ear."

One night a torrential downpour soaked South Louisiana. The next morning the resulting floodwaters came up about 6 feet into most of the homes there.
 
Mrs. Boudreaux was sitting on her roof with her neighbor
column2: Mrs. Thibodaux
column3:
waiting for help to come.
 
Mrs. Thibodaux noticed a lone baseball cap floating near the house.  Then she saw it float far out into the front yard
column4: then float all the way back to the house.  It kept floating out
column5: then back
column6:
out and back.  

\n

Her curiosity got the best of her
column7: so she asked Mrs. Boudreaux
column8:
"Do you see that baseball cap floating away from the house and then back again?"
 
Mrs. Boudreaux said
column9: "Oh yes
column10: that''s my husband. I told him he was going to cut the grass today
column11: come Hell or High Water!!"

column1:
Three guys were at a football game. It just so happens that they
were all diehard football fans. They finally found a seat good
enough for them. But there was just one problem with the so
called "perfect seats." Three nuns were in front of them
blocking their veiw.

\n

The guys wanted them to move so one said
column2:
loud enough for the
nuns to hear
column3:
"Hey I think I''ll move to Idaho. There are only
100 Catholics there."

\n

The second one said
column4:
"No I''m gonna move to Montana. There are
only 50 Catholics living there."

\n

Then the third guy said
column5:
"You two are both wrong. We should move
to Wisconsin. There are only 25 Catholics there."

\n

Then one of the nuns turns around and said
column6:
"Hey why don''t you
go to hell... there aren''t any Catholics there!"

column1: In downtown Roanoke
column2: at a crowded bus stop
column3: a good friend of mine was waiting for her bus. She''s very attractive and was decked out in a tight leather mini skirt  with matching tight leather boots and jacket. As the bus rolled up and it became her turn to get on
column4:
she became aware that her skirt was too tight to allow her leg to come up to the height of the first step on the bus.

\n

Slightly embarrassed and with a quick smile to the bus driver she reached behind her and unzipped her skirt a little thinking that this would give her enough slack to raise her leg. Again she tried to make the step onto the bus only to discover she still couldn''t!

\n

So
column5: a little more embarrassed she once again reached behind her and unzipped her skirt a little more and for a second time attempted the step and once again
column6:
much to her chagrin she could not raise her leg because of the tight skirt.

\n

So
column7:
with a coy little smile to the driver she again unzipped the offending skirt to give a little more slack and again was unable to make the step.

\n

About this time a big burly man that was behind her in the line picked her up easily from the waist and placed her lightly on the step of the bus. Well
column8:
she went ballistic and turned to the would-be hero screeching at him "How dare you touch me!! I don''t even know who you are!"

\n

At this
column9: the big guy drawled
column10: "Well ma''am normally I would agree with you but after you unzipped my fly three times
column11: I kinda figured that we were friends!"

column1:
Dave works hard at the plant and spends most evenings bowling or playing basketball at the gym.

\n

His wife thinks he is pushing himself too hard
column2:
so for his birthday she takes him to a local strip club.

\n

The doorman at the club greets them and says
column3: "Hey
column4: Dave
column5:
how ya doin?"

\n

His wife is puzzled and asks if he''s been to this club before. "Oh no
column6:
says Dave. He''s on my bowling team."

\n

When they are seated
column7: a waitress asks Dave if he''d like his usual Budweiser. His wife is becoming uncomfortable and says
column8:
"You must come here a lot for that woman to know you drink Budweiser".

\n

"No
column9: honey
column10:
she''s in the Ladies Bowling League. We share lanes with them."

\n

A stripper comes over to their table and throws her arms around Dave. "Hi Davey
column11:
she says, Want your usual table dance?"

\n

Dave''s wife
column12: now furious
column13:
grabs her purse and storms out of the club. Dave follows and spots her getting into a cab.

\n

Before she can slam the door
column14: he jumps in beside her and she starts screaming at him. The cabby turns his head and says
column15: "Looks like you picked up a real bitch tonight
column16: Dave."

column1:
1. Learn to work the toilet seat: if it''s up put it down.

2. Don''t cut your hair. Ever.

3. Don''t make us guess.

4. If you ask a question you don''t want an answer to
column2:
expect an answer you
don''t want to hear.

\n

5. Sometimes
column3:
he''s not thinking about you. Live with it.

\n

6. He''s never thinking about "The Relationship√î√∏Œ©.

\n

7. Get rid of your cat. And no
column4:
it''s not different; it''s just like every other
cat.

8. Dogs are better than cats.

9. Sunday = Sports. It''s like the full moon or the changing of the tides. Let
it be.

10. Shopping is not everybody''s idea of a good time.

11. Anything you wear is fine. Really.

12. You have enough clothes.

column1: Mike Tyson was terribly overweight
column2:
so his doctor put him on a diet. "I want
you to eat regularly for two days
column3: then skip a day
column4:
and repeat this procedure
for two weeks. The next time I see you
column5:
you will have lost at least five
pounds."
When Mike Tyson returned
column6:
he shocked the doctor by losing nearly
twenty pounds. "Why
column7:
that''s amazing!" the doctor said. "Did you follow my
instructions?"
Mike Tyson nodded and said
column8: "I''ll tell you though
column9: Doc
column10:
I
thought I was going to drop dead that third day."
"From hunger
column11: you mean?" asked the doctor. To which Tyson answered
column12: "No
column13: Doc
column14: from skipping."

column1: A German
column2: Englishman and American are traveling on a train. They get bored and start telling each other about their families. The German says
column3: "I have 4 kids
column4: one more and they''ll make a basketball team."The Englishman says
column5: "Huh! That''s nothing I have 10 boys; one more and I''ll be the world-champion soccer-team''s coach."The American starts laughing. He says
column6: "I''ve had 17 wives and no kids! But one more wife and I''ll open a golf course!"

column1: Ok this idiot of the first order is invited for a game of golf for the first time
column2:
while in another country.

\n

He''s totally enamoured with the golf ball because he''s never seen anything like it before so he carries like
column3:
30 of them back home to give away as souveniers.

\n

While passing through the customs on his way back
column4: the customs officer who''s perhaps a bigger idiot than this guy
column5: notices his pockets bulging with all these golf balls and can''t figure it out. So he asks our man
column6:
"What the hell is all this?!"

\n

To which he replies
column7:
"Oh they''re just golf balls."
So the customs officer goes
column8: "Oh oh! You mean like tennis elbow?"

column1: What makes these questions so bad is that every one is guaranteed to explode into a major argument and/or divorce if the man does not answer properly
column2:
which is to say dishonestly.

For example:

1 - "What are you thinking?"

The proper answer to this question
column3: of course is
column4: "I''m sorry if I''ve been pensive
column5: dear. I was just reflecting on what a warm
column6: wonderful
column7: caring
column8: thoughtful
column9: intelligent
column10: beautiful woman you are and what a lucky guy I am to have met you." Obviously
column11: this statement bears no resemblance whatsoever to what the guy was really thinking at the time
column12:
which was most likely one of five things:

\n

a - Baseball b - Football c - How fat you are d - How much prettier she is than you e - How he would spend the insurance money if you died

\n

According to the Sassy article
column13: the best answer to this stupid question came from Al Bundy
column14: of Married With Children
column15: who was asked it by his wife
column16: Peg. "If I wanted you to know
column17:
Al said, I''d be talking instead of thinking."

The other questions also have only one right answer but many wrong answers:

2 - "Do you love me?"

The correct answer to this question is
column18: "Yes." For those guys who feel the need to be more elaborate
column19: you may answer
column20: "Yes
column21:
dear." Wrong answers include:

\n

a - I suppose so. b - Would it make you feel better if I said yes? c - That depends on what you mean by "love". d - Does it matter? e - Who
column22:
me?

\n

3 - "Do I look fat?"

\n

The correct male response to this question is to confidently and emphatically state
column23: "No
column24:
of course not" and then quickly leave the room. Wrong answers include:

\n

a - I wouldn''t call you fat
column25:
but I wouldn''t call you thin either. b - Compared to what? c - A little extra weight looks good on you. d - I''ve seen fatter. e - Could you repeat the question? I was thinking about your insurance policy.

\n

4 - "Do you think she''s prettier than me?"

\n

The "she" in the question could be an ex-girlfriend
column26: a passer-by you were staring at so hard that you almost caused a traffic accident or an actress in a movie you just saw. In any case
column27: the correct response is
column28: "No
column29:
you are much prettier." Wrong answers include:

\n

a - Not prettier
column30: just pretty in a different way. b - I don''t know how one goes about rating such things. c - Yes
column31:
but I bet you have a better personality. d - Only in the sense that she''s younger and thinner. e - Could you repeat the question? I was thinking about your insurance policy.

\n

5 - "What would you do if I died?"

\n

Correct answer: "Dearest love
column32: in the event of your untimely demise
column33: life would cease to have meaning for me and I would perforce hurl myself under the front tires of the first Domino''s Pizza truck that came my way." This might be the stupidest question of the lot
column34:
as is illustrated by the following stupid exchange:

\n

"Dear
column35: said the wife. What would you do if I died?" "Why
column36: dear
column37: I would be extremely upset
column38: said the husband.Why do you ask such a question?" "Would you remarry?" persevered the wife. "No
column39: of course not
column40: dear" said the husband. "Don''t you like being married?" said the wife. "Of course I do
column41: dear" he said. "Then why wouldn''t you remarry?" "Alright
column42: said the husband, I''d remarry." "You would?" said the wife
column43: looking vaguely hurt. "Yes" said the husband. "Would you sleep with her in our bed?" said the wife after a long pause. "Well yes
column44: I suppose I would." replied the husband. "I see
column45: said the wife indignantly. And would you let her wear my old clothes? "I suppose
column46: if she wanted to" said the husband. "Really
column47: said the wife icily. And would you take down the pictures of me and replace them with pictures of her?" "Yes. I think that would be the correct thing to do." "Is that so?" said the wife
column48: leaping to her feet. "And I suppose you''d let her play with my golf clubs
column49: too." "Of course not
column50: dear
column51: said the husband. She''s left-handed..."

column1:
In a small southern town there was a "Nativity Scene" that showed great
skill and talent had gone into creating it. One small feature bothered me.
The three wise men were wearing fireman''s helmets.

\n

Totally unable to come up with a reason or explanation
column2:
I left.

\n

At a "Quick Stop" on the edge of town
column3:
I asked the lady behind the counter
about the helmets. She exploded into a rage
column4:
yelling at me. "You Yankees
never do read The Bible!"

\n

I assured her that I did
column5:
but simply couldn''t recall anything about
firemen in The Bible. She jerked her Bible from behind the counter and
ruffled through some pages
column6:
and finally jabbed her finger at a passage.
Sticking it in my face
column7: she said
column8: "See
column9: it says right here
column10:
''The three
wise men came from afar.''"

column1:
EVER WONDER.....

\n

...why the sun lightens our hair
column2:
but darkens our skin?

...why women can''t put on mascara with their mouth closed?

...why you don''t ever see the headline "Psychic Wins Lottery"?

...why "abbreviated" is such a long word?

...why doctors call what they do "practice"?

...why you have to click on "Start" to stop Windows 98?

...why lemon juice is made with artificial flavor
column3:
while dishwashing liquid is made with real lemons?

...why the man who invests all your money is called a broker?

...why there isn''t mouse-flavored cat food?

...who tastes dog food when it has a "new &improved" flavor?

...why Noah didn''t swat those two mosquitoes?

...why they sterilize the needle for lethal injections?

...why they don''t make the whole plane out of the material used for the indestructible black box ?

...why sheep don''t shrink when it rains?

...why they are called apartments when they are all stuck together?

...if con is the opposite of pro
column4:
is Congress the opposite of progress?

\n

...why they call the airport "the terminal" if flying is so safe?

column1:
Murphy''s Laws Of Law Enforcement

\n

1. Bullet Proof vests aren''t.

\n

2. The bigger they are
column2: the harder they fall.  They also punch
column3:
kick and
choke harder too.

\n

3. The speed at which you respond to a fight call is inversely proportional to how long you''ve been a cop.

\n

4. Tear gas works on cops too
column4: and regardless of wind direction
column5:
will always blow back in your face.

\n

5. High speed chases will always proceed from an area of light traffic to an area of extremely heavy traffic.

\n

6. If you know someone who tortures animals and wets the bed
column6:
he is either a serial killer or he works for Internal Affairs.

7. Placing a gun back in a shoulder holster with your finger on the trigger will cause you to walk with a limp.

8. Flash hiders don''t really.

9. If you have cleared all the rooms and met no resistance
column7:
you and your entry team have probably kicked in the door of the wrong house.

\n

10. If a cop swings a baton in a fight
column8:
he will hit other cops more often than he will hit the bad guys he swings at.

\n

11. Domestic arguments will always migrate from an area of few available weapons (living room)
column9:
to an area with many available weapons (kitchen).

\n

12. If you have just punched out a handcuffed prisoner for spitting at you
column10:
you are about to become a star on Eyewitness News.

\n

13. Bullets work on veteran cops too. They also work on weight lifters
column11: martial arts experts
column12: department marksmen
column13: Vice cops
column14: S.W.A.T. jocks
column15:
and others who consider themselves immortal.

\n

14. When a civilian sees a blue light approaching at a high rate of speed
column16:
he will always pull into the lane the cop needs to use.

\n

15. If you drive your patrol car to the geometric center of the Gobi Desert
column17:
within five minutes a dumb-ass civilian will pull along side you and ask for directions.

\n

16. You can never drive slow enough to please the citizens who don''t need a cop
column18:
and you can never drive fast enough to please the ones who do.

\n

17. Any suspect with a rifle is a better shot than any cop with a pistol.

\n

18. From behind you
column19:
the bad guys can see your night sights as well as you
can.

\n

19. On any call
column20: there will always be more bad guys than there are good guys
column21: and the farther away your back-up
column22:
the more there will be.

\n

20. The longer you''ve been a cop
column23:
the shorter your flashlight and your temper gets.

\n

21. Whatever you are about to do
column24: if there is a good chance it will get you killed
column25:
you probably shouldn''t do it.

\n

22. You should never do a shotgun search of a dark warehouse with a cop whose nickname is "Boomer".

\n

23. The better you do your job
column26: the more likely you are to be shot
column27: injured
column28: complained on
column29: sued
column30: investigated
column31:
or subpoenaed on your day off.

\n

24. If a large group of drunk bikers is "holed-up" in a house
column32: the Department will send one officer in a beat car.  If there is one biker "holed-up" in a house
column33: they will send the entire S.W.A.T. Team.

column1: A Texas business man
column2: while in Japan for some business meetings and a few rounds of golf
column3: arrived in Tokyo a day earlier than expected. Feeling lonely that evening
column4: he employed the services of a beautiful young Japanese girl to be his companion for the evening. Although the Japanese girl spoke very little English and the businessman spoke no Japanese
column5: their passion roared and in the heat of the moment she began yelling "Gama Su!
column6: Gama Su!". Hearing this
column7:
the Texan knew he had pleased his female Japanese friend and soon afterwards went to sleep.
The next day while playing golf with his Japanese business colleagues
column8: one of his Japanese partners holed his shot from 170 yards away! Everyone went crazy and began yelling excitedly in Japanese. Wanting to impress his friends
column9: the Texan joined in and began yelling
column10:
"Gama Su! Gama Su!"

\n

Suddenly everyone became quiet. After a moment of silence
column11: one of the Japanese turned to him and asked "Wrong hole? What do you mean wrong hole?"

column1: Sid and Barney head out for a quick round of golf. Since they are short on time
column2: they decide to play only 9 holes. Sid offers Barney
column3: "let''s say we make the time worth the while
column4: at least for one of us
column5: and spot $5 on the lowest score for the day." Barney agrees and they enjoy a great game. After the 8th hole
column6: Barney is ahead by 1 stroke
column7:
but cuts his ball into the rough on the 9th.

\n

"Help me find my ball
column8: you look over there
column9:
he says to Sid. After 5 minutes, neither has had any luck, and since a lost ball carries a four-point penalty, Barney pulls a ball from his pocket and tosses it to the ground. I''ve found my ball!" he announces triumphantly.

column1:
There was once a famous explorer who would travel around the
world videotaping exotic things from around the world. One day
column2:
he decided that he would make a videotape of all the world''s
dances. So
column3:
he and his film crews spent 5 years roaming around
the world taping any exotic dance they could come across. They
ended up in Australia after videotaping the last dance they had
ever heard of. Suddenly
column4:
an old lady comes up to them and says
"Have you gotten the Butcher dance?"

\n

The explorers did not know what the Butcher dance was
column5:
so they
asked the old lady.

\n

"Well
column6:
there''s a very secretive tribe of Aborigines in the
outback that only do this dance called the Butcher dance once a
year. No human outside of their tribe has ever seen it."

\n

This excited the explorers greatly. "Do you know where we can
find this tribe?"

\n

The lady replied "Yes I do
column7: and if you leave tomorrow
column8:
you
should just make it in time. First
column9:
you need to travel 2 hours
west into the outback
column10:
then 5 hours north. You will come to a
mountain range. You must leave your vehicles at the range. Then
column11: you climb over the mountain range
column12:
which is very treacherous.
Then
column13:
you will need to ford a river at the bottom of the
mountains. There should be a tribe of aborigines on the other
side that will guide you to the next tribe for something
valuable in return. They will lead you to a cliff on a plateau.
You must scale down the cliff
column14:
and then it is an hour walk
across a desert to a group of small hills
column15:
and over those hills
will be the aborigines with the dance you seek."

\n

Well
column16:
the explorer knows that he must get this dance to complete
his taping. So
column17: he and his crew set off. 2 hours west
column18:
and then
after 4 hours north
column19: their cars break down
column20:
so they''re forced to
walk the remaining distance with all their equipment across the
hot landscape. When they finally come to the mountains
column21:
2 of the
group lose their footing and fall to their deaths. They finally
make it over the mountains
column22:
but the river has been engorged with
a flood. 1 crewman drowns while he tries to swim across
column23:
so the
remaining people are forced to build makeshift rafts. However
column24: the rafts start to sink
column25:
and half of their camera equipment is
lost. They come to the group of aborigines who will guide them
to the next group
column26: and offer them money. They refuse
column27:
and the
explorers offer them some of their cameras. The aborigines
refuse that
column28: as well. So
column29:
the famous explorer makes his
sacrifice
column30: and offers the only female member of his crew
column31:
which
they accept. They are given a guide who leads them to the cliff.
One of the crewmen gets vertigo
column32:
and accidentally falls off the
cliff tom his death. The explorer and his one remaining crewman
set off across the desert
column33:
and his crewman drops because of heat
stroke. So
column34: the explorer picks up a small camera
column35:
and drags his
ragged self across the desert
column36: up the hills
column37:
and he can hear
drums!

\n

He pulls himself up the top of the hill
column38:
and the drums stop. He
stumbles down to the village elder
column39:
and once they have found a
translator
column40:
proceeds to ask him when the Butcher dance will take
place.

\n

"I''m very sorry
column41:
but we have just finished with our Butcher
dance." "Well
column42: can''t you please do it again
column43:
for me? It''s very
important! You don''t know what we''ve been through!" "We cannot
do that. It would anger our gods
column44:
and we need them to watch over
our livestock and our crops and our water.

\n

So
column45: the explorer heads back to where he started from
column46:
and
finally makes it back and resolves to try again next year. So he
spends the year renting out a house in Australia and gathering
everything he''ll need. He gets mountain climbing gear
column47:
an
inflatable raft
column48: blow-up dolls
column49:
and a car repair kit. He takes
all the precautions
column50: and with a new crew
column51:
sets off.

\n

When they arrive at the mountains
column52:
one of his crew notices a
path in the mountains that wasn''t apparent
column53:
so they drive
through
column54: and make it to the river
column55:
which has dried up. They
cross the dried-up riverbed
column56:
and the aborigines have moved away
because of a lack of water. So
column57:
they carry on from the memory of
their leader. Midway through the desert
column58: however
column59:
one car hits a
rock and tips
column60: and the other car couldn''t turn in time
column61:
and
there''s a horrible accident. By sheer willpower
column62:
the explorer
climbs bloodied and beaten from the wreckage
column63:
finds one camera
that still works
column64:
and stumbles on into the village. He is
immediately recognized by the elder.

\n

"Oh
column65:
you! You have come just in time to see the Butcher dance!
We will delay it for a little bit so that you can be healed of
your wounds!" "No
column66:
I don''t want to waste that time. I''ll be
fine. Just start the Butcher dance!"

\n

This is the time he''s been waiting for two years. Finally
column67:
his 7
year work will be complete. He fires up his camera and watches
the dancers as they come out. They form a circle
column68:
and start to
sing:

column1: By Barbara Florio GrahamFrom McCall''s
column2: June
column3: 1983I read every diet I can get my hands on.  I even follow their suggestions.  But eventually
column4: inevitably
column5: I always get fat again.  Now
column6: at last
column7: I''ve found The Answer.  After living for almost 14 years with a man who never gains an ounce no matter what I serve him
column8: I''ve found out what it is that keeps him thin: He thinks differently.  The real difference between fat and thin people is that thin people:avoid eating popcorn in the movies because it gets their hands greasy;split a large combination pizza with three friends;think Oreo cookies are for kids;nibble cashews one at a time;think that doughnuts are indigestible;read books they have to hold with both hands;become so absorbed in a weekend project they forget to have lunch;fill the candy dish on their desks with paper clips;counteract the midafternoon slump with a nap instead of a cinnamon Danish;exchange the deep-fryer they received for Christmas for a clock-radio;lose their appetites when they''re depressed;think chocolate Easter bunnies are for kids;save leftovers that are too skimpy to use for another meal in order to make interesting soups;throw out stale potato chips;will eat only Swiss or Dutch chocolate
column9: which cannot be found except in a special store;think it''s too much trouble to stop at a special store just to buy chocolate;don''t celebrate with a hot-fudge sundae every time they lose a pound;warm up after skiing with black coffee instead of hot chocolate and whipped cream;try all the salads at the buffet
column10:
leaving room for only one dessert;find iced tea more refreshing than an ice-cream soda;get into such interesting conversations at cocktail parties that they never quite work their way over to the hors-d''oeuvre table;have no compulsion to keep the candy dish symmetrical by reducing the jelly beans to an equal number of each color;think that topping brownies with ice cream makes too rich a dessert;bring four cookies into the TV room instead of a box;think banana splits are for kids.

\n

Joke found on http://www.ahajokes.com

column1: When Apollo Mission Astronaut Neil Armstrong first walked on the moon

column7:

True fact.

is going on. Clinton is of course Toto

to get up into Dorothy''s skirt.

column4:
constitute going out to dinner.

why call us at work?

column1:
Ski season is here. The following is a list of exercises to help you prepare:
- Soak your gloves and store them in the freezer after every use.
- Fasten a small
column2:
wide rubber band around the top half of your head before you
go to bed each night.
- If you wear glasses
column3:
begin wearing them with glue smeared on the lenses.
- Throw away a hundred dollar bill - now.
- Find the nearest ice rink and walk across the ice 20 times in your ski boots
carrying two pairs of skis
column4:
accessory bag and poles. Pretend you are looking for
your car. Sporadically drop things.
- Place a small but angular pebble in your shoes
column5:
line them with crushed ice
and then tighten a C-clamp around your toes.
- Buy a new pair of gloves and immediately throw one away.
- Secure one of your ankles to a bed post and ask a friend to run into you at
high speed.
- Go to McDonald''s and insist on paying $8.50 for a hamburger. Be sure you are
in the longest line.
- Clip a lift ticket to the zipper of your jacket and ride a motorcycle fast
enough to make the ticket lacerate your face.
- Drive slowly for five hours - anywhere - as long as it''s in a snowstorm and
you''re following an 18 wheeler.
- Fill a blender with ice
column6:
hit the pulse button and let the spray blast your
face. Leave the ice on your face until it melts. Let it drip into your clothes.
- Dress up in as many clothes as you can and then proceed to take them off
because you have to go to the bathroom.
- Slam your thumb in a car door. Don''t go see a doctor.
- Repeat all of the above every Saturday and Sunday until it''s time for the
real thing.

column16:

column22: so I''m still a hole behind you!"

\n

have to live elsewhere.

book of the Bible

apple tree. One of their children
column4: Cain
column5: asked
column6:
"Am I my
brother''s son?"

\n

3. Moses led the Hebrew slaves to the Red Sea
column7:
where they made
unleavened bread which is bread made without any ingredients.
Moses went up on Mount Cyanide to get the ten commandments. He
died before he ever reached Canada.

\n

4. Solomom had three hundred wives and seven hundred porcupines.

\n

5. The Greeks were a highly sculptured people
column8:
and without them
we wouldn''t have history. The Greeks also had myths. A myth is a
female moth.

\n

6. Actually
column9:
Homer was not written by Homer but by another man
of that name.

\n

7. Socrates was a famous Greek teacher who went around giving
people advice. They killed him. Socrates died from an overdose
of wedlock. After his death
column10:
his career suffered a dramatic
decline.

\n

8. In the Olympic games
column11: Greeks ran races
column12: jumped
column13:
hurled the
biscuits
column14:
and threw the java.

\n

9. Eventually
column15:
the Romans conquered the Greeks. History calls
people Romans because they never stayed in one place for very
long.

\n

10. Julius Caesar extinguished himself on the battlefields of
Gaul. The Ides of March murdered him because they thought he was
going to be made king. Dying
column16: he gasped out: "Tee hee
column17:
Brutus."

11. Nero was a cruel tyranny who would torture his subjects by
playing the fiddle to them.

12. Joan of Arc was burnt to a steak and was cannonized by
Bernard Shaw. Finally Magna Carta provided that no man should be
hanged twice for the same offense.

13. In midevil times most people were alliterate. The greatest
writer of the futile ages was Chaucer
column18:
who wrote many poems and
verses and also wrote literature.

\n

14. Another story was William Tell
column19:
who shot an arrow through an
apple while standing on his son''s head.

15. Queen Elizabeth was the "Virgin Queen." As a queen she was a
success. When she exposed herself before her troops they all
shouted "hurrah."

16. It was an age of great inventions and discoveries. Gutenberg
invented removable type and the Bible. Another important
invention was the circulation of blood. Sir Walter Raleigh is a
historical figure because he invented cigarettes and started
smoking. And Sir Francis Drake circumcised the world with a 100
foot clipper.

17. The greatest writer of the Renaissance was William
Shakespeare. He was born in the year 1564
column20:
supposedly on his
birthday. He never made much money and is famous only because of
his plays. He wrote tragedies
column21: comedies
column22: and hysterectomies
column23:
all
in Islamic pentameter. Romeo and Juliet are an example of a
heroic couplet. Romeo''s last wish was to be laid by Juliet.

\n

18. Writing at the same time as Shakespeare was Miguel
Cervantes. He wrote Donkey Hote. The next great author was John
Milton. Milton wrote Paradise Lost. Then his wife died and he
wrote Paradise Regained.

\n

19. During the Renaissance America began. Christopher Columbus
was a great navigator who discovered America while cursing about
the Atlantic. His ships were called the Nina
column24: the Pinta
column25:
and the
Santa Fe.

\n

20. Later
column26: the Pilgrims crossed the ocean
column27:
and this was called
Pilgrim''s Progress. The winter of 1620 was a hard one for the
settlers. Many people died and many babies were born. Captain
John Smith was responsible for all this.

\n

21. One of the causes of the Revolutionary War was the English
put tacks in their tea. Also
column28:
the colonists would send their
parcels through the post without stamps. Finally the colonists
won the War and no longer had to pay for taxis. Delegates from
the original 13 states formed the Contented Congress. Thomas
Jefferson
column29: a Virgin
column30:
and Benjamin Franklin were two singers of
the declaration of Independence. Franklin discovered electricity
by rubbing two cats backwards and declared
column31:
"A horse divided
against itself cannot stand.". Franklin died in 1790 and is
still dead.

\n

22. Soon the Constitution of the United States was adopted to
secure domestic hostility. Under the constitution the people
enjoyed the right to keep bare arms.

\n

23. Abraham Lincoln became America''s greatest Precedent.
Lincoln''s mother died in infancy
column32:
and he was born in a log cabin
which he built with his own hands. Abraham Lincoln freed the
slaves by signing the Emasculation Proclamation. On the night of
April 14
column34:
Lincoln went to the theater and got shot in his
seat by one of the actors in a moving picture show. The believed
assinator was John Wilkes Booth
column35:
a supposedly insane actor. This
ruined Booth''s career.

\n

24. Meanwhile in Europe
column36:
the enlightenment was a reasonable
time. Voltaire invented electricity and also wrote a book called
Candy.

25. Gravity was invented by Issac Walton. It is chiefly
noticeable in the autumn when the apples are falling off the
trees.

26. Johann Bach wrote a great many musical compositions and had
a large number of children. In between he practiced on an old
spinster which he kept up in his attic. Bach died from 1750 to
the present. Bach was the most famous composer in the world and
so was Handel. Handel was half German half Italian and half
English. He was very large.

27. Beethoven wrote music even though he was deaf. He was so
deaf he wrote loud music. He took long walks in the forest even
when everyone was calling for him. Beethoven expired in 1827 and
later died for this.

28. The French Revolution was accomplished before it happened
and catapulted into Napoleon. Napoleon wanted an heir to inherit
his power
column37: but since Josephine was a baroness
column38:
she couldn''t have
any children.

\n

29. The sun never set on the British Empire because the British
Empire is in the East and the sun sets in the West.

\n

30. Queen Victoria was the longest queen. She sat on a thorn for
63 years.

column2: ''Honey
column3:
could you fix the front steps? They''re ready to collapse.''

\n

He sighs and says
column4: ''After the game
column5:
Flo.''

\n

Flo grinds her teeth. She nearly broke her neck climbing those stupid stairs and all he cares about is his stupid baseball game. ''Well
column6:
could you fix the light in the hall? It''s been flickering for weeks.''

\n

He sighs and says
column7: ''Darn it
column8: Flo
column9: I''m a sports fan
column10:
not an electrician. Call Joe Burkes to fix it.''

\n

Flo counters: ''Can you fix the fridge door
column11:
then? It won''t shut.''

\n

Jerry turns to talk to her and misses the game-winning homer. He turns back to the screen and sees people celebrating and carrying on. He wants to swear. Instead he says
column12: ''You want me to fix the fridge? Who do I look like
column13:
the Maytag Repairman?''

\n

She opens her mouth and he hushes her silent. ''I need to cool down
column14:
'' he says. ''I''m going out.''

\n

Jerry goes to his favorite watering hole and drinks for about an hour. After a couple beers
column15: he starts to feel guilty about treating Flo so poorly. He returns home and notices the front steps have been repaired. He walks into the hall and sees the hall light working perfectly. He opens the fridge to grab a beer. The fridge door has been fixed
column16:
too.

\n

He finds his wife and says
column17: ''Honey
column18:
how''d you fix all this stuff?''

She smiles and says
column19: ''After you left

I sat outside and cried. This nice young man was passing by and asked what was wrong. I told him. He offered to fix everything for me. All I had to do in return was make love to him or bake him a cake.

\n

Jerry nodded
column21:
appreciatively. ''What kind of cake did you bake?''

\n

Flo''s smile widened. ''Who do I look like
column22: Betty Crocker?''

"Do you know how I can get to Route 91?" the driver asked.

\n

The farmer thought for a few seconds. Then he said

"Do you know where the nearest turnpike entrance is?" the driver asked.

"Nope."

"How about the town of Hadley. Do you know which direction it is from here?"

"Nope."

do you?" he said.

Today we left work early

column1: Why do only 10 percent of men make it to heaven? Because if they all went
column2: it would be called hell.How are husbands like lawn mowers?They''re hard to get started
column3: they emit noxious fumes
column4: and half the time they don''t work.How can you tell when a man is well hung?When you can just barely slip your finger in between his neck and the noose.How do you get a man to stop biting his nails?Make him wear shoes.How many men does it take to screw in a light bulb?One. He just holds it up there and waits for the world to revolve around him.How many men does it take to screw in a light bulb?Three. One to screw in the bulb and two to listen to him brag about the screwing part.How many men does it take to tile a bathroom?Two - if you slice them very thinly.Why can''t men get mad cow disease?Because they are pigs.What do you call a handcuffed man?Trustworthy.What does it mean when a man is in your bed gasping for breath and calling your name? You didn''t hold the pillow down long enough.How does a man show he''s planning for the future?He buys an extra case of beer.What do you call the useless piece of skin on a penis?The man.Why do men have a hole in their penis? So their brains can get some oxygen now and then.Why do men name their penises? Because they don''t like the idea of having a stranger make 90 percent of their decisions.Why does it take 100 million sperm to fertilize an egg?Because not one will stop and ask for directions.What makes a man think about a dinner by candlelight?A power failure.What should you give a man who has everything?A woman to show him how to work it.What has eight arms and an IQ of 60?Four guys watching a football game.What''s the best way to force a man to do sit?ups?Put the remote control between his toes.What''s a man''s idea of honesty in a relationship?Telling you his real name.What''s the difference between Big Foot and intelligent man?Big Foot has been spotted several times.Why did God create man before woman?He didn''t want any advice.Why did God create man before woman?Because you need a rough draft before creating your masterpiece.Why do doctors slap babies'' bums right after they''re born?To knock the penises off the smart ones.Why do little boys whine?Because they''re practicing to be men.

column1:
French-Bashing to Be Olympic Sport

\n

2/18/2003 - William Grim

\n

Geneva - At its annual meeting
column2:
the International Olympic Committee has decided to add French-Bashing to its roster of medal sports in both the Summer and Winter Games.

\n

"We thought it was about time
column3: said Jesus de Manuel y Corazon, Chairman of the IOC and the 1968 European French-Bashing Champion. Everbody hates those little lying
column4: cowardly
column5: collaborating
column6: garlic-eating
column7: never-bathing
column8: nose-picking French bastards. It''s time that French-Bashing was recognized for the truly international sport that it is
column9: one
column10: I might add
column11:
that is much more popular than soccer."

\n

In Summer French-Bashing the Basher runs along a 25 meter path to the Bashee (or the Pierre as it is sometimes called)
column12: a typical French sissy picked randomly from the Paris phone book. The first phase of the Bash is called Verbal Bashing in which the Basher has 20 seconds to hurl insults at the Bashee until he starts to cry like a little girl. Then comes the second phase
column13: or Physical Bashing in which the Basher whacks the Bashee over the head with a baseball bat. Play continues until the Bashee surrenders
column14: which in most cases happens immediately because the Bashee is a scairdy-cat Frog after all. Scoring is similar to that in diving in which points are awarded on style
column15:
technique and degree of

difficulty.

Winter French-Bashing resembles its Summer counterpart with the exception that the Basher approaches the Bashee on skis.

Sports writers are predicting French-Bashing to be the biggest spectator sport of all time
column16:
with the potential of billions of dollars in TV revenues and hundreds of millions of dollars in endorsement contracts for world-class bashers.

\n

The United States and Great Britain are already being touted as gold medal contenders for the 2006 Games
column17: with Canada (the only country to produce both world-class bashers and bashees) a very serious challenger.

column1: Question: If you could live forever
column2:
would you and why?

\n

Answer: "I would not live forever
column3: because we should not live forever
column4: because if we were supposed to live forever
column5: then we would live forever
column6: but we cannot live forever
column7:
which is why I would not live forever."
--Miss Alabama in the 1994 Miss USA contest

\n

"Whenever I watch TV and see those poor starving kids all over the world
column8:
I can''t help but cry. I mean I''d love to be skinny like that but not with
all those flies and death and stuff."
--Mariah Carey

\n

"Researchers have discovered that chocolate produces some of the same
reactions in the brain as marijuana. The researchers also discovered other
similarities between the two
column9:
but can''t remember what they are."
--Matt Lauer on NBC''s Today show
column10:
August 22

\n

"I haven''t committed a crime. What I did was fail to comply with the law."
--David Dinkins
column11: New York City Mayor
column12:
answering accusations that he failed
to pay his taxes.

\n

"Smoking kills. If you''re killed
column13:
you''ve lost a very important part of
your life."
--Brooke Shields
column14:
during an interview to become spokesperson for a federal
anti-smoking campaign

\n

"I''ve never had major knee surgery on any other part of my body."
--Winston Bennett
column15:
University of Kentucky basketball forward

\n

"Outside of the killings
column16:
Washington has one of the lowest crime rates in
the country."
--Mayor Marion Barry
column17: Washington
column18:
D.C.

\n

"We''re going to turn this team around 360 degrees."
--Jason Kidd
column19:
upon his drafting to the Dallas Mavericks

\n

"I''m not going to have some reporters pawing through our papers. We are
the president."
--Hillary Clinton commenting on the release of subpoenaed documents

\n

"China is a big country
column20:
inhabited by many Chinese."
--Former French President Charles De Gaulle

\n

"That lowdown scoundrel deserves to be kicked to death by a jackass
column21:
and
I''m just the one to do it."
--A congressional candidate in Texas

\n

"When I have been asked during these last weeks who caused the riots and
the killing in L.A.
column22:
my answer has been direct and simple: Who is to blame
for the riots? The rioters are to blame. Who is to blame for the killings?
The killers are to blame."
--Former U.S. Vice-President Dan Quayle on the complex social issues
behind the Los Angeles Riots

"Half this game is ninety percent mental."
--Philadelphia Phillies manager Danny Ozark

"It isn''t pollution that''s harming the environment. It''s the impurities in
our air and water that are doing it."
--Former U.S. Vice-President Dan Quayle

"Without censorship
column23:
things can get terribly confused in the public mind."
--General William Westmoreland

\n

"What a waste it is to lose one''s mind. Or not to have a mind is being
very wasteful. How true that is."
--Former U.S. Vice-President Dan Quayle at a fundraising event for the
United Negro College Fund. He was attempting to quote the line "a mind is
a terrible thing to waste"

\n

"If you let that sort of thing go on
column24:
your bread and butter will be cut
right out from under your feet."
--Former British foreign minister Ernest Bevin

\n

"I love California. I practically grew up in Phoenix."
--Former U.S. Vice-President Dan Quayle

\n

(6/16/98) And just the other day
column25:
our boy Dan Quayle was quoted as saying
that the Republicans would definitely nominate someone this time who would
beat Bill Clinton. Of course the 22nd amendment precludes Bill from running
again...
