column1:
London made its pitch to host the 2012 Olympic Games last week.

England has an unfair advantage when it comes to bribing IOC members.

Hookers are nice and cash is sweet but a dukedom is something your family will have for a thousand years.

-Argus Hamilton
Situations you may find yourself in
column2:
and the orgasms you may encounter...

Sex in a boat - oar-gasms.

Sex with a nerd - dork-gasms.

Sex at the entrance to your house - door-gasms.

Sex on carpet or linoleum - floor-gasms.

Sex at the supermarket - store-gasms.

Sex at a Steven King Movie - horror-gasms.

Sex with a prostitute - whore-gasms.

Sex with an accountant - bore-gasms.

Sex while sleeping - snore-gasms.

Sex with ''Arthur'' - Dudley Moore-gasms.

Sex with cartoon donkeys - Eyeore-gasms.

Sex while broke - poor-gasms.

Sex with a lion - roar-gasms.

Sex for hours and hours on end - sore-gasms.

Sex on a golf course - fore-gasms.

Sex with a nymphomaniac (or Ritzi) - more-gasms.

Sex in a gold mine - ore-gasms.

Sex with a dermatologist - pore-gasms.

Sex with a politician - Al Gore-gasms.

Sex with Chocolate
column3: marshmallows
column4:
and graham crackers - s''more-gasms.

Sex with a bullfighter - toreador-gasms.

Sex with a masked man carrying a sword - zorro-gasms.

Sex on the beach - shore-gasms.

Sex at an all-you-can-eat buffet - smorgasbord-gasms.

Sex on a cruise ship deck - shuffleboard-gasms.

Sex in asia - Singapore-gasms.

Sex among the wonders of nature - outdoor-gasms.

Sex in the vicinity of a garbage can - odor-gasms.

Sex on the way to the train - ''All Aboard''-gasms.

Sex that wasn''t very satisfying - ''There''s the door''-gasms.

Sex in an adult theater - hard-core-gasms.

Sex with someone who''s not paying attention - ignore-gasms.

Sex with a competitive partner - score-gasms.

Sex while flying - soar-gasms.

Sex with a beloved partner - adore-gasms.

Sex with a meat-eater - carnivore-gasms.

Sex with a person who''s got a really bad hairdo - pompadore-gasms.

Sex with someone who''s got bad taste in clothes - velour-gasms.

Sex while travelling - tour-gasms.

Sex with a big dog - labrador-gasms.

Sex with Beavis and Butthead - ''GonnaScore''-gasms.

Sex on stairs at the mall - escalator-gasms.

Sex with three of your friends - four-gasms.

Sex with a norse God - Thor-gasms.

Sex when resistance is futile - Borg-gasms.

column1:
On their wedding night the new couple are just about to do the deed when the wife tells her new husband that she has a confession.
"I lied when I told you I was a virgin. I have been with one other man" she tells her new hubby.

The new husband asks if it was anyone he knows?.
The wife answers ...well maybe!

Husband asks who it was.
The wife answers - it was Tiger Woods.

Since the only other person his new bride every slept with was the famous Tiger Woods
column2: he''s not at all upset and they get down to it and do the honeymoon "thing". When finished
column3:
the husband gets out of bed and reaches for the telephone.

\n

"What are you doing?" asked his bride.
"I''m calling for room service. After all that work I''m hungry!"

\n

The wife says
column4:
"Tiger wouldn''t do that."
"Really! Just what would TIGER do?" says the husband.

\n

Well we would do it again!

\n

Ok says the husband and jumps into the bed.
This same thing happens two more times
column5:
after which the guy is pretty tired.

\n

So he drags himself out of bed and gets to the telephone.
The wife says..you''re not calling room service are you!!!!
"NO
column6:
says the exhausted hubby"!
"Well who are you calling then
column7:
she asks."

\n

I''m calling Tiger Woods...
I want to see what par is for this hole!

column1:
A guy walks into a bar with his dog. They both go up to the barstool and sit down. The owner orders two beers.

\n

The bartendar just frowns and says
column2: "Look buddy
column3:
we can''t have any dogs sitting up at the bar."

\n

The owner retorts
column4:
"But this is no ordinary dog." The bartendar doesn''t budge from his stance and tells the guy to leave.

\n

The owner protests
column5: "Look
column6:
this is no ordinary dog. This is a talking dog."

\n

The bartendar says
column7:
"Yeah right buddy.
Okay
column8:
why don''t you and your talking dog leave the bar?"

\n

The owner says
column9: "Okay
column10: I''ll tell you what. I''ll go into the bathroom and take a leak. You can talk to my dog while I go. If you still want us to leave when I get back
column11:
we will."

\n

So the owner leaves. And the dog and the bartendar start talking it up like they are long lost friends. The bartendar starts to really like this dog. There talking about sports and beer and women.

\n

So the bartendar comes up with an idea. He turns to the dog and says
column12: "Look
column13:
I have a friend who owns the bar across the street. If I give you $20 will you go into the bar and order a beer from him?"
The dog says
column14: "No problem"
column15:
and gets up and leaves.

\n

The owner comes back and ask where his dog is. The bartenday explains about the joke. So the owner leaves to get his dog.

\n

Right out of the bar
column16: the owner sees his dog humping another lady dog. And the owner says
column17: "Hey
column18:
get off of her. Why have I never seen you doing this before?"
To which the dog replies
column19: "Because I have never had $20 before."

column1: With Viagra such a hit
column2:
Pfizer is bringing forth a whole line of drugs
oriented towards improving the
performance of men in today''s society.
DIRECTRA - A dose of this drug given to men before leaving on car trips caused
72 percent of them to stop and ask for directions when they got lost
column3:
compared
to a control group where only 0.2 percent asked for directions.
PROJECTRA - Men given this experimental new drug were far more likely to
actually finish a household repair
project before starting a new one.
CHILDAGRA - Men taking this drug reported a sudden
column4:
overwhelming urge to
perform more child-care tasks-especially cleaning up spills and little
accidents.
COMPLIMENTRA - In clinical trials
column5:
82 percent of middle-aged men administered
this drug noticed that their wives had a new hairstyle. Currently being tested
to see if its effects extend to noticing new clothing.
BUYAGRA - Married and otherwise attached men reported a
sudden urge to buy their sweeties expensive jewelry and gifts after taking
this drug for only two days. Still to be seen:
whether the drug can be continued for a period longer thanyour favorites
store''s return limit.
NEGA-VIAGRA - Has the exact opposite effect of Viagra.
Currently undergoing clinical trials on sitting U.S.
presidents.
NEGA-SPORTAGRA - This drug had the strange effect of making men want to turn
off televised sports and actually converse with other family members.
CAPAGRA - Caused test subjects to become
uncharacteristically fastidious about lowering toilet seats and replacing
toothpaste caps. Subjects on higher doses were seen dusting furniture.
PRYAGRA - About to fail its clinical trial
column6:
this drug gave men in the test
group an irresistible urge to dig into the personal affairs of other people.
Note: Apparent over-dose turned three test subjects into special prosecutors.
LIAGRA - This drug causes men to be less than truthful when they are asked
about their sexual affairs. Will be available in Regular
column7:
Grand Jury and
Presidential Strength versions.

column1: ''Resumania'' is a term coined by Mr. Robert Half
column2: founder of RHI Consulting''s parent company
column3: to describe the unintentional bloopers that often appear on job candidates'' resumes
column4:
job applications and cover letters. Here''s some examples:

\n

''I perform my job with effortless efficiency
column5: effectiveness
column6: efficacy
column7: and expertise.'' (And an eye on the ''e'' section of the dictionary
column8:
evidently.)

\n

''Insufficient writing skills
column9: thought processes have slowed down some. If I am not one of the best
column10:
I will look for another opportunity.''(No problem ...)

\n

''Seek challenges that test my mind and body
column11:
since the two are usually inseparable. ''(Glad to hear it.)

''I am very detail-oreinted. ''(With the possible exception of spelling)

''I can play well with others.'' (We''ll be sure to tell your mommy.)

''Married
column12:
eight children. Prefer frequent travel.'' (A new twist on work-family balance.)

''Objection: To utilize my skills in sales.'' (Have you considered law school?)

''My salary requirement is $34 per year.'' (They say money isn''t everything.)

''Served as assistant sore manager.'' (Ouch.)

Good afternoon. I''m Al Gore
column2:
and I''d like to tell you about myself.
I know a lot about hardship
column3:
because I came into this world as a poor black
child in a tiny town in the backwoods of Tennessee. I was born in a log cabin
that I built with my own hands. I taught myself to read by candlelight and
helped support my 16 brothers and sisters by working summers as a deck hand on a
Mississippi River steamboat.
My mother taught me the value of education
column4:
so every day; I would walk 5 miles
to a one-room schoolhouse. I was a mischievous
column5: fun-loving scamp
column6:
thought I
never dreamed that one-day
column7:
my youthful escapades would serve as the inspiration
for "Huckleberry Finn."
Back then
column8: black folks in the south were second-class citizens. One day
column9:
a
traveling minister came through town
column10:
and I asked him if anyone was ever going
to do something to guarantee civil rights for all Americans. Well
column11:
I guess I
made an impression. You see
column12: the minister''s name was Martin Luther King
column13:
Jr.
My father was a United States Senator. He once perched me on his knee and
said
column14: "Son
column15: if you work hard and listen to your mama
column16:
someday you can live in a
hotel in Washington
column17: D.C.
column18:
and go to an exclusive prep school."
But life of privilege was not for me. After getting my high school diploma
column19:
I
took a job in a hot
column20:
dirty textile mill. I was so appalled at the treatment of
the workers there that I organized a union. Later
column21:
that experience inspired a
movie - which is why
column22: to this day
column23:
my close friends at the AFL-CIO call me
"Norma Rae."
When word got out what an 18 year old factory worker had done
column24:
Harvard called
and offered me a scholarship. I captained the hockey team to four consecutive
national championships
column25:
but I also played football and was good enough to win
the Heisman Trophy.
During my college years
column26:
I lived in a housing project and moonlighted playing
lead guitar for a little rock band. You may have heard of it-the Rolling
Stones.
But there was a war going on
column27:
and I felt I had to serve my country. So
I enlisted in the U. S. Army and went to Vietnam. I was deeply opposed to the
war
column28:
but I did my duty as a soldier and came back home with the Medal of Honor
and the Croix de Guerre.
When I got back
column29:
I took a long journey across this great land of ours. I''ve
crossed the deserts bare
column30: man
column31: I''ve breathed the mountain air
column32: man
column33:
I''ve
traveled
column34: I''ve done my share
column35: man
column36:
I''ve been everywhere. And the people I met at
truck stops and campgrounds and homeless shelters on that journey all said the
same thing: "Al
column37:
we need you in Washington."
I knew they were right
column38:
but first I had to take care of some other
business---building the World Trade Center
column39: founding the Audubon Society
column40:
doing
the clinical research that proved smoking caused cancer
column41:
and coming up with the
recipe for Mrs. Field''s chocolate chip cookies.
Finally
column42:
I deferred to the demands of the people of Tennessee and allowed them
to elect me to the House of Representatives and the Senate
column43:
where I established
the US Strategic Oil Reserve. And then one winter day nearly nine years ago
column44:
for
no particular reason
column45:
I answered the call of the people once again and took the
oath of office as Vice President of the United States.
Since then
column46:
I''ve been part of the most successful administration in American
history. And
column47: in my spare time
column48:
I invented the Internet. Many times Bill Clinton
has been pondering some grave decision and has asked me what to do. And when I
would give him my thoughts
column49: he would invariable say
column50:
"Of course. That''s
brilliant. Why didn''t I think of that?"
During the darkest days of the impeachment battle
column51:
the president told me he
only wished he had listened when I told him to stay away form that dark-haired
intern. So after I decided to run for president
column52:
I sat down with him and asked
if he had any suggestions about how to conduct my campaign. And Bill Clinton
gave me a few simple words of advice-words I''ll never forget.
He looked me in the eye and he said
column53: "Al
column54: just tell the truth
column55:
it''s always
worked for me."

column1:
A husband and wife are traveling by car from Key West to Boston.
After almost twenty-four hours on the road
column2:
they''re too tired to
continue
column3:
and they decide to stop for a rest. They stop at a
nice hotel and take a room
column4:
but they only plan to sleep for four
hours and then get back on the road. When they check out four
hours later
column5:
the desk clerk hands them a bill for $350.

\n

The man explodes and demands to know why the charge is so
high. He tells the clerk although it''s a nice hotel
column6:
the rooms
certainly aren''t worth $350. When the clerk tells him $350 is
the standard rate
column7:
the man insists on speaking to the manager.

\n

The manager appears
column8: listens to the man
column9:
and then explains that
the hotel has an Olympic sized pool and a huge conference
center that were available for the husband and wife to use.

\n

"But we didn''t use them." the man complains. "Well
column10:
they are
here
column11:
and you could have." explains the manager.

\n

He goes on to explain they could have taken in one of the shows
for which the hotel is famous. "The best entertainers from New
York
column12:
Hollywood and Las Vegas perform here." the manager says.
"But we didn''t go to any of those shows." complains the man
again.

\n

"Well
column13: we have them
column14:
and you could have." the manager replies.
No matter what facility the manager mentions
column15: the man replies
column16:
"But we didn''t use it!"

\n

The manager is unmoved
column17:
and eventually the man gives up and
agrees to pay. He writes a check and gives it to the manager.
The mnager is surprised when he looks at the check. "But sir
column18:
he says, this check is only made out for $100."

\n

"That''s right
column19:
says the man. I charged you $250 for sleeping
with my wife."

\n

"But I didn''t!" exclaims the mnager.

\n

"Well
column20: the man replies, she was here
column21: and you could have."

column1:
A man traveling down a country road was forced to stop before a giant puddle
covering the entire road. Looking to the side of the road
column2:
the man noticed a
farmer leaning on a fence. "Think it''s safe to cross?" the man asked.

\n

"I reckon so
column3:
replied the farmer.

\n

The puddle immediately swallowed the car as the man drove in. In fact, it was
so deep that he had to roll his window down to swim out of his car back to the
surface. As his head broke the surface, the man said to the farmer, I thought
you said I could safely drive through this puddle!"

\n

"Well
column4: shoot!" said the farmer
column5:
scratching his head. "It only come up
chest-high on my ducks!"

\n

One morning a boy got up and was leaving the house with a hand full of chicken
wire. His father said
column6: ''Son
column7: where are you going?'' The son replied
column8:
''I''m going
to catch me some chickens.'' The father said
column9: ''Son
column10:
you can''t catch chickens with
chicken wire.'' But the son insisted that he knew what he was doing.

\n

Later on that day
column11:
the son came home with two chickens in his hand. The father
thought
column12: ''I guess he knows what he''s doing.'' The next morning
column13:
the son got up
and was leaving the house with some duck tape. The father said
column14: ''Son
column15:
where are
you going?'' The son replied
column16: ''I''m going to catch some ducks.'' The father yelled
column17:
''You can''t catch ducks with duck tape!'' The son insisted that he knew what he
was doing.

\n

Awhile later
column18:
the son came home with two ducks under each arm. The father
thought
column19: ''Shoot
column20:
I guess he does know what he''s doing!'' The next morning the son
got up and was leaving the house with a hand full of puss willows. The father
said
column21: ''Hold up
column22: son
column23: let me put on my shoes!''

Today the postman delivered four calling birds. Now really

column12:
but don''t you think enough is enough. You are

Affectionately
column14:
1972

\n

Dearest John:

\n

What a surprise. Today the postman delivered five golden rings
column15: one for every finger. You''re just impossible

but I love it.
Frankly
column17:
all those birds squawking were beginning to get on my
nerves.

\n

All my love
column19:
1972

Dear John:

When I opened the door today there were actually six geese
laying on my front steps. So you''re back to the birds again huh?
These geese are huge. Where will I ever keep them? The neighbors
are complaining and I can''t sleep through the racket. Please
stop.

Cordially
column21:
1972

John:

What''s with you and those freaking birds?? Seven swans a
swimming. What kind of damn joke is this? There''s bird poop all
over the house and they never stop the racket. I can''t sleep at
night and I''m a nervous wreck. It''s not funny. So stop those
freaking birds.

Sincerely
column23:
1972

\n

I think I prefer the birds. What the hell am I going to do with

column24:
but they had to bring their damn cows. There is

You''ll get yours !
Agnes

column1:
1. Garbage bags do not make good parachutes.

\n

2. A 3-year-old is louder than 200 adults in a crowded restaurant.

\n

3. If you spray hair spray on dust bunnies and run over them with roller blades
column2:
they can ignite.

\n

4. If you hook a dog leash over a ceiling fan
column3:
the motor is not strong enough to rotate a 42-pound boy wearing Batman underwear and a superman cape.

\n

5. When using the ceiling fan as a baseball bat
column4:
you have to throw the ball up a few times before you get a hit.

\n

6. The glass in windows - even double pane - cannot stop a baseball hit by a ceiling fan.

\n

7. When you hear the toilet flush and the words "Uh-oh
column5:
it''s already too late.

8. Brake fluid mixed with Clorox makes smoke, and lots of it.

9. A young child can start a fire with a flint rock even though a 36-year-old man says they can only do it in the movies. A magnifying glass can start a fire even on an overcast day.

10. Small Legos will successfully pass through the digestive tract of a six-year-old.

11. Play-Doh" and "microwave" should never be used in the same sentence.

12. Super glue is permanent.

13. No matter how much Jell-O you put in a swimming pool
column6:
you still can''t walk on water.

14. VCRs will not spontaneously eject PB&J sandwiches

15. A king size waterbed holds enough water to fill a 2000 sq. foot house 4 inches deep.

16. Marbles in gas tanks make lots of noise in a moving car.

17. You probably do not want to know what that odor is.

18. Always look in the oven before you turn it on. Plastic toys do not taste or smell better baked.

19. The spin cycle on the washing machine does make earthworms squirm.

20. Making a cat dizzy will cause it to spit up twice its body weight.

column1:
The other day I went to the local religious book store where I saw a "HONK IF
YOU LOVE JESUS" bumper sticker. I bought it and put it on my back bumper and I''m
glad I did.

What an uplifting experience followed. That bumper sticker really worked!!

I found lots of people who loved Jesus.

I was stopped at the light at a busy intersection
column2:
just lost in thought about
the Lord. Why
column3:
the guy behind me started to honk like crazy.

\n

He must REALLY love Jesus because pretty soon he leaned out of his window and
yelled "JESUS CHRIST!" as loud as he could.

\n

It was like a football game with him shouting
column4:
"GO!...JESUS CHRIST!...GO!"
Everyone else started honking too
column5:
so I leaned out the window and smiled and
waved to all those loving people.

There must have been a guy from Florida back there because I heard him yell
something about a sunny beach and saw him waving with only his middle finger.

I asked my kids what he meant by that and they laughed and said it was the
Hawaiian good luck sign. So I leaned out of the window and gave him the good
luck sign back.

A couple of people were so caught up in the joy of the moment that they got
out of their cars and started running towards me!

I bet they wanted to pray
column6:
but just then I noticed that the light had changed
so I stepped on the gas.

It''s a good thing that I did because I was the only driver to get across the
intersection.

I looked back and everyone was still standing there so I leaned way out the
window and held up the Hawaiian good luck sign as I drove away.

Praise the Lord for such wonderful people!

column1:
A golf pro was helping this attractive young woman with her swing when his zipper got caught in the rhinestones on the back of her skirt.

Needless to say this was embarrassing to both of them since their relationship had been purely platonic up to that point anyway.

They decided to walk together in this lock-step back to the clubhouse where certainly a pair of needle-nosed pliers would fix the problem.

Just as they turned the corner to the clubhouse a German Shepherd ran up and threw a bucket of water on them.

Submitted by Curtis
Edited by Yisman

column1:
I.
Know that although the cat has the advantage of quickness and lack of concern
for human life
column2:
you have the advantage of strength. Capitalize on that advantage
by selecting the battlefield. Don''t try to bathe him in an open area where he
can force you to chase him. Pick a very small bathroom. If your bathroom is more
than four feet square
column3:
I recommend that you get in the tub with the cat and
close the sliding -glass doors as if you were about to take a shower. (A simple
shower curtain will not do. A berserk cat can shred a three-ply rubber shower
curtain quicker than a politician can shift positions.)
II.
Know that a cat has claws and will not hesitate to remove all the skin from
your body. Your advantage here is that you are smart and know how to dress to
protect yourself. I recommend canvas overalls tucked into high-top construction
boots
column4: a pair of steel-mesh gloves
column5: an army helmet
column6: a hockey face-mask
column7:
and a
long-sleeved flak jacket.

\n

III.
Use the element of surprise. Pick up your cat nonchalantly
column8:
as if to simply
carry him to his supper dish. (Cats will not usually notice your strange attire.
They have little or no interest in fashion as a rule.)

\n

IV.
. Once you are inside the bathroom
column9:
speed is essential to survival. In a
single liquid motion
column10: shut the bathroom door
column11: step into the tub enclosure
column12:
slide
the glass door shut
column13:
dip the cat in the water and squirt him with shampoo. You
have begun one of the wildest 45 seconds of your life.

\n

V.
Cats have no handles. Add the fact that he now has soapy fur
column14:
and the problem
is radically compounded. Do not expect to hold on to him for more than two or
three seconds at a time. When you have him
column15: however
column16:
you must remember to give
him another squirt of shampoo and rub like crazy. He''ll then spring free and
fall back into the water
column17:
thereby rinsing himself off. (The national record for
cats is three latherings
column18:
so don''t expect too much.)

\n

IV.
Next
column19:
the cat must be dried. Novice cat bathers always assume this part will
be the most difficult
column20:
for humans generally are worn out at this point and the
cat is just getting really determined. In fact
column21:
the drying is simple compared
with what you have just been through. That''s because by now the cat is
semi-permanently affixed to your right leg. You simply pop the drain plug with
your foot
column22: reach for your towel and wait. (Occasionally
column23: however
column24:
the cat will
end up clinging to the top of your army helmet. If this happens
column25:
the best thing
you can do is to shake him loose and to encourage him toward your leg.) After
all the water is drained from the tub
column26:
it is a simple matter to just reach down
and dry the cat. In a few days the cat will relax enough to be removed from your
leg. He will usually have nothing to say for about three weeks and will spend a
lot of time sitting with his back to you. He might even become psychoceramic and
develop the fixed stare of a plaster figurine. You will be tempted to assume he
is angry. This isn''t usually the case. As a rule he is simply plotting ways to
get through your defenses and injure you for life the next time you decide to
give him a bath. But at least now he smells a lot better

\n

column4: they decided the quickest way would be to do the breast stroke
column5:
so off they set.

One day later the redhead reached the French coast.

Having lost sight of the other two swimmers just off the English coast she decided that they couldn''t be far behind so sat on the beach looking out to sea waiting for the other two.

After a cold night of waiting
column6:
the brunette finally came into sight.

"What took you so long?" inquired the redhead.

"There were some strong currents out there! But I''m here now! Am I the last?" replied the brunette.

"No. Blondie is still out there somewhere." They decided to wait.

Day after day the two swimmers sat on the beach until on the 5th day Blondie came into view.
